original: 'di lta ste zhus pa dang / slar gsungs pa dang / rigs drug la gzigs pa dang / sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rim pa dang / byang chub kyi sems dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sgo nas dang / rang bzhin gyis shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i sgo nas dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhus pa dang / slar gsungs pa dang / rigs drug la gzigs pa dang / sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rim pa dang / byang chub kyi sems dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sgo nas dang / rang bzhin gyis shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i sgo nas dang /
translated: The six chapters are as follows: the request, the reply, the six families, the stages of manifest, complete enlightenment of the magical net, the chapter on the bodhicitta of glorious Vajrasattva, the chapter on the wisdom of the utterly pure basic space of phenomena by way of the great Vairocana,🔽the chapter on mirrorlike wisdom by way of Akṣobhya, the chapter on the wisdom of discernment by way of Amitābha, the chapter on the wisdom of equality by way of Ratnasaṃbhava, the chapter on the wisdom of accomplishment by way of Amoghasiddhi,

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas dang so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes snang ba mtha' yas kyi sgo nas dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sgo nas dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes don yod grub pa'i sgo nas dang /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas dang so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes snang ba mtha' yas kyi sgo nas dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sgo nas dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes don yod grub pa'i sgo nas dang /
translated: and the chapter on the wisdom of the basic space of phenomena by way of the five pristine wisdoms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sgo nas ye shes lnga la bstod pa dang / yon tan dang / sngags dgod pa dang / nye bar bsdu ba rnams te /🔽lus @28a * //

analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che //

analyzed: ces pa dang po nas brtsams te / sgra dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog //

original: ces pa dang po nas brtsams te //
analyzed: ces pa dang po nas brtsams te //

original: ye shes me lce 'od 'bar bar gsal //🔽zhes pa'i bar gyi tshigs bcad bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyis so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //🔽'dod pa'i don grub dam pa ste //

translated: praise from the perspective of the wisdom of individual investigation.

original: zhes pa dang po nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes pa dang po nas brtsams te /
translated: The twenty-two verses beginning with The supreme accomplishment of the desired aim,

original: nor bu chen po rin chen tog / ces pa'i bar gyi tshigs bcad nyi shu rtsa bzhis mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //🔽sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya ba //
analyzed: nor bu chen po rin chen tog / ces pa'i bar gyi tshigs bcad nyi shu rtsa bzhis mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o // sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya ba //
translated: The twenty-four verses beginning with “Great jewel, crest-jewel” are the praise from the perspective of the wisdom of equality.

original: zhes pa dang po nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes pa dang po nas brtsams te /
translated: The fifteen verses beginning with “The object of realization of all buddhas”

original: @28b 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog / ces pa'i bar gyi tshigs bcad bco lngas bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //🔽mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog khyod 'dud //
analyzed: @28b 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog / ces pa'i bar gyi tshigs bcad bco lngas bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o // mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog khyod 'dud //
translated: and ending with “Mañjuśrī, supreme one endowed with glory” are the praise from the perspective of the wisdom of accomplishing activities.

original: ces pa dang po nas brtsams te //🔽ye shes sku nyid khyod la 'dud //
analyzed: ces pa dang po nas brtsams te // ye shes sku nyid khyod la 'dud //
translated: The five verses beginning with “Bestower of the supreme, supreme vajra”

original: ces pa'i bar gyi tshigs bcad lngas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sgo nas ye shes lnga la bstod pa'o //🔽lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang 'di ni zhes pa dang po nas brtsams te //
analyzed: ces pa'i bar gyi tshigs bcad lngas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sgo nas ye shes lnga la bstod pa'o // lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang 'di ni zhes pa dang po nas brtsams te //
translated: and ending with “I bow to you, the wisdom body itself” are the praise of the five wisdoms from the perspective of the five tathāgatas.

original: chos kyi rgyal po thob po zhes pa'i bar gyis ni yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po thob po zhes pa'i bar gyis ni yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: The praise from the perspective of qualities begins with “Vajrapāṇi, Vajradhara” and ends with “You have attained the state of the Dharma king.”

original: aom sarba dharm'a zhes pa dang po nas brtsams te /
analyzed: aom sarba dharm'a zhes pa dang po nas brtsams te /
translated: The praise by way of mantra begins with Om sarva dharma and continues up to dharma dhatu jnana garbha ah.

original: dharma dh'a tu dzny'a na garbha a'a:zhes bya ba'i bar tshigs bcad gsum dang tshig rkang gnyis dang yi ge bzhis ni sngags kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //🔽de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: dharma dh'a tu dzny'a na garbha a'a:zhes bya ba'i bar tshigs bcad gsum dang tshig rkang gnyis dang yi ge bzhis ni sngags kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o // de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: This consists of three verses, two lines, and four syllables.

original: zhes pa dang po nas brtsams te //
analyzed: zhes pa dang po nas brtsams te //
translated: Then, beginning with Glorious Vajradhara,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyis bshad //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyis bshad //
translated: and continuing up to the perfect buddhas have explained,

original: ces pa'i bar gyi tshigs bcad lngas ni nye bar bsdus pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o ;
analyzed: ces pa'i bar gyi tshigs bcad lngas ni nye bar bsdus pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o ;
translated: there are five verses that praise by way of summary.

original: / de ltar de dag gcig tu bsdus nas tshigs su bcad pa brgya drug cu rtsa gnyis rnams dang / yon tan brgya lnga bcu'i gzhung gis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i don bsdus pa'o /
analyzed: / de ltar de dag gcig tu bsdus nas tshigs su bcad pa brgya drug cu rtsa gnyis rnams dang / yon tan brgya lnga bcu'i gzhung gis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i don bsdus pa'o /
translated: Thus, combining all of these, there are 162 verses and a text of 150 qualities that summarize the meaning of the Praise in Verse of the Praise to the Name of Manjushri, the wisdom being, the bhagavat, the wisdom body of all tathagatas.

original: // / 'dir tshig gi don la the tshom gyis thams cad la 'brel pa dang / brjod bya dang dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'i dbang gis rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams 'jug pas na mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di 'brel pa la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / 'dir tshig gi don la the tshom gyis thams cad la 'brel pa dang / brjod bya dang dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'i dbang gis rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams 'jug pas na mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di 'brel pa la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, since those who are engaged in the investigation of the meaning of the words are connected to everything, and since they are engaged in the investigation of the subject matter, the purpose, and the ultimate purpose, the correct description of the title should be stated in this Ornament of Realizations, in terms of its connection and so forth.

original: de ltar yang 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod bya ci stem bstan na de'i cho smyon pa'i tshig bzhin du ma 'brel pa dang / don med par yang dogs pa'i rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams nyan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod bya ci stem bstan na de'i cho smyon pa'i tshig bzhin du ma 'brel pa dang / don med par yang dogs pa'i rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams nyan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the connection and the subject matter of this text are not stated, those who are engaged in the investigation of the text will not listen to it, suspecting that it is unconnected and meaningless, like the words of a madman.

original: de'i phyir na 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod bya gdon mi za bar brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod bya gdon mi za bar brjod dgos so //
translated: Therefore, the connection and the subject matter of this text must be stated without a doubt.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' tshad mar byas te 'jug pa nyid yin pas de la brjod bya la sogs pa smos ci dgos te /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' tshad mar byas te 'jug pa nyid yin pas de la brjod bya la sogs pa smos ci dgos te /
translated: Those who have faith will engage in the study of this text by taking the word of the Transcendent Conqueror as authoritative. What need is there to state the subject matter and so forth to them?

original: ci'i phyir smos mi dgos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir smos mi dgos she na /
translated: Why is it unnecessary to state them?

original: de rnams kyi dad pa tsam gyis rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dad pa tsam gyis rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are engaged by mere faith in those.

original: de la 'dir brjod bya ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la 'dir brjod bya ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Here, the topic is nondual wisdom.

original: yon tan las kyang de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: yon tan las kyang de skad gsungs te /
translated: It is also called that because of its qualities.

original: ji skad gsungs pa /🔽chos gnyis @29a * //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa / chos gnyis @29a * //
translated: As it is said:

original: su med pa gzung ba'i don du mtshan gzung bar bstan to zhes so //
analyzed: su med pa gzung ba'i don du mtshan gzung bar bstan to zhes so //
translated: The nondual Dharma is taught to be the meaning of the name.

original: rjod byed ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rjod byed ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: The expression is the perfect expression of the name.

original: bklag pa ni brjod pa ste /🔽yang dag par brjod pa'i mtshan rnams ni yang dag par brjod pa ste //
analyzed: bklag pa ni brjod pa ste / yang dag par brjod pa'i mtshan rnams ni yang dag par brjod pa ste //
translated: Reading is expression.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: The names that are perfectly expressed are the perfect expression.

original: mtshan ni rnal 'byor dang / bya ba'i rgyud dang spyod pa'i rgyud dang / gsung rab mdo sde mtha' dag dang / chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba thams cad de /
analyzed: mtshan ni rnal 'byor dang / bya ba'i rgyud dang spyod pa'i rgyud dang / gsung rab mdo sde mtha' dag dang / chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba thams cad de /
translated: The name is all the yogas, action tantras, performance tantras, sutra collections of the scriptures, abhidharma, vinaya, mundane and supramundane, and all the moving and unmoving.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa ni gtso bo ma yin pas gnas pa ste dan dam par ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa ni gtso bo ma yin pas gnas pa ste dan dam par ma yin no //
translated: Since the recitation of their names is not the principal thing, it is not the main point.

original: kun rdzob ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni /
translated: The conventional is

original: kun nas srid rtses yongs bcad pa //
analyzed: kun nas srid rtses yongs bcad pa //
translated: completely cut off at the root of existence.

original: 'di dag thams cad ming tsam mo //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ming tsam mo //
translated: All of these are mere names.

original: zhes pa'i rigs pas so //🔽'di dag ni rjod byed dang brjod bya'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: zhes pa'i rigs pas so // 'di dag ni rjod byed dang brjod bya'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'o //
translated: These are the characteristics of the expression and the expressed, or the connection of the method and the method's result.

original: dgos pa yang gsang sngags kyi sgo nas spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa dang / de kho na nyid yid la byed pa gnyis kyis chos thams cad so sor rtogs pa lhur len pa rtog pa med pa'i shes rab kyis 'byed pa dang /
analyzed: dgos pa yang gsang sngags kyi sgo nas spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa dang / de kho na nyid yid la byed pa gnyis kyis chos thams cad so sor rtogs pa lhur len pa rtog pa med pa'i shes rab kyis 'byed pa dang /
translated: The purpose is that the bodhisattvas who practice by way of mantra are intent on individually discerning all phenomena by means of both interest and the attention on reality, and they are intent on discerning them with nonconceptual wisdom.

original: dad pas mngon du byed pas gnyis su med pa'i chos ye shes thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dad pas mngon du byed pas gnyis su med pa'i chos ye shes thob par byed pa'o //
translated: They attain the gnosis of nondual phenomena by actualizing them with faith.

original: de nas yang sgom pa mchog tu mthar phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang brnyes pa dgos pa'i dgos pa zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yang sgom pa mchog tu mthar phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i go 'phang brnyes pa dgos pa'i dgos pa zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the ultimate purpose is the attainment of the state of a Tathāgata, the perfection of supreme meditation.

original: da ni tshig gi don yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni tshig gi don yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the words should be explained.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: Then is stated from the perspective of the Vajra Holder.

original: de ni gsol ba 'debs pa nyid kyi skabs su bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gsol ba 'debs pa nyid kyi skabs su bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because the occasion of the supplication has arrived.

original: 'phags pa sgyu 'phrul dra ba khri drug stong pa rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi nang nas ting nge 'dzin dra ba'i le'u las bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa sgyu 'phrul dra ba khri drug stong pa rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi nang nas ting nge 'dzin dra ba'i le'u las bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas gsungs pa /
translated: From the chapter on the net of samādhis within the ten thousand six hundred thousand Mahāyoga Tantra of the Noble Illusory Net, it was spoken by the Blessed Śākyamuni.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis gsol ba 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis gsol ba 'debs pa yin no //
translated: The ultimate name of the Blessed Wisdom Being Mañjuśrī, which was spoken by the Blessed Vajradhara, is the supplication.

original: dbang po rtul po'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i don du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of guiding sentient beings of dull faculties.

original: yang na de nas zhes gsungs pa'i /
analyzed: yang na de nas zhes gsungs pa'i /
translated: Or else, “from that” is stated.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa'o //
translated: The word “from that” means immediately.

original: de nas rdo rje 'chang khro gnyer rim par ldan la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'chang khro gnyer rim par ldan la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu /
translated: Then Vajradhara, together with those having the sequence of frowns, etc.,

original: mgon po sangs rgyas @29b bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: mgon po sangs rgyas @29b bcom ldan 'das //
translated: the Lord, the Buddha, the Bhagavat,

original: de bzhin gshegs la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: having bowed to the Tathagata,

original: thal mo sbyar ba byas nas kyang //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba byas nas kyang //
translated: having joined the palms together,

original: spyan sngar 'dug ste 'di skad gsol //
analyzed: spyan sngar 'dug ste 'di skad gsol //
translated: sitting in front, said this:

original: zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyir na rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyir na rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is Vajradhara because he holds the vajra.

original: tshig 'dis ni phyogs bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'dis ni phyogs bshad pa'o //
translated: This verse explains the direction.

original: dpal ni lha mo'o //
analyzed: dpal ni lha mo'o //
translated: “Splendor” is a goddess.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni dpal ldan no //
translated: He who has that is “splendid.”

original: 'dis ni rgya che ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgya che ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: This teaches the greatness.

original: 'dis ci zhig ston par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci zhig ston par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What does this teach?

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It teaches that the Bhagavat Vajradhara is the embodiment of method and wisdom.

original: 'di nyid dpal bde mchog gi rgyud las gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid dpal bde mchog gi rgyud las gsungs pa ste /
translated: This very [topic] is taught in the Shriparamādya Tantra:

original: nam mkha' kun gyi skabs na dpal //
analyzed: nam mkha' kun gyi skabs na dpal //
translated: In the space of all, glorious,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: Vajrasattva, the Tathagata.

original: zhes so // sdug bsngal gyis 'dul ba ni gdul dka' ba ste /
analyzed: zhes so // sdug bsngal gyis 'dul ba ni gdul dka' ba ste /
translated: Those to be disciplined by suffering are difficult to discipline,

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as Mahesvara, etc.

original: de dag rnams kyis 'dul ba ni ston pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rnams kyis 'dul ba ni ston pa ste /
translated: The one who disciplines them is the teacher,

original: rdo rje 'dzin nyid kyis 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin nyid kyis 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he disciplines them by being Vajra Holder himself.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa de dag rnams kyi nang na dam pa nyid pas rdo rje 'dzin pa ni mchog go //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa de dag rnams kyi nang na dam pa nyid pas rdo rje 'dzin pa ni mchog go //
translated: Since he is the best of those, Mahesvara, etc., Vajra Holder is supreme.

original: 'jig rten gsum zhes pa ni sa 'og gi 'jig rten dang / sa bla'i 'jig rten dang / sa steng gi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum zhes pa ni sa 'og gi 'jig rten dang / sa bla'i 'jig rten dang / sa steng gi 'jig rten no //
translated: The three worlds are the underworld, the earth, and the sky.

original: de rnams las rgyal ba'i ngang tshul 'di la mnga' bas na 'jig rten gsum las rgyal lo //
analyzed: de rnams las rgyal ba'i ngang tshul 'di la mnga' bas na 'jig rten gsum las rgyal lo //
translated: Since he has the nature of conquering them, he is the conqueror of the three worlds.

original: yang na rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa gsum ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa gsum ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: Alternatively, the three worlds are the conqueror, the honey-maker, and the fulfiller of all aims.

original: de rnams las rgyal ba'i ngang tshul 'di la mnga' bas na 'jig rten gsum las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams las rgyal ba'i ngang tshul 'di la mnga' bas na 'jig rten gsum las rgyal ba'o //
translated: Since he is the one who possesses the nature of victory over those, he is the conqueror of the three worlds.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa de ni dpa' bo ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa de ni dpa' bo ste /
translated: For that very reason, that Blessed Vajra Holder is the hero,

original: gzhan gyi zil gyis mnan par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zil gyis mnan par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not to be overcome by others.

original: rdo rje dbang phyug ces pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje dbang phyug ces pa ni /
translated: The one called Vajreśvara

original: rdo rje ni rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: is the five-pronged vajra.

original: de'i dbang phyug ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang phyug ni gtso bo ste /
translated: His lord is the chief,

original: rdo rje dbang phyug ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbang phyug ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Vajreśvara is the Blessed Vajra Holder.

original: dpal de nyid 'dus pa las gsang ba lnga brjod de /
analyzed: dpal de nyid 'dus pa las gsang ba lnga brjod de /
translated: In the Guhyasamaja, the five secrets are stated in the Shri Paramādya:🔽“Whatever is the nature of sentient beings,

original: ji lta ji ltar 'dul 'gyur ba /🔽sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin las //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar 'dul 'gyur ba / sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin las //
translated: by which they are to be disciplined,

original: de lta de ltar sems can don //
analyzed: de lta de ltar sems can don //
translated: by that very thing the welfare of sentient beings

original: 'dod chags la sogs gtsang bas bya //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs gtsang bas bya //
translated: is accomplished through desire and so forth.

original: sems can kun la phan don du //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan don du //
translated: For the sake of benefiting all sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas bstan pa'i rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan pa'i rgyu yi phyir //
translated: and for the sake of the cause of the Buddha’s teaching,

original: sems can thams cad bsad na yang //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsad na yang //
translated: even if all sentient beings are killed,

original: de ni sdig gis mi gos so //
analyzed: de ni sdig gis mi gos so //
translated: he is not tainted by that sin.”

original: sems can kun la phan don du //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan don du //
translated: For the sake of benefiting all sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas sku dang sbyor ba las //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku dang sbyor ba las //
translated: from the union with the Buddha’s body,

original: gzhan gyi nor rnams 'phrog na yang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor rnams 'phrog na yang /
translated: even if one steals the wealth of others,

original: @30a * // de ni sdig gis mi gos so //
analyzed: @30a * // de ni sdig gis mi gos so //
translated: one is not tainted by that sin.

original: 'dod chags lta bu'i bde ba med //
analyzed: 'dod chags lta bu'i bde ba med //
translated: There is no bliss like that of passion,

original: de ni rgyal ba rnams la 'bul //
analyzed: de ni rgyal ba rnams la 'bul //
translated: which is offered to the Victors.

original: sems can don du gzhan bud med //
analyzed: sems can don du gzhan bud med //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings,

original: bsten pas bsod nams thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsten pas bsod nams thob par 'gyur //
translated: by relying on another’s wife, one attains merit.

original: sems can kun la phan don du //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan don du //
translated: For the sake of benefiting all sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas bstan pa rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan pa rgyu yin phyir //
translated: the cause is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: las rnams thams cad byas pa yis //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad byas pa yis //
translated: By performing all the actions,

original: bsod nams rnam pa mang po brnyes //
analyzed: bsod nams rnam pa mang po brnyes //
translated: one attains many kinds of merit.

original: zhes so // gsang ba lnga po de dag rnams kyi rgyal po yin pas gsang ba'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: zhes so // gsang ba lnga po de dag rnams kyi rgyal po yin pas gsang ba'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Since those five secrets are kings, they are the kings of secrets.

original: yang na gsang ba pa las rgyal ba'i phyir gsang ba'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: yang na gsang ba pa las rgyal ba'i phyir gsang ba'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Alternatively, because they conquer the secret ones, they are the kings of secrets.

original: thal mo sbyar ba byas nas ni /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba byas nas ni /
translated: Having joined the palms,

original: spyan sngar 'dug ste 'di skad gsol //
analyzed: spyan sngar 'dug ste 'di skad gsol //
translated: sitting in front, one should say this.

original: zhes pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i 'brel tshig kun la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i 'brel tshig kun la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is the connecting phrase that should be applied to all the following passages.

original: padma dkar po zhes pa ni dkar po'i padma'o //
analyzed: padma dkar po zhes pa ni dkar po'i padma'o //
translated: The white lotus is a white lotus.

original: rgyas pa ni kha bye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni kha bye ba'o //
translated: Bloomed is opened.

original: spyan ni mig go //
analyzed: spyan ni mig go //
translated: Eye is eye.

original: 'di'i tshig sbyar ba ni padma dkar po yang de yin la rgyas pa yang de yin pas padma dkar po rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i tshig sbyar ba ni padma dkar po yang de yin la rgyas pa yang de yin pas padma dkar po rgyas pa'o //
translated: The expression is: it is a white lotus and it is bloomed, thus it is a bloomed white lotus.

original: de 'dra ba'i spyan dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i spyan dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: He who has such eyes is so described.

original: padma rab tu rgyas pa'i zhal //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: padma rab tu rgyas pa'i zhal // zhes pa ni /
translated: His face is like a fully bloomed lotus.

original: padma ni padma nyid do //
analyzed: padma ni padma nyid do //
translated: Lotus is a lotus.

original: legs par kha bye ba ni rab tu rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: legs par kha bye ba ni rab tu rgyas pa'o //
translated: Fully bloomed is fully opened.

original: zhal ni bzhin no //
analyzed: zhal ni bzhin no //
translated: Face is countenance.

original: padma rab tu rgyas pa dang 'dra ba'i zhal dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: padma rab tu rgyas pa dang 'dra ba'i zhal dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: He who has a face like a fully bloomed lotus is so described.

original: rdo rje'i dbus nas lag pas bzung nas yang dang yang du rdo rje gyen du bsgyur nas gzung ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbus nas lag pas bzung nas yang dang yang du rdo rje gyen du bsgyur nas gzung ba ni /
translated: Holding the vajra with his hand from the middle, he repeatedly raises the vajra and holds it.

original: rang gi lag gis rdo rje mchog //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis rdo rje mchog //
translated: With his own hand he throws up the supreme vajra.

original: yang dang yang du gsor byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du gsor byed pa'o //
translated: Again and again he throws it up.

original: 'di skad gsol to zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di skad gsol to zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected with the statement, “He said this.”🔽🔽

original: dpal phyag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: dpal phyag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i rgyud las /
translated: In the glorious Vajrapāṇi empowerment tantra,

original: dpal rdo rje 'chang gi rjes su spyod pa khro gnyer rim par ldan pa la sogs pa khro bo'i tshogs lnga brjod do //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje 'chang gi rjes su spyod pa khro gnyer rim par ldan pa la sogs pa khro bo'i tshogs lnga brjod do //
translated: the five wrathful hosts beginning with the one who practices after the glorious Vajradhara, who is endowed with a frown, are mentioned.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas phyag 'tshal nas 'di skad gsol zhes pa dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas phyag 'tshal nas 'di skad gsol zhes pa dang 'brel lo //
translated: Having bowed to the Blessed One, Vajradhara, together with those, he said this. This is connected with “he said this.🔽”

original: khro bo'i tshigs de rnams kyang don mtha' yas pas de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: khro bo'i tshigs de rnams kyang don mtha' yas pas de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Since those wrathful ones also have infinite meanings, therefore it is said:

original: lag na rdor je mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: lag na rdor je mtha' yas pa //
translated: “Vajrapāṇi is infinite.🔽”

original: zhes so // rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhin du de rnams kyang gdul mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: zhes so // rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhin du de rnams kyang gdul mtha' yas pa //
translated: Like Vajradhara, they also tame the infinite.

original: zhes so // rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhin du de rnams kyang gdul dka' ba 'dul pas de'i phyir gsungs pa //
analyzed: zhes so // rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhin du de rnams kyang gdul dka' ba 'dul pas de'i phyir gsungs pa //
translated: Since they also tame the difficult to tame, therefore it is said:🔽“The tamer of the difficult to tame.

original: gdul dka' 'dul ba po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gdul dka' 'dul ba po zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is the one who tames the difficult to tame.🔽

original: de nyid kyi phyir dpa' bo ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dpa' bo ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is a hero.

original: de de rnams kyis zil gyis mnan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de rnams kyis zil gyis mnan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those cannot overpower him.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa dpa' bo zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa dpa' bo zhes so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the hero.”

original: nyams ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: nyams ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the experience?

original: dpa' bo tshul lo //
analyzed: dpa' bo tshul lo //
translated: The hero’s way.

original: gzugs ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the form?

original: 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs so //
translated: The form is terrifying.

original: de nyid kyi phyir @30b gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir @30b gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said,

original: 'jigs su rung ba'i dpa' byang can //🔽zhes sos // rdo rje rtse mo rab 'phro ba //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba'i dpa' byang can // zhes sos // rdo rje rtse mo rab 'phro ba //
translated: “The terrifying hero.”🔽The vajra peak is fully extended.

original: zhes pa ni rab tu 'phro ba'i rdo rje'i rtse mo ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rab tu 'phro ba'i rdo rje'i rtse mo ste /
translated: The vajra peak is fully extended.

original: thog ma'i cha dang gang ldan pa de ni /
analyzed: thog ma'i cha dang gang ldan pa de ni /
translated: He who possesses the beginning part is

original: rdo rje rtse mor ba 'phro ba //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mor ba 'phro ba //
translated: the one with the extended vajra peak.

original: zhes so // gsor byed pa zhes bya ba ni gyen du sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes so // gsor byed pa zhes bya ba ni gyen du sgyur ba'o //
translated: The one who throws it up is the one who turns it upward.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: rang gi lag gis so //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis so //
translated: By his own hand.

original: de rnams kyi bdag nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of those?

original: snying rje che dang shes rab dang / thabs kyis 'gro ba rnams kyi don byed pa'i bdag nyid dang ldan pa yin pa de rnams ni /
analyzed: snying rje che dang shes rab dang / thabs kyis 'gro ba rnams kyi don byed pa'i bdag nyid dang ldan pa yin pa de rnams ni /
translated: The nature of those is the nature of great compassion, wisdom, and method, which is the one who acts for the benefit of migrating beings.

original: snying rje dang shes rab dang thabs kyis 'gro don byed pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje dang shes rab dang thabs kyis 'gro don byed pa ste /
translated: One acts for the sake of beings through compassion, wisdom, and skillful means.

original: de la snying rje dang ldan pas snying rje'o //🔽bde ba 'gog par byed pas snying rje ste /
analyzed: de la snying rje dang ldan pas snying rje'o // bde ba 'gog par byed pas snying rje ste /
translated: One is compassionate because one has compassion.🔽One has compassion because one stops the suffering of others.

original: snying rje can ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bas bdag gi bde ba 'gog pa ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: snying rje can ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal bas bdag gi bde ba 'gog pa ni snying rje'o //
translated: One has compassion because one stops one's own happiness due to suffering for the suffering of others.

original: bdag gi bde ba mi 'phel bas na snying rje yang de yin la chen po yang de yin pas snying rje chen po ste /
analyzed: bdag gi bde ba mi 'phel bas na snying rje yang de yin la chen po yang de yin pas snying rje chen po ste /
translated: One has great compassion because one has compassion and because one has great compassion.

original: mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is great because it is non-apprehending in nature.

original: chos thams cad rab tu 'byed pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad rab tu 'byed pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of all dharmas.

original: thabs ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ma lus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ston pa'i sgo nas skal pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ma lus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ston pa'i sgo nas skal pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'o //
translated: Skillful means is the performance of the aims of beings who have the appropriate fortune through the teaching of all supramundane samadhis.

original: 'gro bas 'gro ba ste khams gsum pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro bas 'gro ba ste khams gsum pa rnams so //
translated: Beings are those who go, i.e., those of the three realms.

original: de rnams kyi don ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni dgos pa'o //
translated: Their aim is the purpose.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: snying rje che dang shes rab dang // thabs kyis 'gro don byed pa'i mchog //
analyzed: snying rje che dang shes rab dang // thabs kyis 'gro don byed pa'i mchog //
translated: Great compassion, wisdom, and skillful means are the best for benefiting beings.

original: ces so // de nyid kyi phyir na khro bo de rnams dam pa yin pas mchog ste /
analyzed: ces so // de nyid kyi phyir na khro bo de rnams dam pa yin pas mchog ste /
translated: Therefore, since those wrathful ones are supreme, they are the best.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mchog ces so //
analyzed: mchog ces so //
translated: supreme.

original: rang bzhin gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhe na /
translated: What is their nature?

original: dga' mgu rangs pa'i bsam pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' mgu rangs pa'i bsam pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Their nature is the thought of joy, delight, and satisfaction.

original: de la dga' ba ni sems kyi bsam pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni sems kyi bsam pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Therein, joy is through the thought of the mind.

original: mgu ba ni lus kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: mgu ba ni lus kyi sgo nas so //
translated: Delight is through the body.

original: bsam pa ni blos so //
analyzed: bsam pa ni blos so //
translated: Thought is through the intellect.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste ;
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: dga' ba dang mgu ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de rnams dga' mgu'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mgu ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de rnams dga' mgu'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who possess the thought of joy and delight are called those with the thought of joy and delight.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na rangs pa ni spro ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na rangs pa ni spro ba ste /
translated: Therefore, satisfaction is enthusiasm.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is said:

original: rangs pa zhes so //🔽lus kyi gzugs ni khro bo'i gzugs so //
analyzed: rangs pa zhes so // lus kyi gzugs ni khro bo'i gzugs so //
translated: satisfaction.🔽The form of the body is the form of wrath.

original: khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the form of the body of wrath like?

original: 'jigs byed chen po dang / drag tu bzhad pa dang / dbu dang phyag dang zhabs du ma dang / spyan mi sdug cing skra kham pa gyen du 'greng ba dang / rdzi ma ser ba dang / khro gnyer dang thod pa'i phreng bas brgyan par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen po dang / drag tu bzhad pa dang / dbu dang phyag dang zhabs du ma dang / spyan mi sdug cing skra kham pa gyen du 'greng ba dang / rdzi ma ser ba dang / khro gnyer dang thod pa'i phreng bas brgyan par byed pa dang /
translated: with yellow eyebrows, frowning, adorned with a garland of skulls,🔽adorned with snakes,

original: sbrul gyi rgyan dang / stag lpags kyi smad g-yogs la @31a * //
analyzed: sbrul gyi rgyan dang / stag lpags kyi smad g-yogs la @31a * //
translated: with a lower garment of tiger skin,🔽and so on.

original: sogs pa de rnams gang la yod pa de ni khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa ste /🔽de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: sogs pa de rnams gang la yod pa de ni khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa ste / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: He who has that kind of wrathful bodily form

original: khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa //
analyzed: khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa //
translated: is called “having a wrathful bodily form.”

original: zhes so // sangs rgyas rnams kyi bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi phrin las so //
analyzed: zhes so // sangs rgyas rnams kyi bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi phrin las so //
translated: The activity of the buddhas is the buddha activity.

original: byed pa ni mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa ni mdzad pa ste /
translated: The agent is the one who does it.🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / sangs rgyas phrin las byed pa zhes so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / sangs rgyas phrin las byed pa zhes so //
translated: “The one who does the buddha activity.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir na mgon po ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na mgon po ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is the protector.

original: ston pa sangs rgyas kyi phrin las byed pas na de bas na mgon zhes so //
analyzed: ston pa sangs rgyas kyi phrin las byed pas na de bas na mgon zhes so //
translated: Because he does the activity of the teacher, the Buddha, he is therefore the protector.

original: gang rnams kyis lus btud pa ni /
analyzed: gang rnams kyis lus btud pa ni /
translated: Those who bow their bodies

original: lus btud pa ste /
analyzed: lus btud pa ste /
translated: are those who bow their bodies.

original: lus btud pa de rnams dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas 'di ltar 'og nas 'byung ba'i gsol zhes pa dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: lus btud pa de rnams dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas 'di ltar 'og nas 'byung ba'i gsol zhes pa dang 'brel lo //
translated: Together with those who bow their bodies, the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder, thus as it will be stated below, he says, “please explain.

original: ci byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci byas nas she na /
translated: What is done?

original: phyag byas nas so //
analyzed: phyag byas nas so //
translated: Having bowed.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: To whom?

original: mgon po la'o //
analyzed: mgon po la'o //
translated: To the Protector.

original: mgon med pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams la rjes su ston pa'i phyir na gtso bo ni mgon po'o //
analyzed: mgon med pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams la rjes su ston pa'i phyir na gtso bo ni mgon po'o //
translated: The chief is the Protector because he teaches the world that is without a protector.

original: mgon po yang ci 'dra ba'i mgon po yin zhe na /
analyzed: mgon po yang ci 'dra ba'i mgon po yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of Protector is the Protector?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa zhes so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa zhes so //
translated: the Tathagata.

original: de la de bzhin ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la de bzhin ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: There, the suchness is thusness.

original: de mkhyen pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de mkhyen pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Tathagata because he knows that.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ji ltar byon cing gshegs pa de bzhin du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ji ltar byon cing gshegs pa de bzhin du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Or, the Tathagatas go and come just as they have gone and come, thus he is the Tathagata.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni skal pa phun sum tshogs pas na bcom ldan 'das sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni skal pa phun sum tshogs pas na bcom ldan 'das sam /
translated: Bhagavat means “blessed one” because he is endowed with good fortune.

original: bdud bzhi 'joms pas so //
analyzed: bdud bzhi 'joms pas so //
translated: Or, he is blessed because he has conquered the four demons.

original: de skad yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad yang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: nyon mongs las dang de bzhin skye //
analyzed: nyon mongs las dang de bzhin skye //
translated: The afflictions, karma, birth,🔽and likewise the afflictions,

original: de bzhin nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib //
analyzed: de bzhin nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib //
translated: the obscurations of the knowable,

original: mi mthun phyogs chos gang yin pa //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs chos gang yin pa //
translated: and the qualities that are discordant with enlightenment🔽are conquered by him,

original: 'joms pas de 'dir bcom ldan 'dod //
analyzed: 'joms pas de 'dir bcom ldan 'dod //
translated: so he is called the blessed one.

original: de ltar nges tshig gi rim pas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa 'joms pas ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de ltar nges tshig gi rim pas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa 'joms pas ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Thus, he is the blessed one because he has conquered the afflictions and so on.

original: yang na dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, he is blessed because he possesses the qualities of the lord and so on.

original: de skad yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad yang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:🔽He is said to possess🔽lordship, a beautiful form,🔽fame, glory, the highest,

original: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzangs dang // grags dang dpal dang rab mchog dang // de nas ye shes brtson 'grus dang // drug po rnams la ldan par bshad //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzangs dang // grags dang dpal dang rab mchog dang // de nas ye shes brtson 'grus dang // drug po rnams la ldan par bshad //
translated: knowledge, and diligence.

original: gzhan yang mgon po ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang mgon po ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is he like as a protector?

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: The term “perfect buddha” means one who has awakened perfectly.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is not a śrāvaka or a pratyekabuddha.

original: phyag btsal nas zhes pa ni gong ma dang 'brel to /
analyzed: phyag btsal nas zhes pa ni gong ma dang 'brel to /
translated: Having bowed down, as stated above,

original: thal mo sbyar ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba byas nas ni //
translated: he joined his palms in respect

original: spyan sngar 'dug pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas bdag la phan pa la sogs pa'i don du @31b 'di skad gsol to //
analyzed: spyan sngar 'dug pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas bdag la phan pa la sogs pa'i don du @31b 'di skad gsol to //
translated: and sat in the presence of the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder. For the sake of benefitting himself and others, he made this request:

original: khyab bdag bdag la sman pa dang / bdag la sman pa zhes pa ni bdag la phan pa ste /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bdag la sman pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽bdag don ni bdag la dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab bdag bdag la sman pa dang / bdag la sman pa zhes pa ni bdag la phan pa ste / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bdag la sman pa nyid kyi phyir ro // bdag don ni bdag la dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “O Pervader, for my benefit, for my healing,🔽for my welfare, for my happiness,

original: bdag la ni bdag gi ste /
analyzed: bdag la ni bdag gi ste /
translated: for my own sake, for my own purpose,

original: kye khyab bdag la thugs brtse'i phyir te /
analyzed: kye khyab bdag la thugs brtse'i phyir te /
translated: O Pervader, out of compassion for me,

original: phan gdags pa'i phyir rim pa ji lta ba 'dis bdag gis thob par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i phyir rim pa ji lta ba 'dis bdag gis thob par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: please grant me this, in this sequence, for the sake of benefiting me.”

original: gang gis thob par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis thob par bya zhe na /
translated: By what means should he obtain it?

original: gsungs pa / sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon rdzogs pa'i //
analyzed: gsungs pa / sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon rdzogs pa'i //
translated: The request:

original: byang chub ci nas bdag thob pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya ba'i rim pa de ci nas kyang bdag gis thob par 'gyur ba de ltar kye bcom ldan 'das bshad du gsol zhes phyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i tshig dang
analyzed: byang chub ci nas bdag thob pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya ba'i rim pa de ci nas kyang bdag gis thob par 'gyur ba de ltar kye bcom ldan 'das bshad du gsol zhes phyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i tshig dang
translated: I request you to explain, O Bhagavat, how I may attain the state of manifest, complete enlightenment in the Magical Net, linking this to the verb explain that will occur below.

original: 'brel to // sems can de rnams ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel to // sems can de rnams ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are those sentient beings like?

original: nyon mongs pas ni sems dkrugs shing //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas ni sems dkrugs shing //
translated: They are sentient beings whose minds are disturbed by afflictions.

original: zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa drug go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa drug go //
translated: This refers to the six afflictions.

original: de skad mngon pa'i chos las gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad mngon pa'i chos las gsungs te /
translated: This is stated in the Abhidharma:🔽Pride, views, doubt,

original: nga rgyal lta ba the tshom dang // 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug go //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nga rgyal lta ba the tshom dang // 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug go // zhes gsungs so //
translated: attachment, anger, and ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa de rnams kyis sems rnam par dkrugs pa'i sems can gang yin pa de rnams ni nyon mongs pas ni sems dkrugs shing ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de rnams kyis sems rnam par dkrugs pa'i sems can gang yin pa de rnams ni nyon mongs pas ni sems dkrugs shing ste /
translated: Those sentient beings whose minds are disturbed by those afflictions are sentient beings whose minds are disturbed by afflictions.

original: de'i phyir na de rnams bla na med pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de rnams bla na med pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, in order that they may attain the unsurpassed fruit, the Blessed One is requested to explain.

original: gzhan yang khyad par ci 'dra ba'i sems can zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyad par ci 'dra ba'i sems can zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what kind of special sentient beings?

original: mi shes 'dam du bying ba yi //
analyzed: mi shes 'dam du bying ba yi //
translated: Those sentient beings who are sunk in the mire of nescience,

original: sems can kun la sman pa dang // zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems can kun la sman pa dang // zhes pa ste /
translated: for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: de la mi shes pa ni ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi shes pa ni ma rig pa ste /
translated: There, nescience is ignorance.

original: de nyid thogs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: de nyid thogs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: Because it is the very basis of obstruction,

original: thar dka' bas na 'dam dang 'dra bas 'dam mo //
analyzed: thar dka' bas na 'dam dang 'dra bas 'dam mo //
translated: or because it is difficult to be liberated, it is like a mire, thus it is a mire.

original: der bying ba'i sems can gang yin pa rnams la phan pa'i phyir bshad du gsol zhes pa'i tshig dang 'brel to //
analyzed: der bying ba'i sems can gang yin pa rnams la phan pa'i phyir bshad du gsol zhes pa'i tshig dang 'brel to //
translated: For the sake of those sentient beings who are sunk in that, the Blessed One is requested to explain.

original: bla med 'bras bu thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: bla med 'bras bu thob bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to attain the unsurpassed fruit.

original: zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: The unsurpassed fruit is buddhahood itself.

original: de thob pa ni rab tu rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa ni rab tu rnyed pa'o //
translated: Attaining that is obtaining it.

original: de'i don ni de thob pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni de thob pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of that is for the sake of attaining that.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol //
translated: The Blessed One is requested to explain.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni rtag pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni rtag pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The one called “perfect buddha” is from the perspective of permanence.

original: 'gro ba'i bla ma zhes pa ni 'gro ba rnams kyi bla ma pas 'gro ba'i bla ma ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bla ma zhes pa ni 'gro ba rnams kyi bla ma pas 'gro ba'i bla ma ste /
translated: The one called “teacher of the world” is the teacher of the world, because he is the teacher of migrating beings.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sgo nas so //
translated: This is from the perspective of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: ston pa zhes pa ni 'gro ba la rjes su ston pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa zhes pa ni 'gro ba la rjes su ston pa ste /
translated: The one called “teacher” is the one who teaches migrating beings.

original: @32a * // mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: @32a * // mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: This is from the perspective of Akṣobhya.

original: dam tshig ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: “Commitment” is Bhagavat Vajrasattva.

original: chen po yang de yin la dam tshig kyang de yin pas dam tshig chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la dam tshig kyang de yin pas dam tshig chen po'o //
translated: He is great and he is commitment, thus he is “great commitment.”

original: de'i de nyid ni dam tshig chen po de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i de nyid ni dam tshig chen po de nyid do //
translated: His suchness is “the suchness of great commitment.”

original: de shes pas na /🔽dam tshig chen po de nyid mkhyen //
analyzed: de shes pas na / dam tshig chen po de nyid mkhyen //
translated: Since he knows that,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: he is the one who knows the suchness of great commitment.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi sgo nas so //
translated: This is from the perspective of Amitābha.

original: dbang po zhes pa ni rtul po dang 'bring po dang rnon po rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po zhes pa ni rtul po dang 'bring po dang rnon po rnams te /
translated: “Faculty” refers to the dull, medium, and sharp faculties.

original: de rnams kyi bsam pa ni mno bsam mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bsam pa ni mno bsam mo //
translated: Their thoughts are their intentions.

original: de shes pas na /
analyzed: de shes pas na /
translated: Since he knows that,🔽he is the one who knows the thoughts of all sentient beings.🔽This is from the perspective of Amoghasiddhi.

original: dbang po bsam pa mkhyen zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po bsam pa mkhyen zhes pa ste /
translated: Knowing the thoughts of the faculties.

original: don yod grub pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: From the perspective of Amoghasiddhi.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid las bcom ldan 'das ni dam pa yin pas mchog ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid las bcom ldan 'das ni dam pa yin pas mchog ste /
translated: Thus, since the Blessed One is supreme from the perspective of the nature of the five tathagatas, he is supreme.

original: bshad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: bshad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Please explain is connected.

original: de nas / bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes sku //
analyzed: de nas / bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes sku //
translated: Then, the wisdom body of the Blessed One

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: and so forth.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gang yin pa de bdag gis gzung ngo zhes phyi nas 'byung ba'i tshig dang 'brel to //
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gang yin pa de bdag gis gzung ngo zhes phyi nas 'byung ba'i tshig dang 'brel to //
translated: O Blessed One, I will uphold the name mantra that is connected with you, the wisdom being Manjushri. This is connected with the words that will come later.

original: khyad par ci 'dra ba zhig ye shes sku zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci 'dra ba zhig ye shes sku zhe na /
translated: What kind of special wisdom body?

original: ye shes kyi sku yin pas ye shes sku ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku yin pas ye shes sku ste /
translated: It is a wisdom body because it is a wisdom body.

original: ye shes sku de'o //
analyzed: ye shes sku de'o //
translated: That is the wisdom body.

original: de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //🔽gtsug tor chen po zhes pa ni chen po'i gtsug ni gtsug tor chen po ste /
analyzed: de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so // gtsug tor chen po zhes pa ni chen po'i gtsug ni gtsug tor chen po ste /
translated: That is from the perspective of the mirror-like wisdom.🔽Great uṣṇīṣa is the great uṣṇīṣa of the great one.

original: gtsug tor chen po de'o ;
analyzed: gtsug tor chen po de'o ;
translated: That is the great uṣṇīṣa.

original: / de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: / de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: That is by way of the wisdom of equality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir gtsug tor chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir gtsug tor chen po'o //
translated: The great uṣṇīṣa is because of the nature of the empowerment of all tathāgatas.

original: tshig gi bdag po zhes pa ni tshig ni sgra'o //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag po zhes pa ni tshig ni sgra'o //
translated: The lord of speech is speech, which is sound.

original: bdag po ni mnga' bdag ste tshig gi bdag po de'o //
analyzed: bdag po ni mnga' bdag ste tshig gi bdag po de'o //
translated: The lord is the master, the lord of speech.

original: tshig gi bdag po ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag po ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: The lord of speech is by way of the wisdom of discernment.

original: ye shes sku zhes pa ni ye shes nyid sku yin pas na ye shes sku'o //
analyzed: ye shes sku zhes pa ni ye shes nyid sku yin pas na ye shes sku'o //
translated: The wisdom body is the wisdom body because of being the body of wisdom.

original: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: It is by way of the wisdom of successful activities.

original: rang byung zhes pa ni rang byung ba rang byung ste /
analyzed: rang byung zhes pa ni rang byung ba rang byung ste /
translated: Self-arisen means self-arisen,

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means arisen from the power of meditation.

original: de skad du yang dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud las gsungs pa /🔽kun du bzang po ye shes kyi //
analyzed: de skad du yang dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud las gsungs pa / kun du bzang po ye shes kyi //
translated: Thus it is said in the glorious Supreme Original Tantra:🔽The self-arisen one is the wisdom

original: bdag nyid mngon par byang chub po /
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon par byang chub po /
translated: of the nature of Samantabhadra.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir na de nyid rang 'byung zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir na de nyid rang 'byung zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, he is called “self-arisen.”

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: He is so called from the perspective of the pristine consciousness of the dharmadhātu, which is totally pure.

original: des ci gsungs pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' ye shes lnga dang @32b ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ci gsungs pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na / 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' ye shes lnga dang @32b ldan pa bstan to //
translated: What does he say?

original: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' zhes pa ni /
translated: He teaches Mañjuśrī, the jñānasattva endowed with the five pristine consciousnesses.🔽Mañjuśrī, the jñānasattva,

original: 'jam pa ni mnyen pa dang / dpal dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni mnyen pa dang / dpal dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni 'jam dpal lo //
translated: is gentle and glorious.

original: ye shes sems dpa' zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs ka na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs ka na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is called “jñānasattva” because he resides in the heart center of all tathāgatas.

original: 'jam dpal yang de yin la ye shes sems dpa' yang de nyid yin pas 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal yang de yin la ye shes sems dpa' yang de nyid yin pas 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' ste /
translated: He is Mañjuśrī and also the jñānasattva.

original: de sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not a bodhisattva who is a lord of the tenth stage.

original: de lta na de su zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na de su zhig yin zhe na /
translated: In that case, who is he?

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' ste /
translated: That very perfection of wisdom, nondual pristine consciousness, is Mañjuśrī, the jñānasattva.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said by Dignāga:

original: shes rab pha rol phyin gnyis med //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin gnyis med //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is nondual;

original: ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs //
translated: That pristine consciousness is the Tathāgata.

original: zhes so // ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa de bdag gis gzung ngo zhes pa dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: zhes so // ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa de bdag gis gzung ngo zhes pa dang 'brel lo //
translated: I will uphold the name of the Mañjuśrījñānasattva, who is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, in connection with the recitation of the true names.

original: khyad par ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyad par ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the special quality?

original: gsungs pa / mtshan ni yang dag brjod pa'i mchog / cas bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / mtshan ni yang dag brjod pa'i mchog / cas bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, “The supreme recitation of the true name,” and so on.

original: de'i don ni bshad zin to //🔽don zab ces pa ni zab mo yang de yin la don yang de nyid yin pas na don zab ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni bshad zin to // don zab ces pa ni zab mo yang de yin la don yang de nyid yin pas na don zab ste /
translated: The meaning of that has already been explained.

original: stong pa nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi don to //
translated: “Profound meaning” is profound and also the meaning, and therefore it is the profound meaning, the meaning of emptiness.

original: de la don dang zab pa yod pa de'i phyir bdag gis gzung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la don dang zab pa yod pa de'i phyir bdag gis gzung zhes pa'o //
translated: It has meaning and profundity, therefore it is to be grasped.

original: don ni rgya che zhing zhes pa ni rab tu rgyas pa'i don to //
analyzed: don ni rgya che zhing zhes pa ni rab tu rgyas pa'i don to //
translated: It has a vast meaning, that is, it has an extensive meaning.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni don ni rgya che zhing zhes so //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni don ni rgya che zhing zhes so //
translated: That which has that is called “having a vast meaning.”

original: don chen zhes pa ni che ba'i don gang yin pa de ni don chen po nyid de /
analyzed: don chen zhes pa ni che ba'i don gang yin pa de ni don chen po nyid de /
translated: It has a great meaning, that is, it has a great purpose.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the fulfillment of all the aspirations of the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: mtshungs med ces pa ni mnyam pa med pa gang yin pa de ni mtshungs med do //
analyzed: mtshungs med ces pa ni mnyam pa med pa gang yin pa de ni mtshungs med do //
translated: It is incomparable, that is, it is without equal.

original: gang gi phyir mtshungs pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtshungs pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it without equal?

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the Dharma-element.

original: rab zhi zhes pa ni spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rab zhi zhes pa ni spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is peaceful, that is, it is the pacification of all conceptual elaboration.

original: thog ma bar dang mthar dge ba //
analyzed: thog ma bar dang mthar dge ba //
translated: It is virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: zhes pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang / sgom pa dus rnams la spro ba dang dga' ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang / sgom pa dus rnams la spro ba dang dga' ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because one obtains enthusiasm, joy, and fitness in the periods of listening, reflection, and meditative concentration.

original: dge ba gsum po de bdag gis gzung ngo zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: dge ba gsum po de bdag gis gzung ngo zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The three virtues are to be taken up by me.

original: khyad par gzhan yang ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan yang ci 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What is the other special quality?

original: gsungs pa / 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa ste /🔽'das @33a * //
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs // zhes pa la sogs pa ste / 'das @33a * //
translated: The Buddhas of the past have taught,

original: pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gang gsungs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / yang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yang dang yang du gsungs pa gang yin pa'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gang gsungs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / yang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yang dang yang du gsungs pa gang yin pa'i zhes bya'o //
translated: The Buddhas of the past have taught, the Buddhas of the future will teach, and the Buddhas of the present are teaching again and again.🔽This is what is meant.

original: des 'di skad gsung par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des 'di skad gsung par 'gyur te /
translated: He says this:

original: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gsungs pa de'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gsungs pa de'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: Because the Tathagatas of the three times have taught the recitation of the true names, this Dharma discourse is taught to be like space.

original: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid ni kun du gnas pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid ni kun du gnas pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Whether the Tathagatas appear or not, the nature of reality always abides.

original: yang ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rgyud chen sgyu 'phrul dra ba las //
analyzed: rgyud chen sgyu 'phrul dra ba las //
translated: From the great tantra of the Magical Net,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud chen po 'di la dpag tu med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen pos gsang sngags chen po 'dzin pa rnams dga' nas yang dag par glu blangs pa gang yin pa de bdag gis gzung zhes pa dang 'brel
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud chen po 'di la dpag tu med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa chen pos gsang sngags chen po 'dzin pa rnams dga' nas yang dag par glu blangs pa gang yin pa de bdag gis gzung zhes pa dang 'brel
translated: This is connected with the statement: I will uphold the true songs of praise that were sung by the immeasurable great Vajradharas, who were delighted, in this great tantra of the Magical Net of Mañjuśrī.

original: lo // mgon po rdzogs sangs rgyas kun gyi //
analyzed: lo // mgon po rdzogs sangs rgyas kun gyi //
translated: The lord, the perfect Buddha of all,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: and so forth.

original: kye mgon po ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang ba 'dzin par bdag 'gyur ba de bzhin du bshad par gsol zhes gong ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: kye mgon po ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang ba 'dzin par bdag 'gyur ba de bzhin du bshad par gsol zhes gong ma dang 'brel to //
translated: Oh Lord, just as you are, may I become a holder of the secret of all perfect Buddhas. Please explain it in that way.  This is connected with the above.

original: 'dzin zhes bya ba 'di ni chos kyi skad do //
analyzed: 'dzin zhes bya ba 'di ni chos kyi skad do //
translated: The word holder is a Dharma term.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i bar du 'di /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i bar du 'di /
translated: Until I attain definite emergence,

original: bdag gis bsam pa brtan pos gzung //
analyzed: bdag gis bsam pa brtan pos gzung //
translated: I will firmly hold this.

original: zhes pa ni bdag gis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di'i nges par 'byung ba ma thob kyi bar du gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdag gis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di'i nges par 'byung ba ma thob kyi bar du gzung ngo //
translated: This means that I will hold this recitation of the name until I attain definite emergence from this.

original: nges par 'byung zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Definite emergence is nirvana.

original: ci 'dra bar gzung zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra bar gzung zhe na /
translated: How will I hold it?

original: bsam pa brtan pos so //
analyzed: bsam pa brtan pos so //
translated: With a firm intention.

original: bsam pa ni mno bsam mo //
analyzed: bsam pa ni mno bsam mo //
translated: Intention means thought.

original: brtan po ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: brtan po ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Firm means immovable.

original: de dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni bsam pa brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni bsam pa brtan pa'o //
translated: One who possesses that is firmly intentional.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bdag gis de rtogs nas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa'i khyad par ji lta ba bzhin du bshad par 'tshal lo zhes 'og ma dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bdag gis de rtogs nas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa'i khyad par ji lta ba bzhin du bshad par 'tshal lo zhes 'og ma dang 'brel lo //
translated: Having understood it as it is, I should explain it to all sentient beings, in accordance with their individual aspirations.

original: gang gi don du zhe na /🔽gsungs pa / nyon mongs ma lus bsal ba dang // mi shes ma lus spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang gi don du zhe na / gsungs pa / nyon mongs ma lus bsal ba dang // mi shes ma lus spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: For what purpose?

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said:🔽In order to remove all afflictions without exception, and to abandon all ignorance without exception.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ma lus pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ma lus pa ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzung ngo //
translated: Therein, all afflictions are taken to be the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: de rnams zad pa'i don ni nyon mongs ma lus bsal ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams zad pa'i don ni nyon mongs ma lus bsal ba'o //
translated: The meaning of their exhaustion is the removal of all afflictions without exception.

original: ma lus pa'i dngos po mi shes pa ni mi shes ma lus te //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i dngos po mi shes pa ni mi shes ma lus te //
translated: All things that are not known are all ignorance.

original: de gzhom par bya ba ni mi shes ma lus spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de gzhom par bya ba ni mi shes ma lus spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: To conquer that is to abandon all ignorance without exception.

original: de yi don du bshad par 'tshal //
analyzed: de yi don du bshad par 'tshal //
translated: For that purpose, I should explain.

original: zhes @33b bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes @33b bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected with the above.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par ji bzhin du //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par ji bzhin du //
translated: In accordance with their individual aspirations,

original: sems can rnams la bshad par 'tshal //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bshad par 'tshal //
translated: I should explain to sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du bdag gis rtogs nas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa'i khyad par ji lta ba bzhin du bdag gis rab tu bshad par 'tshal lo zhes pa'i tha tshig go //🔽gsang dbang lag na rdo rje yis //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du bdag gis rtogs nas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa'i khyad par ji lta ba bzhin du bdag gis rab tu bshad par 'tshal lo zhes pa'i tha tshig go // gsang dbang lag na rdo rje yis //
translated: Having understood it just as it is, I should explain it just as it is to all sentient beings, according to their individual aspirations.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: The Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi,

original: de la gsang ba ni lcang lo can gyi pho brang zhes bya ba la gnas pa'i gnod sbyin rnams so //
analyzed: de la gsang ba ni lcang lo can gyi pho brang zhes bya ba la gnas pa'i gnod sbyin rnams so //
translated: Therein, the secret ones are the yakṣas dwelling in the palace called Aṭakāvatī.

original: de rnams kyi rgyal po'i phyir na gsang dbang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyal po'i phyir na gsang dbang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because he is the king of those, he is called the Lord of Secrets.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de skad du //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de skad du //
translated: The Tathāgata said this:

original: zhes pa ni de skad de rnam pa 'di lta bus bcom ldan 'das gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de skad de rnam pa 'di lta bus bcom ldan 'das gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol to //
translated: Thus, with such an expression, the Blessed Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, requested the Tathāgata.

original: gsol nas ji ltar byas she na /
analyzed: gsol nas ji ltar byas she na /
translated: Having requested, what did he do?

original: thal mo sbyar ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba byas nas ni //
translated: Having joined his palms,

original: lus btud nas ni spyan sngar 'dug / ces pa ni lus btud nas spyan sngar gnas zhes so //
analyzed: lus btud nas ni spyan sngar 'dug / ces pa ni lus btud nas spyan sngar gnas zhes so //
translated: bowing his body, he sat in front. Having bowed his body, he sat in front.

original: bkur ba sngon du byas nas don du gnyer ba ni gsol ba 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: bkur ba sngon du byas nas don du gnyer ba ni gsol ba 'debs pa ste /
translated: Having first paid homage, one should request, Please explain.

original: bkur ba ni phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bkur ba ni phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Homage is prostration, etc.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes pa las zhus pa'i rim par phye ba dang po ste tshigs bcad bcu drug go /🔽// / de nas zhus pa'i de ma thag tu gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes pa las zhus pa'i rim par phye ba dang po ste tshigs bcad bcu drug go / // / de nas zhus pa'i de ma thag tu gsungs pa /
translated: This is the first chapter of the commentary on the Arya-nama-samgīti called the Guhya-mantra-artha-avali, with sixteen verses.

original: de nas bcom ldan sh'akya thub //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan sh'akya thub //
translated: Then, immediately after the request, it says, Then the Bhagavat Shakyamuni...

original: ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: de la de nas ni zhus pa'i de ma thag tu slar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la de nas ni zhus pa'i de ma thag tu slar gsungs pa'o //
translated: There, then is immediately after the request, and again is spoken.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bshad zin to //
translated: The Bhagavat has been explained.

original: sh'akya'i rigs rnams kyi thub pa ni sh'akya thub pa'o //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs rnams kyi thub pa ni sh'akya thub pa'o //
translated: The Sage of the Shakyas is the Sage of the Shakyas.

original: sku gsung thugs thub pas na yang thub pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs thub pas na yang thub pa'o //
translated: He is also a Sage because he is a sage of body, speech, and mind.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rkang gnyis mchog / ces pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rkang gnyis mchog / ces pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni bshad zin to //
translated: The perfect Buddha, best of bipeds, the perfect Buddha has been explained.

original: rkang gnyis ni lha dang mi'o //
analyzed: rkang gnyis ni lha dang mi'o //
translated: The two-footed are gods and men.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ni rab ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ni rab ces pa'i don to //
translated: Among them, the best is the meaning of supreme.

original: nyid kyi zhal nas zhes pa ni sh'akya thub pa nyid kyi zhal nas so //
analyzed: nyid kyi zhal nas zhes pa ni sh'akya thub pa nyid kyi zhal nas so //
translated: From his own mouth means from the mouth of Shakyamuni himself.
