original: ljags bzang ba ni g-yas su 'khyil pa'i dung dang 'dra zhing chos thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ljags bzang ba ni g-yas su 'khyil pa'i dung dang 'dra zhing chos thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The tongue is good, like a right-coiling conch, because it is the basis of all dharmas.

original: ring zhing yangs par brkyang mdzad de //
analyzed: ring zhing yangs par brkyang mdzad de //
translated: He extended it long and wide.

original: zhes pa ni rang gi zhal nas ring zhing yangs pa'i rang gi lce sprul pa mdzad nas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi zhal nas ring zhing yangs pa'i rang gi lce sprul pa mdzad nas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that from his own mouth he emanated his own long and wide tongue and retracted it.

original: ci zhig mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig mdzad ce na /
translated: What did he do?

original: 'jig rten gsum po snang byed cing //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po snang byed cing //
translated: Illuminating the three worlds.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so forth.

original: sa 'og dang sa stengs dang sa bla'i 'jig rten gsum la snang zhing gsal bar byed pa'i 'dzum pa bstan nas phyag na rdo rje la slar gsungs so zhes par 'brel to //🔽yang 'dzum pa'i khyad @34a * //
analyzed: sa 'og dang sa stengs dang sa bla'i 'jig rten gsum la snang zhing gsal bar byed pa'i 'dzum pa bstan nas phyag na rdo rje la slar gsungs so zhes par 'brel to // yang 'dzum pa'i khyad @34a * //
translated: Having shown a smile that illuminates and illuminates the three worlds of the underworld, the earth, and the heavens, he spoke again to Vajrapani.

original: par ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: par ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the special smile like?

original: gsungs pa / bdud bzhi'i dgra rnams 'dul byed pa //
analyzed: gsungs pa / bdud bzhi'i dgra rnams 'dul byed pa //
translated: The one who tames the four māra-enemies.

original: zhes pa bdud bzhi ni phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa bdud bzhi ni phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud rnams so //
translated: The four māras are the aggregates, afflictions, devaputra māra, and the lord of death.

original: de rnams nyid dgra rnams te /
analyzed: de rnams nyid dgra rnams te /
translated: They are enemies.

original: de rnams 'dul ba ni rjes su mthun par 'dul zhing tshar gtsod pa'i 'dzum pa bstan nas phyag na rdo rje la slar gsungs so zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de rnams 'dul ba ni rjes su mthun par 'dul zhing tshar gtsod pa'i 'dzum pa bstan nas phyag na rdo rje la slar gsungs so zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Taming them is taming them in accordance with their suitability and showing the smile of victory. It is related to the text saying, He spoke to Vajrapāṇi.

original: sems can rnams kyi ngan song gsum //🔽sbyong bar byed pa'i 'dzum bstan nas //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ngan song gsum // sbyong bar byed pa'i 'dzum bstan nas //
translated: The one who purifies the three lower realms of sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sems can ngan song gsum gyi dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i sems can ngan song gsum gyi dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro'o //
translated: The three lower realms of worldly sentient beings are the hells, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: de dag par sbyang par byed pa'i 'dzum bstan te phyag na rdo rje la slar gsungs zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de dag par sbyang par byed pa'i 'dzum bstan te phyag na rdo rje la slar gsungs zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The one who purifies them shows the smile. It is related to the text saying, He spoke to Vajrapāṇi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos bstan pa'i dus na rtags gsum ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos bstan pa'i dus na rtags gsum ste /
translated: When the tathāgatas teach the dharma, there are three signs.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: 'dzum pa dang / gzigs pa dang / 'od zer gyis bskul ba'o //🔽kha cig tu gcig gam /
analyzed: 'dzum pa dang / gzigs pa dang / 'od zer gyis bskul ba'o // kha cig tu gcig gam /
translated: The smile, the glance, and the urging with light rays.🔽In some [tantras] one [is mentioned],

original: kha cig tu gnyis sam /
analyzed: kha cig tu gnyis sam /
translated: in some two,

original: kha cig tu gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig tu gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: and in some three.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dpal sgyu 'phrul dra pa'i rgyud las gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: dpal sgyu 'phrul dra pa'i rgyud las gnyis gsungs te /
translated: in the glorious Web of Magic Tantra two are mentioned:

original: 'dzum pa dang gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzum pa dang gzigs pa'o //
translated: the smile and the glance.

original: kha cig las gsum la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig las gsum la 'di lta ste /
translated: In some [tantras] three are mentioned, for example,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: in the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines:

original: byams pa la gzigs pa dang / 'dzum pa'i zhal dang / 'od zer spros pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa la gzigs pa dang / 'dzum pa'i zhal dang / 'od zer spros pa'o //
translated: the glance at Maitreya, the smiling face, and the emission of light rays.

original: kha cig las gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig las gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In some [tantras] one is mentioned, for example,

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gnyis las so //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gnyis las so //
translated: in the two [tantras] of the Praise in Hundred and Fifty Verses.

original: 'dzum pa bstan nas zhes pa ni //
analyzed: 'dzum pa bstan nas zhes pa ni //
translated: The line having shown the smile

original: 'dzum pa de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dzum pa de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: refers to the four kinds of smiles:

original: yan lag dang nyid lag las 'phro ba dang / ba spu las 'phro ba dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od 'phro ba dang / ljags kyi dbang po las 'od 'phro ba ste /
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag las 'phro ba dang / ba spu las 'phro ba dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od 'phro ba dang / ljags kyi dbang po las 'od 'phro ba ste /
translated: the smile emanating from the major and minor body parts, the smile emanating from the pores, the smile of natural radiance, and the smile emanating from the tongue organ.

original: 'dir ni ljags kyi dbang po rdzu 'phrul bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: 'dir ni ljags kyi dbang po rdzu 'phrul bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rtags so //
translated: Here, the tongue faculty is a sign that is preceded by the manifestation of a miracle.

original: tshig ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: tshig ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the speech like?

original: tshangs pa'i gsung zhes pa ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gsung zhes pa ste /
translated: It is the speech of Brahma.

original: tshangs pa'i sgra dang ldan pa'i phyir changs pa'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sgra dang ldan pa'i phyir changs pa'i gsung ngo //
translated: It is the speech of Brahma because it is endowed with the voice of Brahma.

original: tshangs pa'i sgra ni che ba dang / yon tan che ba'i tshig bla dags te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sgra ni che ba dang / yon tan che ba'i tshig bla dags te /
translated: The voice of Brahma is a designation for a great sound and a great quality.

original: ji skad du /🔽tshangs ldan bsod nams rab skye ba'o ;
analyzed: ji skad du / tshangs ldan bsod nams rab skye ba'o ;
translated: As it is said:

original: / zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: / zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: “Brahma’s speech is the arising of great merit.”

original: stong phrag du ma rnams las te /
analyzed: stong phrag du ma rnams las te /
translated: It is heard in many thousands.

original: stong phrag gi sgra ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la shes par bya ste /
analyzed: stong phrag gi sgra ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la shes par bya ste /
translated: The word “thousands” should be understood as the trichiliocosm.

original: stong phrag du ma'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor zhes ston to //
analyzed: stong phrag du ma'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor zhes ston to //
translated: It is taught that the wheel has the nature of many thousands.

original: ji skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po 'jig rten gyi khams @34b sgras gang bar byed do zhes so //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po 'jig rten gyi khams @34b sgras gang bar byed do zhes so //
translated: “The trichiliocosm is filled with sound.”

original: ji ltar nang na thos pa de bzhin du phyi rol na yang shes te /
analyzed: ji ltar nang na thos pa de bzhin du phyi rol na yang shes te /
translated: Just as it is heard internally, so it is known externally.

original: de la nang gang yin pa de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po 'di la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la nang gang yin pa de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po 'di la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: That which is internal is that which is located in this trichiliocosm.

original: phyi rol ni 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan yang yin pa rnams te /
analyzed: phyi rol ni 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan yang yin pa rnams te /
translated: That which is external is also other world systems.

original: de bas na che ba'i phyir tshangs pa'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na che ba'i phyir tshangs pa'i gsung ngo //
translated: Therefore, because it is great, it is Brahma's speech.

original: yang na tshangs pa na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa na bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'o //
translated: Or, Brahma is the Blessed One Shakyamuni.

original: tshangs pa de'i tshig 'di nyid tshangs ba'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: tshangs pa de'i tshig 'di nyid tshangs ba'i gsung ngo //
translated: The speech of that Brahma is Brahma's speech.

original: snyan pa yis zhes pa ni mnyan na bde ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan pa yis zhes pa ni mnyan na bde ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Pleasant means it is pleasant to listen to.

original: 'jig rten gsum po kun bkang nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po kun bkang nas //
translated: Having filled the entire triple world

original: zhes pa ni de'i las tshangs pa'i gsung gcig kho nas 'jig rten gsum rnam par khyab pa'i gsung gis phyag na rdo rje la slar gsungs pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i las tshangs pa'i gsung gcig kho nas 'jig rten gsum rnam par khyab pa'i gsung gis phyag na rdo rje la slar gsungs pa dang 'brel to //
translated: means that with just that one Brahma speech, the speech that pervades the triple world, it is connected to Vajrapani's reply.

original: de skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: srid pa 'joms pa'i gsung ni gcig po yang //
analyzed: srid pa 'joms pa'i gsung ni gcig po yang //
translated: Even that one speech that conquers existence

original: theg pa sna tshogs rab bstan phye ba yis //
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs rab bstan phye ba yis //
translated: is differentiated by teaching the various vehicles.

original: ji lta ji ltar skye bo thams cad kyis //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar skye bo thams cad kyis //
translated: Just as all beings

original: rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur skyon med rnam par gsal //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur skyon med rnam par gsal //
translated: The cause of realization, faultless, and clear.

original: zhes so // snying rje che dang ldan gyur pas //
analyzed: zhes so // snying rje che dang ldan gyur pas //
translated: Having become endowed with great compassion,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: and so forth.

original: lag na rdo rje khyod legs so //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje khyod legs so //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, you are excellent.

original: khye dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang gang dang gang gi phyir khyod 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i sku dang 'brel pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gang yin pa de nga las nyan par brtson pa de dang de'i phyir gsang ba'i bdag po la legs par bstan par🔽bya zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: khye dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang gang dang gang gi phyir khyod 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i sku dang 'brel pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gang yin pa de nga las nyan par brtson pa de dang de'i phyir gsang ba'i bdag po la legs par bstan par bya zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: For whatever reason, you are striving to hear from me the name-mantra of Mañjuśrījñānasattva, which is the Praise in One Hundred and Eight Names. For that reason, O Lord of Secrets, I will teach it well.

original: khyod kyis ci'i don du nga las dris pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: khyod kyis ci'i don du nga las dris pa yin zhe na /
translated: For what purpose did you ask me?

original: 'gro la phan pa'i don du ni //
analyzed: 'gro la phan pa'i don du ni //
translated: For the sake of benefiting migrating beings,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: 'gro ba la nye bar phan gdags pa'i phyir snying rje chen po dang ldan par gyur pas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba la nye bar phan gdags pa'i phyir snying rje chen po dang ldan par gyur pas so //
translated: Having become endowed with great compassion for the sake of benefiting migrating beings,

original: khyad par ji lta bu'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa nyan par brtson zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa nyan par brtson zhe na /
translated: For what kind of Praise in One Hundred and Eight Names are you striving to hear?

original: dag par byed cing sdig sel ba //🔽zhes pa ste /🔽de la dag par byed cing zhes pa ni bkra shis pa'o //
analyzed: dag par byed cing sdig sel ba // zhes pa ste / de la dag par byed cing zhes pa ni bkra shis pa'o //
translated: purifies and removes sin.

original: sdig sel ba zhes pa ni mi dge ba 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: sdig sel ba zhes pa ni mi dge ba 'joms pa'o //
translated: Here, purifies means auspicious, and removes sin means destroying non-virtue.

original: khyod ni rtse gcig yid kyis nyon //
analyzed: khyod ni rtse gcig yid kyis nyon //
translated: You should listen with a one-pointed mind.

original: zhes pa ni de yis 'di skad gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de yis 'di skad gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: This means he will say this:

original: bum pa kha bub pa dang / bum pa zhabs rdol ba dang / bum pa mi gtsang ba bzhin du mi rung ngo zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bum pa kha bub pa dang / bum pa zhabs rdol ba dang / bum pa mi gtsang ba bzhin du mi rung ngo zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as an inverted pot, a pot with a hole in the bottom, and an unclean pot are unsuitable, so it is.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But how is it?

original: legs par nyon cig ces pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs ma thag tu rdo rje 'dzin pas gsol pa /
analyzed: legs par nyon cig ces pa'o // bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs ma thag tu rdo rje 'dzin pas gsol pa /
translated: Listen well!

original: bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol //
analyzed: bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol //
translated: Immediately after the Blessed One spoke, Vajradhara said, Blessed One, that is excellent!

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das ni sh'akya thub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das ni sh'akya thub pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is Shakyamuni.

original: de ni de ltar mnyan par bgyi'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni de ltar mnyan par bgyi'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means I will listen in that way.

original: legs @35a * //
analyzed: legs @35a * //
translated: Excellent!

original: zhes pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa nyid kyi rim pas bdag gis mnyan to zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa nyid kyi rim pas bdag gis mnyan to zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means I will listen according to the very stages that were taught.🔽 🔽I will listen to the Dharma of the Vajra Vehicle,

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba las slar gsungs pa'i rim par phye ba ste gnyis pa tshigs bcad drug pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba las slar gsungs pa'i rim par phye ba ste gnyis pa tshigs bcad drug pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter in the detailed commentary on the meaning of the words of the mantra called “The View of the Meaning of the Mantra,” from the noble Sūtra of the Explanation of the Names.

original: // / da ni slar gsungs pa'i de ma thag tu rigs drug la gzigs pa'i rim par phye ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / da ni slar gsungs pa'i de ma thag tu rigs drug la gzigs pa'i rim par phye ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, immediately after the recitation, the chapter on the vision of the six families is stated:

original: de nas bcom ldan sh'akya thub //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan sh'akya thub //
translated: Then the Bhagavān Śākyamuni

original: ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: de la / gsang sngags rigs chen thams cad dang // zhes pa ni sdud par byed pa'i tshig 'di ni spyir bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: de la / gsang sngags rigs chen thams cad dang // zhes pa ni sdud par byed pa'i tshig 'di ni spyir bstan pa'o ;
translated: Here, “all the great families of mantra” is a summarizing statement.

original: /'dir de dang de la rnam par gzigs te /
analyzed: /'dir de dang de la rnam par gzigs te /
translated: Here, he looked at this and that.

original: tshig gi bdag po 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i skye ba med pa'i chos can tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so zhes phyis 'byung ba'i tshig dang lhan cig tu 'brel to //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag po 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i skye ba med pa'i chos can tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so zhes phyis 'byung ba'i tshig dang lhan cig tu 'brel to //
translated: The lord of speech, Mañjuśrī, the jñānasattva, uttered this verse, which is the unborn nature, in connection with the later words.

original: gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs //
analyzed: gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs //
translated: The family of the holders of secret mantra and knowledge mantra.

original: zhes pa ni rig sngags 'dzin pas na rig sngags 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rig sngags 'dzin pas na rig sngags 'chang ba'o //
translated: This is because they hold knowledge mantras.

original: gsang sngags kyi bdag nyid kyang de yin la rig sngags 'chang ba yang de nyid yin pas na gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba ni 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi bdag nyid kyang de yin la rig sngags 'chang ba yang de nyid yin pas na gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba ni 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of secret mantra and it is the holder of knowledge mantras, thus the family of the holders of secret mantra and knowledge mantra is the nature of holding.

original: de'i rigs ni gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: de'i rigs ni gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs te /
translated: The family of that is the family of the holders of secret mantra and knowledge mantra.

original: las kyi rigs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: las kyi rigs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means the family of action.

original: rigs gsum la ni rnam par gzigs //
analyzed: rigs gsum la ni rnam par gzigs //
translated: The family of the three is the family of Vairochana.

original: zhes pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin nyid pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin nyid pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means the family of Vairochana because it is the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs //
translated: The family of the mundane and supramundane.

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten la lta bas na 'jig rten no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten la lta bas na 'jig rten no //
translated: This is because it views the mundane.

original: de'i rigs ni 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: de'i rigs ni 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs te /
translated: The family of that is the family of the mundane and supramundane.

original: padma'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: padma'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means the lotus family.

original: 'jig rten snang byed rigs chen dang // zhes pa ni 'jig rten rnams la gsal bar byed pa ni 'jig rten snang byed de me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid pas mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten snang byed rigs chen dang // zhes pa ni 'jig rten rnams la gsal bar byed pa ni 'jig rten snang byed de me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid pas mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The illuminator of the world is the illuminator of the worlds, because it is the nature of the mirror-like intuition, and so is Akshobhya.

original: de'i rigs ni /
analyzed: de'i rigs ni /
translated: Its family is

original: 'jig rten snang byed rigs chen dang // zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten snang byed rigs chen dang // zhes pa ste /
translated: The great family of the illuminator of the world.

original: rdo rje'i rigs so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs so //
translated: It is the vajra family.🔽The supreme family of the great seal,

original: phyag rgya chen po'i rigs mchog dang // zhes pa ni byang sems rdo rje'i rigs so //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i rigs mchog dang // zhes pa ni byang sems rdo rje'i rigs so //
translated: is the bodhisattva vajra family.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na mchog ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na mchog ste /
translated: It is supreme for that very reason,

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the enlightenment spirit of Vairochana, etc.

original: de'i rigs ni phyag rgya chen po'i rigs mchog go //
analyzed: de'i rigs ni phyag rgya chen po'i rigs mchog go //
translated: Its family is the supreme family of the great seal.

original: rigs chen gtsug tor cher gzigs nas //🔽@35b zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rigs chen gtsug tor cher gzigs nas // @35b zhes pa ni /
translated: Having seen the great crest jewel family,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis khams gsum gyi rgyal por dbang bskur bas na gtsug tor chen po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis khams gsum gyi rgyal por dbang bskur bas na gtsug tor chen po ste /
translated: The great crest jewel is the consecration of the king of the three worlds by all the transcendent lords.

original: de'i rigs ni rigs chen gtsug tor che ste /
analyzed: de'i rigs ni rigs chen gtsug tor che ste /
translated: That type is the great type of the great uṣṇīṣa.

original: rin po che'i rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “jewel type” is explained above.

original: chen gzigs pa'i don ni gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: chen gzigs pa'i don ni gong du bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “great seer” is explained above.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba las rigs drug la gzigs pa'i rim par phye ba ste gsum pa tshigs bcad gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba las rigs drug la gzigs pa'i rim par phye ba ste gsum pa tshigs bcad gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third verse of the second chapter on the stages of seeing the six types in the detailed commentary on the noble Mañjuśrī’s Root Tantra called “The View of the Meaning of Secret Mantra.”

original: // / da ni dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rim pa bla ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bshad de ;
analyzed: // / da ni dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rim pa bla ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bshad de ;
translated: Now, the stage of perfect enlightenment of the glorious Net of Illusory Manifestations, which is transmitted from one guru to another, will be explained.

original: de yang dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i le'u khri drug stong gi nang nas byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i le'u khri drug stong gi nang nas byung ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, it arises from within the sixteen thousand chapters of the glorious Net of Illusory Manifestations.

original: de la dang por re zhig sngags kyi sgor zhugs nas spyad pa spyod pas /
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig sngags kyi sgor zhugs nas spyad pa spyod pas /
translated: There, first of all, having entered the door of mantra, one should practice.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi spyi gtsug gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa zhes pa gtsug gi nor bu 'di mngon du byed 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ma
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi spyi gtsug gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa zhes pa gtsug gi nor bu 'di mngon du byed 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ma
translated: The Blessed One, Mañjuśrī, the wisdom being, the crown of the wisdom of all tathāgatas, the non-dual ultimate, the one who is called the One Who Utters the Names of the Crown Jewel, wishes to actualize this crown jewel.

original: lus shing lus pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su sgrol ba'i bsam pa dang / byang chub chen por smon pa'i sems dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid dang ldan pas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: lus shing lus pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su sgrol ba'i bsam pa dang / byang chub chen por smon pa'i sems dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid dang ldan pas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams bsdus te /
translated: The bodhisattva who, with the intention to completely liberate all sentient beings without exception, with the aspiration for great awakening, endowed with the nature of method and wisdom, gathers sentient beings through the four means of gathering,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: should generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect complete awakening.

original: 'di skad kyang brjod de /
analyzed: 'di skad kyang brjod de /
translated: And he should say this:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bdag la dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bdag la dgongs su gsol /
translated: All buddhas and bodhisattvas, please heed me!

original: bdag che ge mo zhes bya ba dus 'di nas gzung nas ji tsam byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du bla na med pa'i byang chub mchog gi sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag che ge mo zhes bya ba dus 'di nas gzung nas ji tsam byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du bla na med pa'i byang chub mchog gi sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
translated: I, [name], from this time forward, until the seat of awakening is reached, will generate the unsurpassed, supreme mind of enlightenment.

original: ji ltar dus gsum mgon po rnams //
analyzed: ji ltar dus gsum mgon po rnams //
translated: Just as the lords of the three times

original: byang chub nyid du nges pa'i //
analyzed: byang chub nyid du nges pa'i //
translated: were definitely set on enlightenment,🔽I will also generate

original: byang chub sems ni bla na med pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni bla na med pa //
translated: the unsurpassed, supreme mind of enlightenment.

original: dam pa bdag gis bskyed par bgyi //
analyzed: dam pa bdag gis bskyed par bgyi //
translated: I will firmly take up the trainings in ethics,🔽gathering virtuous dharmas,🔽and acting for the welfare of sentient beings.🔽I will firmly take up the trainings in ethics.🔽I will take refuge in the Buddha,

original: tshul khrims kyi ni bslab pa dang // dge ba'i chos ni sdud pa dang // sems can don byed tshul khrims rnams //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi ni bslab pa dang // dge ba'i chos ni sdud pa dang // sems can don byed tshul khrims rnams //
translated: the Dharma, and the supreme, unsurpassed Sangha,🔽the Three Jewels.🔽From this time forward, I will take refuge.🔽I will never turn away from them.

original: brtan por bdag gis so sor gzung //
analyzed: brtan por bdag gis so sor gzung //
translated: I will firmly take up🔽the vows generated by the Buddha.🔽I will firmly take up🔽the vows generated by the Buddha.🔽I will firmly take up

original: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun dang // bla med mchog gi dkon mchog gsum //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun dang // bla med mchog gi dkon mchog gsum //
translated: the vows generated by the Buddha.🔽I will firmly take up

original: deng brtsams te gzung bar bgyi //
analyzed: deng brtsams te gzung bar bgyi //
translated: the vows generated by the Buddha.

analyzed: nam du yang ni mi gtong ngo //

original: sdom pa sangs rgyas sbyor bskyed pa //
analyzed: sdom pa sangs rgyas sbyor bskyed pa //
translated: the vows generated by the Buddha.

original: deng nas brtan @36a * //
analyzed: deng nas brtan @36a * //
translated: I will firmly take up🔽the vows generated by the Buddha.🔽I will firmly take up

original: par gzung bar bgyi //🔽rdo rje rigs mchog chen po yi //
analyzed: par gzung bar bgyi //🔽rdo rje rigs mchog chen po yi //
translated: the vows generated by the Buddha.🔽I will firmly take

original: rdo rje dril bu'i phyag rgya dag / de nyid kho nas so sor gzung //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu'i phyag rgya dag / de nyid kho nas so sor gzung //
translated: just as they were held by you.

original: slob dpon yang ni gzung bar bgyi //
analyzed: slob dpon yang ni gzung bar bgyi //
translated: I will also hold the master.

original: drug tu byas te nyin re la //
analyzed: drug tu byas te nyin re la //
translated: Having made six parts,

original: sbyin pa rnam bzhi rab tu sbyin //
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam bzhi rab tu sbyin //
translated: I will give the four gifts every day.🔽This is the pledge of the mind

original: rin chen rigs mchog chen po yi //🔽yid dga' ba yi dam tshig go //🔽phyi dang gsang ba'i theg pa gsum //
analyzed: rin chen rigs mchog chen po yi // yid dga' ba yi dam tshig go // phyi dang gsang ba'i theg pa gsum //
translated: of the great supreme jewel family.🔽I will also hold the sublime Dharma

original: dam pa'i chos kyang gzung bar bgyi //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyang gzung bar bgyi //
translated: of the outer and inner three vehicles.🔽This is the pledge of the mind

original: padma'i rigs mchog dag pa yi //🔽byang chub chen po las byung ba'o //
analyzed: padma'i rigs mchog dag pa yi // byang chub chen po las byung ba'o //
translated: of the pure supreme lotus family.🔽I will hold all the vows

original: las kyi rigs mchog chen po la //🔽sdom pa thams cad rab ldan pa //
analyzed: las kyi rigs mchog chen po la // sdom pa thams cad rab ldan pa //
translated: of the great supreme karma family.

original: so sor yang dag gzung bar bgyi //
analyzed: so sor yang dag gzung bar bgyi //
translated: I will perform the activities🔽of the great supreme karma family.

original: mchod pa'i las kyang ci nus bgyi //
analyzed: mchod pa'i las kyang ci nus bgyi //
translated: I will perform the activities

original: las kyi rigs mchog chen po la'o //🔽bla na med pa'i byang chub sems //
analyzed: las kyi rigs mchog chen po la'o // bla na med pa'i byang chub sems //
translated: of the great supreme karma family.

original: bskyed par byas te bdag gis ni //
analyzed: bskyed par byas te bdag gis ni //
translated: I will generate the unsurpassed bodhicitta

original: sems can kun gyi don du ni //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don du ni //
translated: and for the sake of all sentient beings

original: sdom pa ma lus gzung bar bgyi //
analyzed: sdom pa ma lus gzung bar bgyi //
translated: I will hold all the vows.

original: ma rgal ba rnams bsgral bar bgyi //
analyzed: ma rgal ba rnams bsgral bar bgyi //
translated: I will liberate those not liberated🔽and

original: ma grol ba rnams bdag gis dgrol //
analyzed: ma grol ba rnams bdag gis dgrol //
translated: I shall liberate those not liberated.

original: dbugs ma byung ba dbugs dbyung ste //
analyzed: dbugs ma byung ba dbugs dbyung ste //
translated: I shall release the breath of those not breathing.

original: mya ngan 'das la sems can dgod //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das la sems can dgod //
translated: I shall place sentient beings in nirvana.

original: sdom pa gzung ba sngon du 'gro bas byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ste //
analyzed: sdom pa gzung ba sngon du 'gro bas byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ste //
translated: Having taken the vows as a preliminary, one should generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i rim pa 'dis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i rim pa 'dis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate by means of the five stages of manifest enlightenment.

original: dang por re zhig me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan gyi sbyor bas bsgom par bya ste /🔽ji ltar yongs su dag pa'i me long gi dkyil 'khor la de'i drung gi yul dang dus kyi dngos po'i rig pa rnams so sor snang ba de ltar shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa byang chub kyi sems chen po la 'gro
analyzed: dang por re zhig me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan gyi sbyor bas bsgom par bya ste / ji ltar yongs su dag pa'i me long gi dkyil 'khor la de'i drung gi yul dang dus kyi dngos po'i rig pa rnams so sor snang ba de ltar shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa byang chub kyi sems chen po la 'gro
translated: First, one should meditate by means of the application of the reflection of mirror-like pristine awareness.

original: ba dang yul dang skye gnas kyi dbye bas phye ba'i sems can gyi khams snang ste /
analyzed: ba dang yul dang skye gnas kyi dbye bas phye ba'i sems can gyi khams snang ste /
translated: Just as the cognitions of the things of the place and time in front of a completely pure mirror appear individually, in the same way, in the great mind of enlightenment, the natural outflow of the completely pure realm of reality, the world of sentient beings appears, divided by the categories of realm, destination, and birth.

original: de rnams shin tu dri ma med pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes de la yang bltas te de'i phyi nas sems can la dmigs pa'i snying rje bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams shin tu dri ma med pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes de la yang bltas te de'i phyi nas sems can la dmigs pa'i snying rje bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Having also looked at that mirror-like pristine wisdom which is completely stainless, one should generate compassion that focuses on sentient beings.

original: ae ma'o sems can 'di rnams mgon med pa /
analyzed: ae ma'o sems can 'di rnams mgon med pa /
translated: Oh! These sentient beings are without a protector,

original: skyabs med pa /
analyzed: skyabs med pa /
translated: without a refuge,

original: dpung gnyen med pas sdug bsngal ba rnams 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor bying ba de rnams kyi don du ji ltar bdag nyid ltar thams cad kyi thams cad du sdug bsngal las bsgral bar bya ste /
analyzed: dpung gnyen med pas sdug bsngal ba rnams 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor bying ba de rnams kyi don du ji ltar bdag nyid ltar thams cad kyi thams cad du sdug bsngal las bsgral bar bya ste /
translated: and without a defender. Therefore, those who are suffering and sinking in the ocean of cyclic existence are without a protector, without a refuge, and without a defender. For the sake of those who are sinking in the ocean of cyclic existence, just as I myself, I will liberate all of them from suffering.

original: ji ltar zug rdu can gyi sems can thams cad me long lta bu'i ye shes la sems can rnams kun rdzob tu snang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zug rdu can gyi sems can thams cad me long lta bu'i ye shes la sems can rnams kun rdzob tu snang bar bya'o //
translated: Just as all sentient beings who are afflicted by pain are reflected in the mirror-like pristine wisdom, so too sentient beings are reflected in the mirror-like pristine wisdom.

original: de nas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la mos par byas te /
analyzed: de nas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la mos par byas te /
translated: Then, having generated devotion in the pristine wisdom of equality,

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid du sbyor bas /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid du sbyor bas /
translated: one should apply all phenomena to the equality of selflessness.

original: ji ltar chos rnams stong @36b pa dang bdag med pa de ltar bdag kyang stong pa dang bdag med pa zhes bsgoms te /
analyzed: ji ltar chos rnams stong @36b pa dang bdag med pa de ltar bdag kyang stong pa dang bdag med pa zhes bsgoms te /
translated: Just as phenomena are empty and selfless, so too am I empty and selfless.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa la gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa la gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that all phenomena are selfless.

original: de skad kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad kyang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: bdag ci 'dra ba de 'drar sems can thams cad shes //
analyzed: bdag ci 'dra ba de 'drar sems can thams cad shes //
translated: Just as I am, so are all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad ci 'dra de 'drar chos kun shes //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ci 'dra de 'drar chos kun shes //
translated: Just as all sentient beings are, so are all phenomena.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: And so on.

original: / de nas chos thams cad bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pas chos la dmigs pa'i snying rje mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: / de nas chos thams cad bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pas chos la dmigs pa'i snying rje mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Then, by realizing that the nature of all phenomena is selfless, one should generate the wisdom of equanimity, which is compassion focused on phenomena.

original: de nas aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpanna tv'ata ces sngags brjod nas //
analyzed: de nas aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpanna tv'ata ces sngags brjod nas //
translated: Then, one should recite the mantra: “Akāra-mukhaṃ sarva-dharmāṇām adhyajñāna-utpattaye.”

original: ma lus par ni mdor bsdus te //
analyzed: ma lus par ni mdor bsdus te //
translated: In brief, all things are included in this.

original: sngags pa sngags don bsgoms nas su //
analyzed: sngags pa sngags don bsgoms nas su //
translated: The mantra practitioner, having contemplated the meaning of the mantra,

original: dmigs pa med dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: dmigs pa med dang lhan cig tu //
translated: together with the absence of objectification,

original: chos bdag med pa rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa rnam par bsgom //
translated: meditates on the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de ltar so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes de lta bu'i de ma thag pa nyid du dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: de ltar so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes de lta bu'i de ma thag pa nyid du dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'i rjes su song ba /
translated: Thus, immediately after such individually discerning gnosis, one should cultivate the gnosis of emptiness, the utterly pure expanse of reality, which is the gnosis of great compassion free from objectification,

original: gzung 'dzin kun las rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: gzung 'dzin kun las rnam par grol ba /
translated: free from all dualistic perception,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
translated: naturally luminous,

original: cha shas kyi rang bzhin las 'das pa /🔽shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid kyi ye shes bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: cha shas kyi rang bzhin las 'das pa / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid kyi ye shes bsgom par bya'o //
translated: beyond the nature of parts,🔽and beyond the nature of the extremes.

original: de nas yang sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa dang bral bas na rnal 'byor pas sngon gyi smon lam gyis bsgoms pa'i sems kyi rgyun gyi dbang gis langs te /
analyzed: de nas yang sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa dang bral bas na rnal 'byor pas sngon gyi smon lam gyis bsgoms pa'i sems kyi rgyun gyi dbang gis langs te /
translated: Then, since one is separated from the benefit of all sentient beings, the yogi/nī arises by the power of the stream of mind cultivated by the previous aspiration and

original: mi dmigs pa'i snying rje chen pos bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i snying rje chen pos bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes mngon du bya'o //
translated: should manifest the gnosis of successful activities with nonobjectifying great compassion.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes nyid kyi phyir de'i de nyid kyis sems can gyi don thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes nyid kyi phyir de'i de nyid kyis sems can gyi don thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Because it is the pure mundane gnosis that is attained subsequent to nonconceptual gnosis, it is by means of that gnosis that all the welfare of sentient beings is accomplished.

original: de'ang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par byang ba'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par byang ba'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: That is to be known as the bodhicitta of engagement, the bodhicitta of purification that has the nature of the relative and ultimate.

original: de nas rnal 'byor pas sems nyid sgyu ma'i rnam pa nam mkha'i phyogs su gnas pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba skar ma'i rnam pa 'dra ba'i aa bsams te /
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pas sems nyid sgyu ma'i rnam pa nam mkha'i phyogs su gnas pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba skar ma'i rnam pa 'dra ba'i aa bsams te /
translated: Then the practitioner should visualize the mind itself in the aspect of an illusion abiding in the space, naturally luminous, like the aspect of a star, an āḥ.

original: de las byung ba khro bo 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrigs pa sngon po mdog du ma'i 'od zer brgya stong gis yongs su bskor ba ming gzhan kun du bzang po mchog tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid yi ge h'um chen po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba khro bo 'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khrigs pa sngon po mdog du ma'i 'od zer brgya stong gis yongs su bskor ba ming gzhan kun du bzang po mchog tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid yi ge h'um chen po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: From that arises the great hūṃ, the nature of the wrathful one, surrounded by a garland of blazing light, blue in color, surrounded by hundreds of thousands of light rays of many colors, the nature of Samantabhadra, the essence of supreme joy.

original: yi ge h'um de las rnam pa du ma'i 'od rnams phyung ste /
analyzed: yi ge h'um de las rnam pa du ma'i 'od rnams phyung ste /
translated: Light rays of many forms emerge from that syllable hūṃ.

original: 'od kyi rtse mo de las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sprul nas /
analyzed: 'od kyi rtse mo de las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sprul nas /
translated: From the tips of those light rays, all tathāgatas emanate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du gshegs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du gshegs te /
translated: All those tathāgatas go to all buddhafields.

original: ma lus zhing lus pa @37a * //
analyzed: ma lus zhing lus pa @37a * //
translated: Without exception,

original: med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can gyi khams thams cad yang dag par sbyangs te /
analyzed: med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can gyi khams thams cad yang dag par sbyangs te /
translated: they purify the entire realm of sentient beings in all worlds without exception.

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa yang byas nas ji srid sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i bar yang bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa yang byas nas ji srid sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i bar yang bstan te /
translated: Having also generated the mind of enlightenment, and so on, they display all the emanations of all buddhas.

original: yang slar log nas ye ge h'um de la zhugs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: yang slar log nas ye ge h'um de la zhugs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Again, they return and enter that syllable hūṃ.

original: de las gyur pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog drug po mngon du dga' ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing drug tu khyab pas 'bar ba'i gzi brjid kyis bdud thams cad kyi dgras thub par dka' ba sgo drug la rtse lnga pa'i ye shes kyi
analyzed: de las gyur pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog drug po mngon du dga' ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing drug tu khyab pas 'bar ba'i gzi brjid kyis bdud thams cad kyi dgras thub par dka' ba sgo drug la rtse lnga pa'i ye shes kyi
translated: Since the six colors such as blue that arise from that pervade the six buddhafields, such as Abhirati, the blazing splendor is difficult to overcome by all māras.🔽

original: rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The six colors such as blue that arise from that pervade the six buddhafields such as Abhirati, and since they are difficult to overcome by all the enemies of Mara by the splendor of blazing, one should meditate on the five-peaked gnosis in the six doors.

original: de'i bum pa'i nang na gnas pa'i yi ge bhr'um dkar po bsam ste /
analyzed: de'i bum pa'i nang na gnas pa'i yi ge bhr'um dkar po bsam ste /
translated: One should think of the white syllable bhrum located inside that vase.

original: de las gyur pa'i rin po che sna bzhi'i rang bzhin stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi gzhal yas khang rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: de las gyur pa'i rin po che sna bzhi'i rang bzhin stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi gzhal yas khang rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: From that, one should meditate on the nature of the four types of jewels as the immeasurable palace of the world systems of a great billion world systems.

original: de'ang ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is it like?

original: gru chos kyi 'byung gnas /🔽de'i steng du yi ge aa las sna tshogs rdo rje /
analyzed: gru chos kyi 'byung gnas / de'i steng du yi ge aa las sna tshogs rdo rje /
translated: The base is the source of phenomena.

original: des kyang rdo rje'i dngos po mdog dkar po'i sa gzhir byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang rdo rje'i dngos po mdog dkar po'i sa gzhir byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: On top of that, from the syllable a, one should bless the vajra base as the ground of the nature of a white vajra.

original: de nas yi ge bhr'um gyis rtse mo rdo rje dang nor bu rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzhal yas khang rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: de nas yi ge bhr'um gyis rtse mo rdo rje dang nor bu rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzhal yas khang rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: Then, with the syllable bhrūṃ, one should visualize the peak as the palace of the multistoried jewel-gem, the immeasurable mansion.

original: de'ang ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is it like?

original: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
translated: It has four corners and four gates,

original: tva ra na bzhis brgyan pa'o //🔽dril bu dar dang 'phan la sogs //
analyzed: tva ra na bzhis brgyan pa'o // dril bu dar dang 'phan la sogs //
translated: adorned with four tvaṃs.🔽It is draped with bells, silk, and tassels,

original: me tog phreng dang rnga yab bklubs //
analyzed: me tog phreng dang rnga yab bklubs //
translated: garlanded with flower garlands and yak-tail whisks.🔽In all the corners and

original: grva mtshams dag ni thams cad dang // sgo khyams kyi ni mtshams su yang //
analyzed: grva mtshams dag ni thams cad dang // sgo khyams kyi ni mtshams su yang //
translated: in the intermediate directions of the porticoes,

original: rdo rje rin chen rnams dang ni //🔽zla gam rnams kyis yang dag brgyan //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen rnams dang ni // zla gam rnams kyis yang dag brgyan //
translated: it is adorned with vajras and jewels🔽and crescents.

original: dra ba dra phyed bkod pa la //
analyzed: dra ba dra phyed bkod pa la //
translated: It is arrayed with nets and half-nets,

original: sna tshogs gzugs kyis bklubs pa'o //🔽rdul tshon kha dog lnga yis kyang //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs kyis bklubs pa'o // rdul tshon kha dog lnga yis kyang //
translated: draped with various forms.🔽Also, the outer maṇḍala

original: phyi yi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
analyzed: phyi yi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
translated: is drawn with five-colored powders.

original: dkyil 'khor de yi gnas skabs su //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de yi gnas skabs su //
translated: In the place of that maṇḍala,

original: chud nas nang gi gzhal yas khang //
analyzed: chud nas nang gi gzhal yas khang //
translated: the inner immeasurable mansion

original: rdo rje dbyings zhes brjod pa ni //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings zhes brjod pa ni //
translated: is called the vajra realm.

original: de nas gnyis pa dgod par bya //
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa dgod par bya //
translated: Then, the second one should be arranged.

original: rdo rje phreng bas yongs bskor ba //
analyzed: rdo rje phreng bas yongs bskor ba //
translated: Surrounded by the Vajra-garland,

original: ka ba brgyad kyis rnam brgyan pa //
analyzed: ka ba brgyad kyis rnam brgyan pa //
translated: Adorned with eight pillars,

original: rdul tshon lnga po nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: rdul tshon lnga po nyid kyis ni //
translated: With the five-colored powders themselves

original: dra ba dra phyed la sogs bklubs //
analyzed: dra ba dra phyed la sogs bklubs //
translated: Draped with nets, half-nets, and so forth.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi ni phyi rol yang //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi ni phyi rol yang //
translated: Also outside the maṇḍala

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kun //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kun //
translated: All the characteristics as taught

original: khyad par du ni mdor bsdus nas /
analyzed: khyad par du ni mdor bsdus nas /
translated: Are summarized in particular

original: de yi nang du thams cad bya //
analyzed: de yi nang du thams cad bya //
translated: And everything is done within it.

original: sgo yi mtshams dang tva ra na //
analyzed: sgo yi mtshams dang tva ra na //
translated: The door-junctions and the tvaṣṭṛ

original: gcig nyid du ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid du ni mi bya'o //
translated: Should not be made into one.

original: de phyir de yi sgo rnams ni //
analyzed: de phyir de yi sgo rnams ni //
translated: Therefore, the doors of that

original: tva ra na rnams brtag mi bya //
analyzed: tva ra na rnams brtag mi bya //
translated: Should not be considered as tvaṣṭṛ.

original: go rims bzhin du lha rnams kyi //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du lha rnams kyi //
translated: The seats of the deities

original: gdan ni phyi nas dgod par bya //
analyzed: gdan ni phyi nas dgod par bya //
translated: Should be placed outside in order.

original: lha rnams ji bzhin @37b rim pas so //
analyzed: lha rnams ji bzhin @37b rim pas so //
translated: In accordance with the deities,

original: de nas dbus su bkod pa nyid //
analyzed: de nas dbus su bkod pa nyid //
translated: Then arranged in the center

original: gtso bo yi ni gdan yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo yi ni gdan yin no //
translated: Is the seat of the principal one.

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs kun la //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs kun la //
translated: In all directions beginning with the east

original: mi bskyod la sogs rnams kyi gdan //
analyzed: mi bskyod la sogs rnams kyi gdan //
translated: The seats of Akṣobhya and so forth

original: rang gi sa bon las grub pa //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las grub pa //
translated: Are accomplished from their own seed syllables,

original: sbyor ba'i rim pas brtag par bya //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rim pas brtag par bya //
translated: Contemplated through the stages of union.

original: de la gdan rnams brtag pa ni dbus su seng ge'i gdan dang / shar du glang po che'i gdan dang / lho ru rta'i gdan dang / nub tu rma bya'i gdan dang / byang du nam mkha' lding gi gdan zhes so //
analyzed: de la gdan rnams brtag pa ni dbus su seng ge'i gdan dang / shar du glang po che'i gdan dang / lho ru rta'i gdan dang / nub tu rma bya'i gdan dang / byang du nam mkha' lding gi gdan zhes so //
translated: The examination of the seats is as follows: a lion seat in the center, an elephant seat in the east, a horse seat in the south, a peacock seat in the west, and a garuḍa seat in the north.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nas brtsams te rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi yi ge aa las bskyed pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nas brtsams te rdo rje 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi yi ge aa las bskyed pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: One should visualize the moon maṇḍalas generated from the letter A, beginning with Vajrasattva and ending with Vajra Arapacana.

original: de nas yang gtso bo'i gdan la yi ge aa las yongs su bskyed pa'i rnam par snang mdzad chen po'o //
analyzed: de nas yang gtso bo'i gdan la yi ge aa las yongs su bskyed pa'i rnam par snang mdzad chen po'o //
translated: Then, on the principal seat, one should visualize Mahāvairocana generated from the letter A.

original: gang gi phyir sems gang yin pa kho na gzung ba la sogs pa dang bral bas chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems gang yin pa kho na gzung ba la sogs pa dang bral bas chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Because the mind itself, free from grasping and so forth, is the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: de nyid zhal bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid zhal bzhi pa ste /
translated: That [mind] itself is four-faced,

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhi'o //
translated: the four liberations beginning with emptiness.

original: chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin thams cad rab tu skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sku mdog dkar po'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin thams cad rab tu skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sku mdog dkar po'o //
translated: He is white in color because he is the cause for the generation of all meditative concentrations by his very focus on the sphere of reality.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ral pa'i dbu rgyan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ral pa'i dbu rgyan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He has a crown of matted locks because he is of the nature of the sphere of reality.

original: zhi ba'i sems nyid kyi phyir sku la rgyan mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i sems nyid kyi phyir sku la rgyan mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: He is unadorned because of his very peaceful mind.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: He has the mudra of supreme enlightenment because he is the very embodiment of method and wisdom.

original: / de lta bu'i dngos po rnam par snang mdzad chen por bdag nyid mos par bya ste /
analyzed: / de lta bu'i dngos po rnam par snang mdzad chen por bdag nyid mos par bya ste /
translated: One should imagine oneself in this way as Great Vairocana.

original: sangs rgyas bzhi'i gdan gyi sbyor bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhi'i gdan gyi sbyor bas so //
translated: By the yoga of the four buddha seats.

original: de'i thugs kar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na yi ge dh'i:las yongs su bskyed pa'i bcom ldan 'das dang po'i sangs rgyas zhal lnga pa gtsug phud lnga dang ldan pa de nyid kyi phyir ;
analyzed: de'i thugs kar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na yi ge dh'i:las yongs su bskyed pa'i bcom ldan 'das dang po'i sangs rgyas zhal lnga pa gtsug phud lnga dang ldan pa de nyid kyi phyir ;
translated: In his heart, on a moon disc, from the syllable dhiḥ, is the Blessed Original Buddha, five-faced and five-crested.

original: gdong lnga gtsug phud lnga dang ldan //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gdong lnga gtsug phud lnga dang ldan // zhes gsungs so //
translated: He has five faces and five topknots.

original: mdog lnga dang ldan te de nyid dang 'brel ba'i gtsug phud lnga pa'i zur phud can no //
analyzed: mdog lnga dang ldan te de nyid dang 'brel ba'i gtsug phud lnga pa'i zur phud can no //
translated: He has five colors and five topknots, which are connected to those faces.

original: shar sngon po /🔽lhor ser po /
analyzed: shar sngon po / lhor ser po /
translated: The east face is blue.🔽The south face is yellow.

original: nub dmar po /
analyzed: nub dmar po /
translated: The west face is red.

original: byang ljang gu /
analyzed: byang ljang gu /
translated: The north face is green.

original: dbu steng na rta mchog gi zhal bzhin du gnas pa'i zhal dkar po zhi ba byis pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan ba ;
analyzed: dbu steng na rta mchog gi zhal bzhin du gnas pa'i zhal dkar po zhi ba byis pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan ba ;
translated: The face above the head is white, peaceful, and adorned with the ornaments of a child.

original: sgeg pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sgeg pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He is handsome.

original: sna tshogs kyi na bza' mnabs pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi na bza' mnabs pa /
translated: He wears a variegated garment.

original: phyag brgyad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa kha bzhir bgos nas phyag bzhis thugs kar yang dag par par 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag brgyad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa kha bzhir bgos nas phyag bzhis thugs kar yang dag par par 'dzin pa /
translated: He has eight arms. He holds the Perfection of Wisdom in Four Hundred Verses divided into four parts in his four hands at his heart.

original: phyag gzhan bzhis ni shes rab kyi ral gri 'debs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag gzhan bzhis ni shes rab kyi ral gri 'debs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa /
translated: He holds a wisdom sword in his other four hands in the manner of striking.

original: sangs rgyas bzhi'i gdan gyi sbyor @38a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhi'i gdan gyi sbyor @38a * //
translated: He sits on a seat of four buddhas.

original: bas bzhugs pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: bas bzhugs pa bsgom mo //
translated: Meditate on him.

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bcu gnyis nye bar mtshon pa /
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bcu gnyis nye bar mtshon pa /
translated: Here the twelve levels of the tathāgatas are illustrated.

original: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcad //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcad //
translated: The Lord of Words has composed the verse.

original: ces pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: ces pa dang 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing //
translated: Endowed with the six kings of mantra.

original: zhes pa ni phyis 'byung ba'i sngags drug dang ldan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyis 'byung ba'i sngags drug dang ldan pa la bya'o //
translated: This refers to being endowed with the six mantras that will come later.

original: bdag nyid ci zhe na /🔽gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // zhes pa la /
analyzed: bdag nyid ci zhe na / gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // zhes pa la /
translated: What is its nature?🔽Arising non-dually.

original: gnyis ni gzung 'dzin no //
analyzed: gnyis ni gzung 'dzin no //
translated: The two are subject and object.

original: de med pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is non-duality.

original: de las 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Arising from that is birth.

original: gnyis su med par 'byung ba ni gnyis su med par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med par 'byung ba ni gnyis su med par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Arising non-dually is non-dual arising.

original: tshigs bcad gang la yod pa de ni gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i tshigs bcad do //
analyzed: tshigs bcad gang la yod pa de ni gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i tshigs bcad do //
translated: The verse that has that is the verse endowed with non-dual arising.

original: gzhan yang khyad par ci 'dra zhe na /🔽mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyad par ci 'dra zhe na / mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa //
translated: What other distinctions does it have?🔽This is said to be the nature of non-arising.

original: zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means the nature of the dharmadhatu and the nature of emptiness.

original: 'di gsungs pa zhes pa ni bshad pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di gsungs pa zhes pa ni bshad pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, “It is taught.”

original: dpal rdo rje snying po rgyan gyi rgyud las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bcu gnyis su gsungs te /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje snying po rgyan gyi rgyud las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bcu gnyis su gsungs te /
translated: The Śrīvajra-garbha-vyūha-tantra teaches the twelve stages of the tathāgatas.

original: kun du 'od kyi sa chen po'o //
analyzed: kun du 'od kyi sa chen po'o //
translated: The stage of universal light is the great stage.

original: de ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'dra //
analyzed: de ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'dra //
translated: It is like the orb of the sun.

original: bdud rtsi 'od ni gnyis pa ste //
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'od ni gnyis pa ste //
translated: The stage of nectar light is the second.

original: shin tu 'od gsal zla ba 'dra //
analyzed: shin tu 'od gsal zla ba 'dra //
translated: It is like a very clear moon.

original: nam mkha'i 'od ni gsum pa ste //
analyzed: nam mkha'i 'od ni gsum pa ste //
translated: The stage of sky light is the third.

original: nam mkha'i gzhi bzhin rab tu gnas //
analyzed: nam mkha'i gzhi bzhin rab tu gnas //
translated: It is like the foundation of space.

original: rdo rje 'od ni bzhi pa ste //
analyzed: rdo rje 'od ni bzhi pa ste //
translated: The stage of vajra light is the fourth.

original: sa de 'od ni dga' ba'o //🔽lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan sbyor bas //
analyzed: sa de 'od ni dga' ba'o // lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan sbyor bas //
translated: The light of this stage is joy.🔽It is designated as vajra

original: rdo rje zhes ni yongs su brtags //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes ni yongs su brtags //
translated: because it is the application of firm intention.

original: lnga pa rin 'od ces bya ba //
analyzed: lnga pa rin 'od ces bya ba //
translated: The fifth is called jewel light.

original: dbang bskur ba la rab tu gnas //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la rab tu gnas //
translated: It is the stage of consecration.

original: padma'i 'od ces drug pa ste //
analyzed: padma'i 'od ces drug pa ste //
translated: The sixth is called lotus light.

original: padma bzhin du rab tu skye //
analyzed: padma bzhin du rab tu skye //
translated: It is like a lotus.

original: rang bzhin dag pa chos nyid phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pa chos nyid phyir //
translated: Because its nature is pure,

original: dri ma med cing yongs 'dzin med //
analyzed: dri ma med cing yongs 'dzin med //
translated: it is stainless and without grasping.

original: bdun pa las kyi 'od ces pa //
analyzed: bdun pa las kyi 'od ces pa //
translated: The seventh is called karma light.

original: sangs rgyas phrin las byed par 'dod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phrin las byed par 'dod //
translated: They wish to perform the deeds of the Buddha.

original: brgyad pa dpe med ces bya ba //
analyzed: brgyad pa dpe med ces bya ba //
translated: The eighth is called Incomparable.

original: de la dpe ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la dpe ni yod ma yin //
translated: There is no example for it.

original: dpe ldan zhes pa dgu pa ste //
analyzed: dpe ldan zhes pa dgu pa ste //
translated: The ninth is called Having an Example,

original: thams cad dpe ni so sor rtogs //
analyzed: thams cad dpe ni so sor rtogs //
translated: because all examples are individually discerned.

original: bcu pa shes rab 'od ces pa //
analyzed: bcu pa shes rab 'od ces pa //
translated: The tenth is called Light of Wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas sa ni bla na med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sa ni bla na med //
translated: the stage of the Buddha, unsurpassed.

original: bcu gcig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid //
analyzed: bcu gcig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid //
translated: The eleventh is called Omniscience,

original: sa chen rab tu 'od gsal ba //
analyzed: sa chen rab tu 'od gsal ba //
translated: the great stage, very radiant.

original: bcu gnyis so sor rig pa pa //
analyzed: bcu gnyis so sor rig pa pa //
translated: The twelfth is called Individual Awareness,

original: rnal 'byor ye shes rab tu rdzogs //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ye shes rab tu rdzogs //
translated: the perfection of the wisdom of yoga.

original: zhes so // de rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bcu gnyis aa la sogs pa'i sgra'i yi ge bcu gnyis su yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bcu gnyis aa la sogs pa'i sgra'i yi ge bcu gnyis su yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be known as the twelve stages of the transcendent lords, completely perfected in the twelve syllables beginning with “a.”

original: dus gsum bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: dus gsum bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: The buddhas of the three times

original: zhes @38b pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zhes @38b pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
translated: are those of the past, future, and present.

original: thugs la gnas lnga ni zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs la gnas lnga ni zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five places in the heart are because of being located in the hearts of all tathāgatas.

original: ye shes kyi sku zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The wisdom body is because of being the nature of the wisdom body.

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha is because of realizing the meaning of things as they are.

original: da ni dang po'i sangs rgyas de'i thugs kar shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dang po'i sangs rgyas de'i thugs kar shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Now, the wheel of wisdom should be meditated on in the heart of that first buddha.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig gsungs she na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the one that teaches the meaning of dependent origination.

original: de bzhin yang bshad pa //
analyzed: de bzhin yang bshad pa //
translated: It is also explained as follows:

original: rtsibs kyi lte ba yang dag 'dzin //
analyzed: rtsibs kyi lte ba yang dag 'dzin //
translated: The hub is the perfect retention

original: rtsibs rnams lte ba la yang brten /🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung sbyor bar //
analyzed: rtsibs rnams lte ba la yang brten / rten cing 'brel par 'byung sbyor bar //
translated: The spokes are based on the hub.

original: 'khor lo 'di ni rab tu bskor //
analyzed: 'khor lo 'di ni rab tu bskor //
translated: This wheel is fully turned🔽By the application of dependent origination.

original: zhes so // yi ge aas bskyed pa'i kha dog drug dang ldan pa rtsibs drug pa /
analyzed: zhes so // yi ge aas bskyed pa'i kha dog drug dang ldan pa rtsibs drug pa /
translated: It has six colors generated by the syllable A, with six spokes,

original: mu khyud bzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mu khyud bzhi dang ldan pa /
translated: and four concentric circles.

original: shin tu bkod pa'i lte ba de'i dkyil na yi ge aa bsams te /
analyzed: shin tu bkod pa'i lte ba de'i dkyil na yi ge aa bsams te /
translated: In the center of that very well-arranged hub, one should imagine the syllable A.

original: bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i sngags la sogs pa sngags rnams mu khyud bzhi la mdog dkar po kho na bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i sngags la sogs pa sngags rnams mu khyud bzhi la mdog dkar po kho na bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize the mantras, such as the root mantra of the wisdom-being Bhagavat, on the four circular bands, all of them white in color.

original: de la dang po'i mu khyud la /
analyzed: de la dang po'i mu khyud la /
translated: On the first circular band,🔽one should visualize the following:

original: aom sarba dharm'a aa bh'a ba sva bh'a ba bi shuddha badzra aa a'a aam aa:/
analyzed: aom sarba dharm'a aa bh'a ba sva bh'a ba bi shuddha badzra aa a'a aam aa:/
translated: Om sarva-dharmâbhâva-svabhâva-viśuddha-vajra-a ā aṃ āḥ.

original: de'i phyir rol du mu khyud gnyis pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bcu gnyis brjod pa'i sgra'i yi ge bcu gnyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rol du mu khyud gnyis pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bcu gnyis brjod pa'i sgra'i yi ge bcu gnyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: On the second circular band, which is outside of that, one should visualize the twelve syllables that express the twelve stages of the Tathâgata.

original: de nas dang po'i lce nas brtsams nas ji tsam du sngags drug po bkod pa'i rigs kyi mdog rim par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dang po'i lce nas brtsams nas ji tsam du sngags drug po bkod pa'i rigs kyi mdog rim par bya'o //
translated: Then, beginning from the first tongue, one should arrange the six mantras in order according to the color of the family.

original: 'di ltar ste dang po la aom badzra t'i kshn'a ya te na ma:/
analyzed: 'di ltar ste dang po la aom badzra t'i kshn'a ya te na ma:/
translated: It is as follows: On the first, Om vajra-tīkṣṇa-ayate namaḥ.

original: gnyis pa la aom du: kha tstshe d'a ya te na ma:/
analyzed: gnyis pa la aom du: kha tstshe d'a ya te na ma:/
translated: On the second, Om duḥkha-ccheda-ayate namaḥ.

original: gsum pa la aom pradzny'a dzny'a na m'urt'a ya te na ma:/
analyzed: gsum pa la aom pradzny'a dzny'a na m'urt'a ya te na ma:/
translated: On the third, Om prajñā-jñāna-mūrta-ayate namaḥ.

original: bzhi pa la aom dzny'a na k'a y'a ya te na ma:/
analyzed: bzhi pa la aom dzny'a na k'a y'a ya te na ma:/
translated: On the fourth, oṃ jñāna kāyāya namo.

original: lnga pa la aom b'a g'i shva r'a ya te na ma:/
analyzed: lnga pa la aom b'a g'i shva r'a ya te na ma:/
translated: On the fifth, oṃ vāgīśvarāya namo.

original: drug pa la aom aa ra pa tsa n'a ya te na ma:/
analyzed: drug pa la aom aa ra pa tsa n'a ya te na ma:/
translated: On the sixth, oṃ arpaṇacannāya namo.

original: 'khor lo'i phyi rol mu khyud la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku'i phreng ba'i sngags bkod de /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i phyi rol mu khyud la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku'i phreng ba'i sngags bkod de /
translated: On the outer rim of the wheel, arrange the mantra garland of the Blessed One, the gnosis body of all tathāgatas.

original: aa a'a:aom sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya /
analyzed: aa a'a:aom sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya /
translated: A ā oṃ sarva tathāgata hrīḥ

original: ha ra ha ra /
analyzed: ha ra ha ra /
translated: hara hara

original: aom h'um hr'i:bha ga w'an /
analyzed: aom h'um hr'i:bha ga w'an /
translated: oṃ hūṃ hrīḥ bhagavān

original: dzny'a na m'urti /
analyzed: dzny'a na m'urti /
translated: jñānamūrti

original: b'a g'i shva ra ;
analyzed: b'a g'i shva ra ;
translated: vāgīśvara

original: ma h'a w'a tsa /
analyzed: ma h'a w'a tsa /
translated: mahāvāca

original: sarba dharm'a ga ga na aa ma la su pa ri shuddha dharma dh'a tu dzny'a na garbha a'a:/
analyzed: sarba dharm'a ga ga na aa ma la su pa ri shuddha dharma dh'a tu dzny'a na garbha a'a:/
translated: sarva dharma gagana amala supariśuddha dharmadhātu jñāna garbha āḥ

original: phyi rol gyi mu khyud gnyis pa la ka la sogs pa ha'i mthar thug pa'i yi ge dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mu khyud gnyis pa la ka la sogs pa ha'i mthar thug pa'i yi ge dgod par bya'o //
translated: On the second outer rim, arrange the letters from ka up to ha.

original: de ni 'khor lo'i sngags dgod pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'khor lo'i sngags dgod pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: That is the procedure for arranging the wheel's mantras.

original: 'khor lo de'i dbus na gnas pa'i yi ge aa las bskyed @39a * //
analyzed: 'khor lo de'i dbus na gnas pa'i yi ge aa las bskyed @39a * //
translated: In the center of that wheel, generate the letter a.

original: ba'i bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa' zhal drug pa /
analyzed: ba'i bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa' zhal drug pa /
translated: The Bhagavat Jñānasattva is six-faced.

original: ston ka'i zla ba'i mdog can /
analyzed: ston ka'i zla ba'i mdog can /
translated: He is the color of the autumn moon.

original: aindra n'i la mchog gi gtsug phud nyi ma 'char ka'i dkyil ltar 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyis bskor ba /
analyzed: aindra n'i la mchog gi gtsug phud nyi ma 'char ka'i dkyil ltar 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyis bskor ba /
translated: He has a crest of the supreme sapphire, and is surrounded by a halo of light like the orb of the rising sun.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyan gyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyan gyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa//
translated: He is absorbed in the samādhi of the ornament of the nature of all tathāgatas.

original: sna tshogs padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: He sits on a multicolored lotus seat.

original: phyag gnyis kyis autpala dmar po dang autpala sngon po gnyis la brten nas gnas pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam gnyis 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis kyis autpala dmar po dang autpala sngon po gnyis la brten nas gnas pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam gnyis 'dzin pa /
translated: With his two hands he holds two volumes of the Prajñāpāramitā resting on red and blue lotuses.

original: zhi ba'i tshul dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid bsams te /
analyzed: zhi ba'i tshul dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid bsams te /
translated: He is imagined to have a peaceful demeanor.

original: de'i thugs kar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de'i thugs kar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms nas /
translated: At his heart one should visualize a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i byed rgyu /
analyzed: de'i steng du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i byed rgyu /
translated: Upon that is the cause of the arising of the gnosis of omniscience, which is the nature of the Prajñāpāramitā.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad bskyed par gyur pa /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad bskyed par gyur pa /
translated: It is the source of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su gyur pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su gyur pa /
translated: It is the accumulation of merit and wisdom of all great bodhisattvas.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes thams cad kyi byed rgyur gyur pa'i ye ge aa bkod de /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes thams cad kyi byed rgyur gyur pa'i ye ge aa bkod de /
translated: It is the cause of all ultimate wisdom.

original: de nas 'khor lo la gnas pa'i sngags kyi yi ge gang yin pa rnams ji ltar gsungs pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa shin tu rnam par bkod pa mi shes pa'i ri bo 'joms par nus pa'i 'od dang ldan par bsgoms te /
analyzed: de nas 'khor lo la gnas pa'i sngags kyi yi ge gang yin pa rnams ji ltar gsungs pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa shin tu rnam par bkod pa mi shes pa'i ri bo 'joms par nus pa'i 'od dang ldan par bsgoms te /
translated: Then, the mantra syllables that are on the wheel are visualized as having the colors as taught, very well arranged, and endowed with light that is able to destroy the mountain of ignorance.

original: 'od de rnams kyis rang gi lus la snang bar byed pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'od de rnams kyis rang gi lus la snang bar byed pa bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on those lights illuminating one’s body.

original: 'od kyis snang bar byas ma thag tu zhal bzhi las phyung ste /
analyzed: 'od kyis snang bar byas ma thag tu zhal bzhi las phyung ste /
translated: As soon as one is illuminated by the light, one should emerge from the four faces.

original: mi mjed 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: mi mjed 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byas nas /
translated: Having illuminated the Sahā world,

original: de nas rdo rje'i sgo drug nas 'od zer kha dog drug phyung ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i sgo drug nas 'od zer kha dog drug phyung ste /
translated: then six-colored light rays emerge from the six vajra doors.

original: nam mkha'i khams thams cad du khyab pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su song nas ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi don byas nas /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams thams cad du khyab pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su song nas ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi don byas nas /
translated: Since it pervades the entire realm of space, it goes to various buddhafields and performs the welfare of sentient beings without exception or remainder.
