analyzed: chen po yang de yin la sgyu 'phrul dga' bas dga' ba yang de nyid yin pas sgyu 'phrul chen po dga' bas dga'o //
translated: It is the great illusion, since it is the great illusion, and it is the accomplishment of the aim of the illusion, since it is the accomplishment of the aim of the illusion.🔽It is the great illusion, since it is the great illusion, and it is the accomplishment of the aim of the illusion, since it is the accomplishment of the aim of the illusion.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po mig 'phrul can ni rdo rje khu tshur ro //🔽mig 'phrul can ni sprul pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po mig 'phrul can ni rdo rje khu tshur ro //🔽mig 'phrul can ni sprul pa'i tshogs te /
translated: It is the great illusion, since it is the great illusion, and it

original: sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnams gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnams gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The vajras of body, speech, and mind are united as one.

original: de mkhyen pa ni mig 'phrul can no //
analyzed: de mkhyen pa ni mig 'phrul can no //
translated: The knowledge of that is the magician.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po yang de nyid yin la mig 'phrul can yang de nyid yin pas sgyu 'phrul chen po mig 'phrul can no //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po yang de nyid yin la mig 'phrul can yang de nyid yin pas sgyu 'phrul chen po mig 'phrul can no //
translated: That is the great magic, and that is the magician, so it is the great magic, the magician.

original: 'di la ni dam pa'i chos kyi tshig yin pa'i phyir na ring po med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni dam pa'i chos kyi tshig yin pa'i phyir na ring po med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that there is no long-term retention, because it is a phrase of the sublime Dharma.

original: de rnams kyang bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes la brten pa dang / rdo rje la sogs pa bzhi'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams kyang bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes la brten pa dang / rdo rje la sogs pa bzhi'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Those are based on the knowledge of successful activities and have the nature of the four vajras and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa gnas gyur pa'i bdag nyid bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes su gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa gnas gyur pa'i bdag nyid bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes su gnas pa ste /
translated: The nature of the transformation of the eye consciousness and so on is the knowledge of successful activities.

original: @45a * // ji skad gsungs pa'i phyin ci log spangs pa'i sgo nas bde bar gshegs pa kun mchod pa dang / mngon par srung bar byed pa dang / bgegs nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang / sku la sogs pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: @45a * // ji skad gsungs pa'i phyin ci log spangs pa'i sgo nas bde bar gshegs pa kun mchod pa dang / mngon par srung bar byed pa dang / bgegs nye bar zhi bar byed pa dang / sku la sogs pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: It is the worship of all the sugatas through abandoning the errors as they are taught, the protection of the teachings, the pacification of obstacles, and the emptiness of body and so on.

original: ye shes byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje la sogs pa de rnams kyi las kyi las kyi go rims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje la sogs pa de rnams kyi las kyi las kyi go rims zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is the agent of pristine wisdom, and for that very reason, those vajra and so on are called the sequence of actions of the actions.

original: de bzhin du ser sna dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / mi bzod pa dang / le lo rnams kyi gnyen po'i phyogs nyid kyis de nyid sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du ser sna dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / mi bzod pa dang / le lo rnams kyi gnyen po'i phyogs nyid kyis de nyid sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Likewise, because of being the very antidote to stinginess, immorality, impatience, and laziness, it is the very nature of the perfections of generosity, morality, patience, and effort.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo ste //
analyzed: sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo ste //
translated: The great donor, the chief,

original: tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog / bzod chen 'chang ba brtan pa po //
analyzed: tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog / bzod chen 'chang ba brtan pa po //
translated: The great morality, the supreme holder, the great patience, the steadfast,

original: brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin //
translated: The great effort, the one of perseverance.

original: zhes so // de la ;
analyzed: zhes so // de la ;
translated: Therein,

original: sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo ste //
analyzed: sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo ste //
translated: The great donor, the chief,

original: zhes pa rdo rje sgeg mo'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje sgeg mo'o //
translated: is Vajra Lāsya.

original: mchod pa dang rjes su 'dzin pa'i 'dod pa'i sbyin pas na sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang rjes su 'dzin pa'i 'dod pa'i sbyin pas na sbyin pa'o //
translated: Because of the gift of desire of worship and maintenance, it is generosity.

original: sbyin pa de'i bdag po ni sbyin bdag ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa de'i bdag po ni sbyin bdag ste /
translated: The lord of that generosity is the donor.

original: sbyin bdag de yin la chen po yang de yin pas na sbyin bdag chen po ste /
analyzed: sbyin bdag de yin la chen po yang de yin pas na sbyin bdag chen po ste /
translated: Since he is the donor and also great, he is the great donor.

original: zang zing dang / skyabs dang / chos dang / dbang bskur ba'i bdag nyid sbyin la zhig gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zang zing dang / skyabs dang / chos dang / dbang bskur ba'i bdag nyid sbyin la zhig gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he gives the gift of material things, protection, the Dharma, and consecration.

original: de'i phyir gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtso bo ste /
translated: Therefore, he is the chief,

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi rab kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi rab kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is the best in the entire world.

original: tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog ni rdo rje phreng ba ma'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog ni rdo rje phreng ba ma'o //
translated: The supreme upholder of great morality is Vajra-Avali.

original: lus ngag yid gsum mnyam par gzhag pas na tshul khrims ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes pa'i skad kyi dbyings zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum mnyam par gzhag pas na tshul khrims ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes pa'i skad kyi dbyings zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Morality is meditative concentration, because body, speech, and mind are in meditative concentration.

original: mi dge ba bcu spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / so sor thar pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / so sor thar pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The meaning of the verbal root is as follows: Morality has the nature of abandoning the ten nonvirtues and the nature of the pratimoksha vows.

original: de dag 'dzin pas na tshul khrims 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de dag 'dzin pas na tshul khrims 'chang ba'o //
translated: Since he upholds them, he is the upholder of morality.

original: chen po yang de yin la tshul khrims 'chang ba yang de nyid yin pas tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la tshul khrims 'chang ba yang de nyid yin pas tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is the great one who upholds morality, because he is the great one and he upholds morality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ste mngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //🔽bzod chen 'chang ba brtan pa po ni rdo rje dbyangs len ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ste mngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro // bzod chen 'chang ba brtan pa po ni rdo rje dbyangs len ma'o //
translated: He is the supreme one, because he is the foremost.🔽He is the one who upholds great patience, because he is firm, like Vajraghantā.

original: sran tshugs par byas pas na bzod pa ste /
analyzed: sran tshugs par byas pas na bzod pa ste /
translated: Patience is the endurance of great suffering.

original: de 'dzin pas na bzod pa 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na bzod pa 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is the one who upholds patience, because he holds it.

original: chen po yang de nyid yin la bzod pa yang de nyid yin pas na bzod chen 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de nyid yin la bzod pa yang de nyid yin pas na bzod chen 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is the one who upholds great patience, because he is the great one and he upholds patience.

original: de nyid kyang brtan po ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyang brtan po ste /
translated: He is the firm one,

original: sdug bsngal chen po la brtan par sran thub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po la brtan par sran thub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is patient with great suffering.

original: brtson @45b 'grus chen po brtul ba yin ni rdo rje gar ma'o //
analyzed: brtson @45b 'grus chen po brtul ba yin ni rdo rje gar ma'o //
translated: He is the one who is resolute in great effort, because he is like Vajratāṇḍava.

original: brtson 'grus che ba ni dge ba la spro ba ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus che ba ni dge ba la spro ba ste /
translated: Great effort is the enthusiasm for virtue.

original: sdig pa la sogs pa la spro ba ni dam pa'i phyir na le lo nyid de brtson 'grus ma yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa la sogs pa la spro ba ni dam pa'i phyir na le lo nyid de brtson 'grus ma yin no //
translated: The enthusiasm for evil, etc., is laziness, not effort, because it is not supreme.

original: de'i brtul ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //🔽de'i phyir gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi'i bdag nyid go rims bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa las grub par rang gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnam par dag pa'i stobs kyis lhun gyis grub pa mngon par dga' ba'i khyad par du gyur par
analyzed: de'i brtul ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o // de'i phyir gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi'i bdag nyid go rims bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa las grub par rang gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnam par dag pa'i stobs kyis lhun gyis grub pa mngon par dga' ba'i khyad par du gyur par
translated: Its practice is to perfect all the roots of virtue, mundane and supramundane.

original: byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the four secret offerings are accomplished from the mirror-like pristine awareness, etc., in order, by the power of the purification of one's own door of liberation, and one is caused to become distinguished by spontaneous, superior joy.

original: de nyid shes rab 'chal pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam med pa dang / nyam chung ba rnams dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa la dga' ba nyid kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid shes rab 'chal pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam med pa dang / nyam chung ba rnams dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa la dga' ba nyid kyis gsungs pa /
translated: That very [joy] is taught to be for those who are not of deficient wisdom, who are not distracted, who have correct aspirations, who are not weak, and who delight in the subjugation of adverse factors.

original: bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas //
translated: Abiding in the great meditative stabilization,

original: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba //
analyzed: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba //
translated: Embodying the great wisdom,

original: stobs po che la thabs che ba //
analyzed: stobs po che la thabs che ba //
translated: The great strength, the great means,

original: smon lam ye shes rgya mtsho che //
analyzed: smon lam ye shes rgya mtsho che //
translated: The great ocean of aspiration and intuition.

original: zhes pa'o // de la tshigs bcad 'di la ni bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis bsnor bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de la tshigs bcad 'di la ni bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis bsnor bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, in this verse, concentration and insight are to be understood as a pair.

original: de'i phyir na don 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na don 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba ni rdo rje bdug pa ma'o //
analyzed: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba ni rdo rje bdug pa ma'o //
translated: The one who holds the body of great insight is Vajra Dhūpā.

original: shes rab chen po ni shes rab chen po ste /
analyzed: shes rab chen po ni shes rab chen po ste /
translated: Great insight is great insight.

original: de nyid kyi lus de 'dzin pas na shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi lus de 'dzin pas na shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba'o //
translated: Since she holds that very body, she is the one who holds the body of great insight.

original: bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas ni rdo rje me tog ma'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas ni rdo rje me tog ma'o //
translated: The one who abides in the concentration of great concentration is Vajra Puṣpā.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Concentration is the characteristic of a one-pointed mind.

original: de la brten pas na ting 'dzin gnas te /
analyzed: de la brten pas na ting 'dzin gnas te /
translated: Since she abides in that, she is the one who abides in concentration.

original: che ba yang de yin la bsam gtan yang de nyid yin pas na bsam gtan chen po'o //
analyzed: che ba yang de yin la bsam gtan yang de nyid yin pas na bsam gtan chen po'o //
translated: Since she is great and also a concentration, she is a great concentration.

original: chen po ni bsam gtan bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: chen po ni bsam gtan bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: She is great because she has the nature of the four concentrations.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //
translated: She abides in the concentration of those four concentrations.

original: smon lam ni rdo rje mar me'o //
analyzed: smon lam ni rdo rje mar me'o //
translated: The vow is Vajrapradīpā.

original: smon par byed pas na smon lam ste /
analyzed: smon par byed pas na smon lam ste /
translated: It is a vow because it vows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas are born by the power of their vows.

original: thabs che ba ni rdo rje dri chab ma'o //
analyzed: thabs che ba ni rdo rje dri chab ma'o //
translated: The great means is Vajra-gandhā.

original: chen po yang de yin la thabs kyang de yin pas thabs che ba ste /
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la thabs kyang de yin pas thabs che ba ste /
translated: It is great and it is a means, thus it is a great means.

original: thabs nyid dbang gis ma lus shing mi lus pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi re ba dang bsam pa ji lta ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid ni shes rab dang / @46a * //
analyzed: thabs nyid dbang gis ma lus shing mi lus pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi re ba dang bsam pa ji lta ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro // de nyid ni shes rab dang / @46a * //
translated: It is a means because it fulfills the hopes and wishes of the entire world without exception, by the power of its means.🔽That is the nature of the four outer offerings, characterized by the perfections of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan dang / smon lam dang / thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyis phyi'i mchod pa'i bdag nyid bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / smon lam dang / thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyis phyi'i mchod pa'i bdag nyid bzhi rnams so //
translated: meditative concentration, vow, and means.🔽The path with its enjoyment is the cause of delight. The two perfections of power and

original: longs spyod dang bcas pa'i lam la dga' ba'i rgyu'i dngos pos stobs dang / ye shes gnyis kyi chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir /
analyzed: longs spyod dang bcas pa'i lam la dga' ba'i rgyu'i dngos pos stobs dang / ye shes gnyis kyi chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir /
translated: knowledge are the nature of the entry into the realm of reality.

original: stobs dang ye shes de dag rab tu rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: stobs dang ye shes de dag rab tu rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: The analysis of the powers and the knowledges.

original: de la stobs ni dad pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de la stobs ni dad pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The five beginning with faith are the powers.

original: ye shes ni mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: ye shes ni mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: The path of insight and the path of cultivation are the knowledges.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun no //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun no //
translated: The path of insight is the seven members of enlightenment.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
translated: The path of cultivation is the eight members of the noble path.

original: de dag kyang dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid sgo srung bzhi'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de dag kyang dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid sgo srung bzhi'i bdag nyid de /
translated: They are the four gates of protection, having the nature of faith, vigor, mindfulness, and samadhi.

original: theg pa chen po la mngon par yid ches pa dang / 'jug pa dang / de rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / yang dag par mgu bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la mngon par yid ches pa dang / 'jug pa dang / de rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / yang dag par mgu bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the great vehicle's conviction, engagement, continuity, and delight.

original: de nyid shes rab yongs su dag pa tsam la ltos pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ji skad bstan pa'i sgo nas byams pa la sogs bcu drug gi ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid shes rab yongs su dag pa tsam la ltos pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ji skad bstan pa'i sgo nas byams pa la sogs bcu drug gi ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: That very is the sixteen aspects of the emptinesses, which are the nature of the samadhis of love, etc., in terms of the analysis of emptiness as taught, in dependence on just the purity of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: byams chen rang bzhin dpag tu med //
analyzed: byams chen rang bzhin dpag tu med //
translated: His nature is immeasurable love,🔽great compassion is his supreme mind,

original: snying rje chen po blo yi mchog / shes rab chen po blo chen ldan //
analyzed: snying rje chen po blo yi mchog / shes rab chen po blo chen ldan //
translated: he has great wisdom and great intelligence,

original: mkhas pa chen po thabs che ba //
analyzed: mkhas pa chen po thabs che ba //
translated: he is a great scholar and has great skill in means.

original: zhes pa'o // de la byams chen rang bzhin dpag tu med ni byams pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de la byams chen rang bzhin dpag tu med ni byams pa ste /
translated: Therein, immeasurable love is his nature, which is love.

original: 'di la mdza' ba yod pa ni mdza' pa can te /
analyzed: 'di la mdza' ba yod pa ni mdza' pa can te /
translated: He who has love here is loving.

original: mjug ni de'i rkyen dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mjug ni de'i rkyen dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The suffix is in the sense of having that as a condition.

original: de ni sems can thams cad la mdza' ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni sems can thams cad la mdza' ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: That is the nature of love for all sentient beings.

original: che ba yang de yin la byams pa'i rang bzhin yang de nyid yin pas byams chen rang bzhin no //
analyzed: che ba yang de yin la byams pa'i rang bzhin yang de nyid yin pas byams chen rang bzhin no //
translated: It is great and it is the nature of love, thus it is the nature of great love.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is immeasurable,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kun la bu gcig ba bzhin du byams pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽snying rje chen po blo yi mchog ni 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kun la bu gcig ba bzhin du byams pa nyid kyi phyir ro // snying rje chen po blo yi mchog ni 'jam dpal lo //
translated: because it is love for all world-realms as if they were one's only child.🔽Great compassion is his supreme mind, which is Manjushri.

original: snying rje chen po ni mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Great compassion is the nature of non-apprehension.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni snying rje chen po can no //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni snying rje chen po can no //
translated: He who has that is the one with great compassion.

original: blo'i mchog ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes yin no //
analyzed: blo'i mchog ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes yin no //
translated: The best of minds is the pristine wisdom of the extremely pure reality realm.

original: des ni 'di skad gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i bdag nyid de bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes so //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i bdag nyid de bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes so //
translated: The Lord has a nature of profundity and magnificence.

original: shes rab chen po blo chen ldan ni spos kyi glang po ste /
analyzed: shes rab chen po blo chen ldan ni spos kyi glang po ste /
translated: The one with great wisdom and great mind is Gandhahastin.

original: shes @46b rab chen po ste chos rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: shes @46b rab chen po ste chos rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: He has great wisdom, which is the nature of the discernment of phenomena.

original: 'di dang gang ldan pa de ni shes rab can te /
analyzed: 'di dang gang ldan pa de ni shes rab can te /
translated: He who has that is the wise one.

original: chen po yang de yin la shes rab kyang de yin pas shes rab chen po nyid blo chen no //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la shes rab kyang de yin pas shes rab chen po nyid blo chen no //
translated: He is the one with great wisdom, and that is his great mind.

original: mkhas pa chen po thabs chab ni ye shes tog go //
analyzed: mkhas pa chen po thabs chab ni ye shes tog go //
translated: The one with great skill and great means is Jnanakesari.

original: gang zhig thabs che ba yin pa de ni thabs che pa'o ;
analyzed: gang zhig thabs che ba yin pa de ni thabs che pa'o ;
translated: He who has great means is the one with great means.

original: / de la mkhas pa chen po ni blo rdzogs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: / de la mkhas pa chen po ni blo rdzogs pa chen po'o //
translated: There, great skill is the great perfection of mind.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba shes pas dam pa'i chos ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba shes pas dam pa'i chos ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he teaches the true Dharma by knowing the thoughts and latent tendencies of all sentient beings.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po stobs dang ldan //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po stobs dang ldan //
translated: He has great magical power and strength.

original: shugs chen mgyogs pa chen po ste //
analyzed: shugs chen mgyogs pa chen po ste //
translated: He is of great speed and great force.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po cher grags pa ;
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po cher grags pa ;
translated: He has great magical power and great fame.

original: stobs chen pha rol gnon pa po //
analyzed: stobs chen pha rol gnon pa po //
translated: He has great strength and great courage.

original: zhes de la rdzu 'phrul chen po stobs dang ldan ni bzang skyong ngo //
analyzed: zhes de la rdzu 'phrul chen po stobs dang ldan ni bzang skyong ngo //
translated: Among them, Bhadrapāla has great magical power and strength.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs ni rdzu 'phrul stobs te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs ni rdzu 'phrul stobs te /
translated: Magical power is strength.

original: de dang ldan pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He who possesses that is one who has the strength of magical power.

original: chen po yang de yin la rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang ldan pa yang de nyid yin pas rdzu 'phrul chen po'i stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang ldan pa yang de nyid yin pas rdzu 'phrul chen po'i stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is great and also has the strength of magical power, so he is one who has the strength of great magical power.

original: shugs chen mgyogs pa chen po ste blo gros rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: shugs chen mgyogs pa chen po ste blo gros rgya mtsho'o //
translated: Sāgaramati is of great speed and great force.

original: shugs chen pos 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni shugs chen te /
analyzed: shugs chen pos 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni shugs chen te /
translated: He who goes with great force is of great speed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang sri zhu'i don du du ma'i 'jig rten du bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang sri zhu'i don du du ma'i 'jig rten du bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because he moves in many worlds in order to worship and serve all the Tathagatas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na mgyogs pa chen po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na mgyogs pa chen po zhes gsungs so //
translated: And for that very reason he is called Mahajava, the Great Speed.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po cher grags pa ni blo gros mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po cher grags pa ni blo gros mi zad pa ste /
translated: Maha-rddhi-maha-yasha is Akashagarbha.

original: 'jig rten dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir na rdzu 'phrul chen po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir na rdzu 'phrul chen po'o //
translated: He is of great spiritual power because he is endowed with the accumulations of merit and knowledge of the world, the Sravakas, and the Pratyekabuddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir na cher grags so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir na cher grags so //
translated: And he is of great fame because he has completed the accumulations of merit and knowledge of all the Tathagatas.

original: stobs chen pha rol gnon pa po ni spobs pa brtsegs pa'o //
analyzed: stobs chen pha rol gnon pa po ni spobs pa brtsegs pa'o //
translated: Maha-bala-parama-shura is Sarvanivaranavishkambhin.

original: chen po yang de yin la stobs kyang de nyid yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa phyis 'byung ba rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la stobs kyang de nyid yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pa phyis 'byung ba rnams gzung ngo //
translated: He is of great strength because he has the ten Tathagata powers, such as the knowledge of the possible and impossible, which will occur later.

original: de rnams kyi pha rol gnon pa ni de'i brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang gang ldan pa de stobs chen pha rol gnon pa po'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi pha rol gnon pa ni de'i brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang gang ldan pa de stobs chen pha rol gnon pa po'o //
translated: The one who is endowed with the power of his exertion is the one who has the great power of exertion.

original: srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms //🔽mkhregs chen rdo rje chen po 'chang //
analyzed: srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms // mkhregs chen rdo rje chen po 'chang //
translated: He is the one who conquers the great mountain of existence.🔽He is the one who holds the great vajra of great solidity.

original: drag po chen po drag shul che //
analyzed: drag po chen po drag shul che //
translated: He is the one with great wrath, the one with great ferocity.

original: 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa po //🔽zhes pa ni /🔽de la srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms pa ni mthu chen @47a * //
analyzed: 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa po // zhes pa ni / de la srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms pa ni mthu chen @47a * //
translated: He is the one who terrifies the great terror.

original: po thob pa'o //
analyzed: po thob pa'o //
translated: Here, the one who conquers the great mountain of existence is the one who has attained great power.

original: srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //🔽de nyid ri bo ste /
analyzed: srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o // de nyid ri bo ste /
translated: Existence is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: mi shes pa'i brag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i brag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are a mountain because they are a mass of ignorance.

original: de dag yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes thob pas 'joms pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni 'joms pa'o //🔽chen po yang de yin la srid pa'i ri bo 'joms pa yang de nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de dag yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes thob pas 'joms pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni 'joms pa'o // chen po yang de yin la srid pa'i ri bo 'joms pa yang de nyid yin pas /
translated: The one who is endowed with the method of conquering them by attaining the unmistaken gnosis that is directly opposite to them is the conqueror.🔽He is great and he is the conqueror of the mountain of existence.

original: srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms //
analyzed: srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms //
translated: Therefore, he is the one who conquers the great mountain of existence.

original: zhes so // mkhregs chen rdo rje chen po 'chang ba ni ngan song kun 'dren no //
analyzed: zhes so // mkhregs chen rdo rje chen po 'chang ba ni ngan song kun 'dren no //
translated: The great hard one, the great vajra holder, is the leader of all the lower realms.

original: rdo rje chen po ni kun du bzang po'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rdo rje chen po ni kun du bzang po'i ye shes te /
translated: The great vajra is the wisdom of Samantabhadra.

original: de 'dzin pas na rdo rje ni chen po 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na rdo rje ni chen po 'chang ngo //
translated: Since he holds that, he is the great vajra holder.

original: sra ba'i phyir dang lus dang ldan pa'i phyir na mkhregs pa'o //
analyzed: sra ba'i phyir dang lus dang ldan pa'i phyir na mkhregs pa'o //
translated: He is hard because he is solid and has a body.

original: drag po chen po drag shul che ba ni mya ngan gyi mun pa kun 'joms pa'i blo gros so //
analyzed: drag po chen po drag shul che ba ni mya ngan gyi mun pa kun 'joms pa'i blo gros so //
translated: The great fierce one, the great wrathful one, is the mind that conquers all the darkness of suffering.

original: chen po yang yin la drag po yang de nyid yin pas na drag po chen po ste /
analyzed: chen po yang yin la drag po yang de nyid yin pas na drag po chen po ste /
translated: He is the great fierce one because he is great and fierce.

original: gdul dka' ba'i sems can rnams la khro bo chen po'i gzugs ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul dka' ba'i sems can rnams la khro bo chen po'i gzugs ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he displays the form of the great wrathful one to the sentient beings who are difficult to tame.

original: drag shul che ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal de zhi ba yin yang sems can gdul ba'i phyir drag shul can du yang ston zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: drag shul che ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal de zhi ba yin yang sems can gdul ba'i phyir drag shul can du yang ston zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The great wrathful one is the Bhagavat Manjusri. The meaning is that he is wrathful because he displays wrath in order to tame sentient beings, even though he is peaceful.

original: 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa po ni dra ba can gyi 'od do //
analyzed: 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa po ni dra ba can gyi 'od do //
translated: The great fear, the one who causes fear, is Jaliniprabha.

original: 'jigs chen ni 'jigs byed chen po'i gzugs 'dzin pas na 'jigs chen no //
analyzed: 'jigs chen ni 'jigs byed chen po'i gzugs 'dzin pas na 'jigs chen no //
translated: Great fear is the form of the great fearsome one, so it is great fear.

original: de yang 'jigs par byed pas na 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa'o //🔽mgon po rigs mchog chen po ste //
analyzed: de yang 'jigs par byed pas na 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa'o // mgon po rigs mchog chen po ste //
translated: Great fear is the great terror, and it is also fearful, thus it is the great fear of the great terror.🔽The Lord is the great lineage,🔽the guru, the supreme of great mantras,

original: bla ma gsang sngags che ba'i mchog / theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas //
analyzed: bla ma gsang sngags che ba'i mchog / theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas //
translated: abiding in the way of the Great Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog / ces pa ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog / ces pa ni /
translated: the supreme way of the Great Vehicle.

original: de la mgon po rigs mchog chen po ni zla 'od gzhon nu'o //
analyzed: de la mgon po rigs mchog chen po ni zla 'od gzhon nu'o //
translated: Here, the Lord is Candraprabha Kumara.

original: chen po yang de yin la rigs kyang de nyid yin pas rigs mchog chen po ste /
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la rigs kyang de nyid yin pas rigs mchog chen po ste /
translated: He is great and also a lineage, thus he is the great lineage.

original: gzungs bzhi'o // de yang chig dang / don dang sngags dang / phyag rgya'i bdag nyid rnams so //
analyzed: gzungs bzhi'o // de yang chig dang / don dang sngags dang / phyag rgya'i bdag nyid rnams so //
translated: It is the four retentions, which are the nature of words, meanings, mantras, and seals.

original: de nyid ni mgon po ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mgon po ste /
translated: He is the Lord

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus ngag yid la kun du spyod pa'i sdig pa ma lus par yang dag par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus ngag yid la kun du spyod pa'i sdig pa ma lus par yang dag par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he completely purifies the body, speech, and mind of all sentient beings of all their misdeeds.

original: bla ma gsang sngags che ba'i mchog ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma gsang sngags che ba'i mchog ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The Guru, the supreme great mantra is Amitabha.

original: chen po yang de nyid yin la gsang sngags kyang de nyid yin pas gsang sngags che ba ste /
analyzed: chen po yang de nyid yin la gsang sngags kyang de nyid yin pas gsang sngags che ba ste /
translated: He is great and he is the mantra, thus he is the great mantra.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: He is the nature of the Great Seal.

original: de'i mchog ni gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i mchog ni gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: His supreme is his chief.

original: de nyid bla ma ste /
analyzed: de nyid bla ma ste /
translated: He is the Guru,

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ji lta ba bzhin du shes nas mngon par rtogs pa nye bar ston @47b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ji lta ba bzhin du shes nas mngon par rtogs pa nye bar ston @47b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he teaches the realization of the nature of the mind of all sentient beings.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas ni nam mkha'i mdzod do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas ni nam mkha'i mdzod do //
translated: The abode of the Mahayana is Akasagarbha.

original: theg pa chen po ni 'og nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni 'og nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Mahayana is taught below.

original: de'i tshul ni lam mo //
analyzed: de'i tshul ni lam mo //
translated: Its way is the path.

original: de zhon pa ni gnas pa'i don to //
analyzed: de zhon pa ni gnas pa'i don to //
translated: To ride it is the meaning of abode.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog ni sgrib pa rnam par sel pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog ni sgrib pa rnam par sel pa'o //
translated: The supreme of the Mahayana way is Avalokitdvara.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis brjod du med pa'i chos nyid du khong du chud pa'i rtog pa med pa'i ye shes ni theg pa chen po zhes so //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis brjod du med pa'i chos nyid du khong du chud pa'i rtog pa med pa'i ye shes ni theg pa chen po zhes so //
translated: The gnosis that is free from conceptual thought, which is the understanding that both cyclic existence and nirvana are the inexpressible ultimate reality, is the Great Vehicle.

original: yang na 'khor ba'i gnas thabs dang spyod yul dang rten gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: yang na 'khor ba'i gnas thabs dang spyod yul dang rten gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Or else, the Great Vehicle is the nature of the means, domain, and basis for remaining in cyclic existence.

original: bla na med pa rnam pa gsum gyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa yin zhes so //
analyzed: bla na med pa rnam pa gsum gyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa yin zhes so //
translated: It is the Great Vehicle because it includes the three unexcelled aspects.

original: gal te de ltar yin na ni de'i chen po ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na ni de'i chen po ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it great?

original: gang dag 'jig rten thams cad la phan par byed pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das des de che ba nyid de /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten thams cad la phan par byed pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das des de che ba nyid de /
translated: It is great because it is the means for the benefit of all worlds, the Bhagavan Buddha.

original: de rnams kyi theg pa 'di ni bskyed pa'i don dam nges par 'byung ba'i don du sgrub pa'o //🔽de'i phyir na de dang lhan cig pa'i chen po'i theg pa yin pas theg pa chen po 'am /
analyzed: de rnams kyi theg pa 'di ni bskyed pa'i don dam nges par 'byung ba'i don du sgrub pa'o // de'i phyir na de dang lhan cig pa'i chen po'i theg pa yin pas theg pa chen po 'am /
translated: This vehicle of his is established for the purpose of generating the ultimate, for the purpose of emancipation.

original: chen po nyid kyi theg pa pas theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po nyid kyi theg pa pas theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the Great Vehicle because it is the vehicle of the great, or it is the Great Vehicle because it is the vehicle of the great ones.

original: yang na chen po rnam pa bdun gyi phyir te /
analyzed: yang na chen po rnam pa bdun gyi phyir te /
translated: Or else, it is the Great Vehicle because it is great in seven ways:

original: dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs dang / yang dag par grub pa dang / las che ba nyid kyi phyir theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs dang / yang dag par grub pa dang / las che ba nyid kyi phyir theg pa chen po'o //
translated: its object, practice, intuition, effort, means, perfect achievement, and action are all great.

original: chen po yang de yin la theg pa yang de nyid yin pas theg pa chen po ste ;
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la theg pa yang de nyid yin pas theg pa chen po ste ;
translated: It is the Great Vehicle because it is great and it is a vehicle.

original: theg pa gzhan la de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la de rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is great because the others do not have these seven kinds of greatness.

original: de bas na de mdor bsdus nas theg pa chen po ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de bas na de mdor bsdus nas theg pa chen po ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therefore, in brief, the Great Vehicle is threefold:

original: rgyu dang yul dang / rten gyi rang bzhin rnams yongs su snang ba'i don du rig par bya'o //🔽de nyid thabs tsam la ltos pas sam /
analyzed: rgyu dang yul dang / rten gyi rang bzhin rnams yongs su snang ba'i don du rig par bya'o // de nyid thabs tsam la ltos pas sam /
translated: its cause, its object, and its support.

original: ma lus pa'i 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: It is the intuition of the Transcendent Lord, the Bodhisattva Manjusri, the Gnosis Hero, the body of gnosis of the Transcendent Lords, because it is the cause of the intuition of the Great Vehicle, because it is the object of the intuition of the Great Vehicle, and because it is the support of the intuition of the Great Vehicle.🔽It is the intuition of the Transcendent Lords because it is the cause of the intuition of the Great Vehicle.🔽It is the Gnosis Hero because it is the object of the intuition of the Great Vehicle.🔽It is the body of gnosis of the Transcendent Lords because it is the support of the intuition of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Thus, the Transcendent Lords,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
translated: The perfect Buddha arises from A.

original: zhes pa nyid la sogs pa mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge tshigs bcad gzhung tshig gi bye brag gi khyad par can 'brel tshig med pa rnams kyis khyad par du byas pa'i ye shes sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la gnas pa 'jam dpal
analyzed: zhes pa nyid la sogs pa mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge tshigs bcad gzhung tshig gi bye brag gi khyad par can 'brel tshig med pa rnams kyis khyad par du byas pa'i ye shes sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la gnas pa 'jam dpal
translated: Thus, the mantra syllables of the name, which are distinguished by the particular words of the text, are connected with the wisdom being, Mañjuśrī, who resides in the heart of all tathāgatas.

original: ye shes sems dpa' 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog ces bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog ces bya bar blta'o //
translated: The wisdom being, Mañjuśrī, should be seen as the supreme glorious one.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha sems ma rdo rje ma la @48a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha sems ma rdo rje ma la @48a * //
translated: Those deities of the maṇḍala, such as Vajragarvā,

original: sogs pa de rnams kyang phyag rgya chen por sbyor bas rang rang gi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan du ldan pa phyung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa de rnams kyang phyag rgya chen por sbyor bas rang rang gi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan du ldan pa phyung ste /
translated: are also endowed with their own colors and implements, having been produced by the application of the great seal.

original: phyung nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams kun gyi sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byas te /
analyzed: phyung nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams kun gyi sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byas te /
translated: Having been produced, they perform the deeds of the buddhas for the sentient beings of all world systems.

original: yang phyir log nas mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge rnams kyi rang rang gi rigs kyi mdog dang ldan par bsgyur te /
analyzed: yang phyir log nas mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge rnams kyi rang rang gi rigs kyi mdog dang ldan par bsgyur te /
translated: Again, having returned, transform the syllables of the mantra of the night into the colors of their respective families.

original: ji ltar don gyi rim pas rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po lngar bkod pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams la bzhugs par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: ji ltar don gyi rim pas rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po lngar bkod pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams la bzhugs par bsgoms nas /
translated: Meditate on them as residing on the moon maṇḍalas in the five great maṇḍalas of the vajra realm in the order of the meaning.

original: 'khor lo de'i lte ba la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i gzugs gong nas gsungs pa bzhin du bdag nyid mos te /
analyzed: 'khor lo de'i lte ba la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i gzugs gong nas gsungs pa bzhin du bdag nyid mos te /
translated: The form of Mañjuśrījñānasattva, the gnosis body of all tathāgatas, abiding in the center of that maṇḍala, is as previously described.🔽“The Bhagavān, the gnosis body, is the true ultimate reality of nonduality.

original: bcom ldan 'das ye shes kyi sku de nyid kyi gnyis su med pa'i yang dag pa'i don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa mtshan gyi gtsug gi nor bu 'di rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang yang rung ba sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod🔽pa'i byang chub sems dpas dus gsum du kha ton du byed pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ye shes kyi sku de nyid kyi gnyis su med pa'i yang dag pa'i don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa mtshan gyi gtsug gi nor bu 'di rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang yang rung ba sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod🔽pa'i byang chub sems dpas dus gsum du kha ton du byed pa'am /
translated: Any son or daughter of good family who practices the conduct through the door of mantra should recite this crown jewel of the name of the true ultimate reality, the true ultimate reality of the Bhagavān, the gnosis body, the form of Mañjuśrījñānasattva, in the three times.

original: glegs bam du byas pa la klog cing 'don pa dang / gtsang ba dang mi gcang bar gyur pas te /
analyzed: glegs bam du byas pa la klog cing 'don pa dang / gtsang ba dang mi gcang bar gyur pas te /
translated: The one who recites the verses of the mantra syllables of the night,🔽without speaking, as if no one else were listening,

original: ci yang mi smra bar ji lta ba bzhin du sus kyang mi thos par mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge tshigs bcad de ltar klog pa ni ring por mi thogs pa kho nar yon tan las brjod pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs dang / gzhan yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci yang mi smra bar ji lta ba bzhin du sus kyang mi thos par mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge tshigs bcad de ltar klog pa ni ring por mi thogs pa kho nar yon tan las brjod pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs dang / gzhan yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: will soon attain the host of qualities described as the benefits of the practice, and other qualities as well.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i skyes bu gang zag de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs shin tu bsags te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i skyes bu gang zag de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs shin tu bsags te /
translated: The person who upholds the ultimate essence of the true teaching will accumulate the stores of merit and wisdom.

original: shin tu myur bar sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan rnams la yang dag par gyur nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing /
analyzed: shin tu myur bar sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan rnams la yang dag par gyur nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing /
translated: Very quickly, having become endowed with the qualities of all the buddhas, he will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: bskal pa mang por yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos su 'gyur la /
analyzed: bskal pa mang por yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos su 'gyur la /
translated: He will not pass into parinirvāṇa for many eons,

original: sems can thams cad la bla na med pa'i chos ston par byed la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bla na med pa'i chos ston par byed la /
translated: and he will teach the unsurpassed Dharma to all sentient beings.

original: phyogs bcur dam pa'i chos kyi rnga sgra sgrogs pa'i chos kyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcur dam pa'i chos kyi rnga sgra sgrogs pa'i chos kyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be a Dharma king who sounds the drum of the true Dharma in the ten directions.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po de'i mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig rnams gcig tu bsdu ba byas nas mtshan brgyad cu rtsa drug rnams yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po de'i mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig rnams gcig tu bsdu ba byas nas mtshan brgyad cu rtsa drug rnams yin te /
translated: The names of the mantras of the syllables of that great maṇḍala of the vajra realm are collected into one, and there are eighty-six names.

original: de rnams kyang dkyil 'khor chen po'i lha rnams la rnam par phye nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang dkyil 'khor chen po'i lha rnams la rnam par phye nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Those are to be applied by distinguishing the deities of the great maṇḍala.

original: de la bzhi ni ye @48b shes sems dpa' dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
analyzed: de la bzhi ni ye @48b shes sems dpa' dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
translated: Among them, four are [the names] of the jñānasattva and the moon maṇḍala.

original: yi ge aa ni gsum mo //
analyzed: yi ge aa ni gsum mo //
translated: The syllable a is three.

original: rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi bcu gcig go //
analyzed: rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi bcu gcig go //
translated: The names of Vajraratna and so forth, and Drdha and so forth, are eleven.

original: dang po rdo rje sems dpa' nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dang po rdo rje sems dpa' nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with Vajrasattva,

original: ji tsam sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'i mthar thug gi bar du ma lus pa'i mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig gi khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bos go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'i mthar thug gi bar du ma lus pa'i mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig gi khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bos go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the special words of the mantra syllables of the name, in order, by way of the nature of the special and the qualified, up to the end of the complete elimination of all obscurations.

original: tshigs bcad ni bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshigs bcad ni bcu bzhi ste /
translated: There are fourteen verses.

original: mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig rnams ni brgyad cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig rnams ni brgyad cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: The words of the mantra syllables of the name are sixty-eight.

original: de ni man ngag yin no //
analyzed: de ni man ngag yin no //
translated: That is the instruction.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba las byang chub kyi sems rdo rje rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i rim pa'i dbang du byas pa ste lnga pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba las byang chub kyi sems rdo rje rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i rim pa'i dbang du byas pa ste lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifth chapter from the commentary on the Noble Mañjuśrī’s Root Tantra called “The Mirror of Poetics,” which is an explanation in accordance with the stages of the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm of the mind of enlightenment.

original: // / da ni gnyis pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'khor lo bshad de /
analyzed: // / da ni gnyis pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'khor lo bshad de /
translated: Now, the second, the explanation of Vairocana’s wheel, is explained.

original: de yang 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i lha rnams bkod pa'i rim pas che ba'i bdag nyid bstan nas /🔽da ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i sgo nas dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin khyad par bstan par 'dod pas rang gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas gti mug la spyod pa'i sems can rnams
analyzed: de yang 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i lha rnams bkod pa'i rim pas che ba'i bdag nyid bstan nas / da ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i sgo nas dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin khyad par bstan par 'dod pas rang gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas gti mug la spyod pa'i sems can rnams
translated: Furthermore, having taught the greatness of the arrangement of the deities of the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm, the gnosis body of all tathāgatas, the bodhisattva Mañjuśrījñānasattva,

original: gdul ba'i don du rang gi 'khor lo dgod pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gdul ba'i don du rang gi 'khor lo dgod pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: now, in order to teach the special nature of all entities from the perspective of the great Vairocana, the gnosis of the completely pure dharmadhātu, he taught the arrangement of his retinue for the purpose of guiding sentient beings who engage in delusion through his own door of liberation.

original: de la yang rnam par snang mdzad dang rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i khyad par du bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang rnam par snang mdzad dang rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i khyad par du bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between Vairocana and Great Vairocana?

original: de mi shes pas de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de mi shes pas de gsungs pa /
translated: Since that is not known, he taught that.

original: rang bzhin can gzugs kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid 'og min lha'i rgyal po'i gnas der ;
analyzed: rang bzhin can gzugs kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid 'og min lha'i rgyal po'i gnas der ;
translated: The sambhogakāya is the natural outflow of the dharmakāya, and it is the characteristic of the sambhogakāya that it appears in the Akaniṣṭha realm of the king of gods.

original: lha'i rigs su skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis chos kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa so sor nyams su myong bar byed pa'i don du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas rnam par smin pa'i skur gyur pa yongs su dag pa'i
analyzed: lha'i rigs su skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis chos kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa so sor nyams su myong bar byed pa'i don du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas rnam par smin pa'i skur gyur pa yongs su dag pa'i
translated: In that realm, bodhisattvas born into the divine family experience the enjoyment of the Dharma through the stages of meditative concentration of manifest complete enlightenment.

original: ye shes kyi so sor snang ba'i mtshan nyid rgyu mthun pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi so sor snang ba'i mtshan nyid rgyu mthun pa'i sku ste /
translated: The sambhogakāya is the natural outflow of the dharmakāya, and it is characterized by the appearance of pure wisdom.

original: gnas de nyid na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshogs kyis bskor ba'i ston pa gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: gnas de nyid na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshogs kyis bskor ba'i ston pa gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The teacher who is surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattva mahāsattvas in that realm is Bhagavān Vairocana.

original: de ltar zla gsang thig le'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar zla gsang thig le'i rgyud las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Candragarbha Tantra:

original: gnas gtsang ma rnams spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma rnams spangs pa'o //
translated: Abandoning the pure abodes,

original: 'og min gnas ni nyams dga' bar //
analyzed: 'og min gnas ni nyams dga' bar //
translated: In the delightful Akaniṣṭha realm,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de @49a * //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de @49a * //
translated: The perfect Buddha🔽is the emanator.

original: sangs rgyas // sprul pa po ni 'dir sangs rgyas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas // sprul pa po ni 'dir sangs rgyas //
translated: The Buddha here is the emanator.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad do //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad do //
translated: This is a verse.

original: rnam par snang mdzad chen po ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis las shin tu rnam par grol ba dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin du snang zhing ston par nus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis las shin tu rnam par grol ba dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin du snang zhing ston par nus pa'o //
translated: The Great Vairocana is the body of the nature of gnosis, completely liberated from the two obscurations of affliction and the knowable, and able to appear and display the nature of all things.

original: bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin de nyid las dngos po thams cad ston par nus par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin de nyid las dngos po thams cad ston par nus par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that the Blessed One, from just that nature of reality, is able to display all things?

original: de ltar dpal rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar dpal rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las gsungs te /
translated: It is like that, as stated in the Tantra of the Manifest Enlightenment of Vairocana.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de sems can thams cad la rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de sems can thams cad la rnam par phye ste /
translated: Blessed One, the tathāgatas, arhats, and completely perfect buddhas have attained the wisdom of omniscience and have revealed that wisdom of omniscience to all sentient beings.

original: tshul sna tshogs dang / bsam pa sna tshogs dang / thabs sna tshogs dag gis chos ston te /
analyzed: tshul sna tshogs dang / bsam pa sna tshogs dang / thabs sna tshogs dag gis chos ston te /
translated: They teach the Dharma to them in various ways, with various methods, and with various intentions.

original: kha cig la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul /
analyzed: kha cig la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul /
translated: To some they teach the way of the Hearers’ Vehicle,

original: kha cig la ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i tshul /
analyzed: kha cig la ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i tshul /
translated: to some they teach the way of the Solitary Realizers’ Vehicle,

original: kha cig la ni theg pa chen po'i tshul /
analyzed: kha cig la ni theg pa chen po'i tshul /
translated: to some they teach the way of the Great Vehicle,

original: kha cig la ni mngon par shes pa lnga'i tshul lo //
analyzed: kha cig la ni mngon par shes pa lnga'i tshul lo //
translated: to some they teach the way of the five superknowledges,

original: kha cig la ni lhar skye bar bya ba dang / kha cig la ni mir skye bar bya ba dang / ji srid du lto 'phye chen po dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang /
analyzed: kha cig la ni lhar skye bar bya ba dang / kha cig la ni mir skye bar bya ba dang / ji srid du lto 'phye chen po dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang /
translated: to some they teach the way of being born as a god, to some they teach the way of being born as a human, and so on up to: to some they teach the way of being born as a great nāga, a great kumbhāṇḍa, a great yakṣa, a great rākṣasa, a gandharva, an asura, a garuḍa, a kinnara, or a mahoraga.

original: nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am cer skye bar bya ba'i bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am cer skye bar bya ba'i bar du chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are to be guided by a garuḍa, and to those who are to be guided by a human or a kinnara.

original: de la sems can la la sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba rnams la sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su mthong //
analyzed: de la sems can la la sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba rnams la sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su mthong //
translated: Some beings who are to be guided by a buddha see him in the form of a buddha.

original: la las ni nyan thos kyi gzugs su /
analyzed: la las ni nyan thos kyi gzugs su /
translated: Some see him in the form of a śrāvaka.

original: la las ni rang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su /
analyzed: la las ni rang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su /
translated: Some see him in the form of a pratyekabuddha.

original: la las ni byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs su /🔽la las ni dbang phyug chen po'i gzugs su ;
analyzed: la las ni byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs su / la las ni dbang phyug chen po'i gzugs su ;
translated: Some see him in the form of a bodhisattva.🔽Some see him in the form of Maheśvara.

original: la las ni tshangs pa'i gzugs su /🔽la las ni sred med kyi bu'i gzugs su /
analyzed: la las ni tshangs pa'i gzugs su / la las ni sred med kyi bu'i gzugs su /
translated: Some see him in the form of Brahmā.🔽Some see him in the form of Nārāyaṇa.

original: la las ni rnam thos kyi bu'i gzugs su //
analyzed: la las ni rnam thos kyi bu'i gzugs su //
translated: Some see him in the form of Vaiśravaṇa.

original: la las ni lto 'phye chen po dang mi dang mi ma yin pa'i bar du mthong ste /
analyzed: la las ni lto 'phye chen po dang mi dang mi ma yin pa'i bar du mthong ste /
translated: Some see him in the form of a mahoraga, a human, or a non-human.

original: rang rang gi tshig brjod pa'i tshul dang / spyod lam la rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rang rang gi tshig brjod pa'i tshul dang / spyod lam la rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: He abides in the conduct and behavior of each of them, speaking in their respective languages.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de 'ang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ror ro gcig pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de 'ang 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ror ro gcig pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: That gnosis of omniscience is also of one taste with the taste of the Tathāgata’s liberation.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che // zhes pa ni /
translated: The great Buddha Vairocana

original: de la sangs rgyas ni ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po kun mkhyen pa'o //🔽rnam par snang mdzad che ni rnam par gsal @49b bas na rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas ni ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po kun mkhyen pa'o // rnam par snang mdzad che ni rnam par gsal @49b bas na rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: Here, “Buddha” is the knower of all things as they are and as they are not.🔽“ Great Vairocana” is Vairocana because he illuminates,

original: rnam par snang ba kho nar byed pas na rnam par snang mdzad do /
analyzed: rnam par snang ba kho nar byed pas na rnam par snang mdzad do /
translated: and he is Vairocana because he makes everything into light.

original: rang gi don la 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi don la 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he increases his own purpose.

original: chen po yang de yin la rnam par snang mdzad kyang de nyid yin pas rnam par snang mdzad che zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la rnam par snang mdzad kyang de nyid yin pas rnam par snang mdzad che zhes pa'o //
translated: He is great and he is Vairocana, thus he is the great Vairocana.

original: thub pa chen po ni sku gsung thugs thub pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa chen po ni sku gsung thugs thub pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: “ Great Sage” is endowed with the sage’s body, speech, and mind.

original: chen po yang de yin la thub pa yang de nyid yin pas thub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la thub pa yang de nyid yin pas thub pa chen po'o //
translated: He is great and he is a sage, thus he is the great sage.

original: thub pa chen po zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: thub pa chen po zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is he called the Great Sage?

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he is always in equipoise.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes pa'i tshig gi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes pa'i tshig gi phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are always in equipoise.

original: lus la sogs par son pa'i gnas ngan len med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs par son pa'i gnas ngan len med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is free from the negative tendencies that are present in the body, etc.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni thub chen ldan no //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni thub chen ldan no //
translated: He who has that is endowed with the Great Sage.

original: chen po yang de yin la thub pa yang de nyid yin pas thub chen te /
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la thub pa yang de nyid yin pas thub chen te /
translated: He is great and a sage, so he is the Great Sage.

original: gnas 'jog dang / ri byi dang / grog mkhar la sogs pa drang srong rnams yin no //
analyzed: gnas 'jog dang / ri byi dang / grog mkhar la sogs pa drang srong rnams yin no //
translated: The sages are the ṛṣis such as Vasiṣṭha, Śuka, and Vālmīki.

original: des 'dul ba rnams la de lta bu'i gzugs su so sor snang ba'i phyir na thub pa chen po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des 'dul ba rnams la de lta bu'i gzugs su so sor snang ba'i phyir na thub pa chen po zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is called the Great Sage because he appears in such a form to those who are to be disciplined.

original: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba // zhes pa la /
translated: He is born from the great way of secret mantra.

original: gsang sngags tshul chen ni theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen ni theg pa chen po ste /
translated: The great way of secret mantra is the Great Vehicle.

original: gsang sngags tshul de las byung bas na gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba'o //🔽chen po yang de yin la gsang sngags las byung ba yang de nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul de las byung bas na gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba'o // chen po yang de yin la gsang sngags las byung ba yang de nyid yin pas /
translated: It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.🔽It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.🔽It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.🔽It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.

original: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba // zhes pa ste /
translated: It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.

original: de nyid las grub pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las grub pa'o //
translated: It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.🔽It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.🔽It is great and it arises from mantra,

original: gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can //🔽zhes pa ste /🔽rdo rje theg pa chen po'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can // zhes pa ste / rdo rje theg pa chen po'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: so it is the great way of mantra.🔽It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.🔽It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.

original: de yang rnam par snang mdzad che ;
analyzed: de yang rnam par snang mdzad che ;
translated: It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.🔽It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.🔽It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.🔽It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.🔽It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.🔽It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.

original: / zhes pa la sogs pas kyang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog ces pa'i bar la brjod par bya'o //🔽pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste //
analyzed: / zhes pa la sogs pas kyang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog ces pa'i bar la brjod par bya'o // pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste //
translated: It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.🔽It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.🔽It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas //🔽pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas // pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
translated: It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.🔽It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
translated: It is great and it arises from mantra,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: so it is the great way of mantra.🔽It is the great way of mantra because it arises from that way of mantra.🔽It is great and it arises from mantra,🔽so it is the great way of mantra.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams thob pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i lam rnams kyi sgo nas bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams thob pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i lam rnams kyi sgo nas bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: The path of pure intention to attain the perfections is taught in the following verse.

original: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste //
translated: The ten perfections are attained.

original: zhes pa de la yang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ston pa ni 'di ltar dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa //
analyzed: zhes pa de la yang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ston pa ni 'di ltar dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa //
translated: The ten perfections are taught in the Madhyāntavibhāga:

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //🔽bsam gtan dang @50a * //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus // bsam gtan dang @50a * //
translated: Generosity, morality, patience, diligence,

original: ni shes rab thabs //
analyzed: ni shes rab thabs //
translated: Concentration, wisdom, means,🔽Vows, power, and knowledge:

original: smon lam stobs dang ye shes dang // 'di dag pha rol phyin bcur 'dod //
analyzed: smon lam stobs dang ye shes dang // 'di dag pha rol phyin bcur 'dod //
translated: These are asserted as the ten perfections.

original: ces so // de la sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ste //
analyzed: ces so // de la sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ste //
translated: There are three kinds of generosity:

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / skyabs kyi sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / skyabs kyi sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: Generosity of material things, generosity of protection, and generosity of the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Morality is threefold:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of restraint, the morality of gathering virtuous dharmas, and the morality of acting for the welfare of living beings.

original: bzod pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bzod pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of patience:

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: patience in voluntarily accepting suffering, patience in withstanding the hostility of others, and patience in enduring the hardships involved in seeking knowledge.

original: brtson 'grus la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of effort:

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / yongs su mthar phyin pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / yongs su mthar phyin pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: armor-like effort, applied effort, and the effort of not being satisfied with a little.

original: bsam gtan la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of meditation:

original: nyes pa spong ba dang / rnam par gnas pa can dang / dbang sbyor ba can no //
analyzed: nyes pa spong ba dang / rnam par gnas pa can dang / dbang sbyor ba can no //
translated: meditation that eliminates faults, meditation that stabilizes the mind, and meditation that develops psychic powers.

original: shes rab la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of wisdom:

original: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: wisdom that comes from listening, wisdom that comes from reflecting, and wisdom that comes from meditating.

original: thams la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: thams la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of skillful means:

original: rang gi skyon spong ba dang / sems can 'jug par byed pa dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi skyon spong ba dang / sems can 'jug par byed pa dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba'o //
translated: skillful means that eliminates one’s own faults, skillful means that engages sentient beings, and skillful means that quickly brings about complete enlightenment.

original: smon lam la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: smon lam la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of aspiration:

original: rang gi tshogs dang 'brel pa can dang / sems can gyi don dang rjes su 'brel pa can dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshogs dang 'brel pa can dang / sems can gyi don dang rjes su 'brel pa can dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: related to one's own group, related to the benefit of sentient beings, and to the purification of the Buddha-land.

original: stobs la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: stobs la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Power is threefold:

original: las ldog par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dang / bdud dang pha rol rgol ba ldog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las ldog par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dang / bdud dang pha rol rgol ba ldog par byed pa'o //
translated: it causes the turning back of karma, it causes the turning back of afflictions, and it causes the turning back of Mara and opponents.

original: ye shes la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ye shes la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Knowledge is threefold:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa dang / thabs thams cad las lkog tu ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa dang / thabs thams cad las lkog tu ma gyur pa'o //
translated: non-discrimination, the understanding of the equality of discrimination, and the non-obscuration of all methods.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sems can thams cad la byams pa'i bsam pa yongs su bsgoms pas na pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming tho ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sems can thams cad la byams pa'i bsam pa yongs su bsgoms pas na pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming tho ba'o //
translated: Those perfections such as giving, etc. are called perfections because they perfect the thought of complete enlightenment and because they cultivate the attitude of love for all sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: They are mundane and supramundane.

original: de la bdag la sogs pa dmigs pa ma spangs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag la sogs pa dmigs pa ma spangs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The mundane perfections are those in which the focus on self and so forth is not abandoned.

original: 'jig rten @50b las 'das pa yang phung po la sogs pa la bdag med pa la sogs par mos pas 'jug pa dang / de kho na nyid rtogs pas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten @50b las 'das pa yang phung po la sogs pa la bdag med pa la sogs par mos pas 'jug pa dang / de kho na nyid rtogs pas 'jug pa ste /
translated: The supramundane perfections are those in which one engages through conviction in the selflessness of the aggregates and so forth, and those in which one engages through realization of thatness.

original: de nyid dbu ma la 'jug pa las zla ba grags pas gsungs pa /🔽sbyin dang len pa sbyin pa pos stong pa //
analyzed: de nyid dbu ma la 'jug pa las zla ba grags pas gsungs pa / sbyin dang len pa sbyin pa pos stong pa //
