translated: Candrakīrti’s Introduction to the Middle Way says:🔽Giving is empty of the giver.🔽Giving is a supramundane perfection.

original: sbyin pa 'jig rten las 'das pha rol phyin //🔽de la gang na gzhin  pa skyes gyur pa //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'jig rten las 'das pha rol phyin // de la gang na gzhin  pa skyes gyur pa //
translated: When one who is giving gives a gift,

original: 'jig rten pa yi pha rol phyin par bstan //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi pha rol phyin par bstan //
translated: that is taught to be a mundane perfection.

original: zhes so // thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i dngos po las ye shes 'byung ba'i rim pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rtogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa ni pha rol gyi don yin la /
analyzed: zhes so // thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i dngos po las ye shes 'byung ba'i rim pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rtogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa ni pha rol gyi don yin la /
translated: The ultimate object is the perfection of the realization of omniscience, which is the culmination of the process of the arising of wisdom from the things that are heard, contemplated, and meditated upon.

original: phyin pa'i don ni de'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: phyin pa'i don ni de'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The meaning of perfection is its nature.

original: dngos po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: It is the condition of things.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa nyid la pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa nyid la pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Likewise, generosity itself is the perfection.

original: de ltar tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And so too for morality and so on.

original: de'i phyir yangs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa'i sbyin pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yangs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyin pa gang yin pa'i sbyin pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the generosity of the bodhisattvas who abide in the vast vehicle, which is characterized by the purity of the three spheres, is the perfection of generosity.

original: gang so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sbyin pa ni sbyin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sbyin pa ni sbyin pa kho na'o //
translated: The generosity of ordinary beings is just generosity.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin te //
translated: It is not a perfection,

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i shes rab dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i shes rab dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of the wisdom that is the purity of the three spheres.

original: de'i phyir na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mig kho nar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi mig kho nar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, understand that the perfection of wisdom is the eye of the perfections of generosity and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na dbu ma la 'jug pa las zla ba grags pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na dbu ma la 'jug pa las zla ba grags pas gsungs pa /
translated: For this very reason, Candrakīrti says in his Supplement to the Middle Way:

original: mig ldan skyes bu gcig gis ji ltar 'dod pa'i sar //
analyzed: mig ldan skyes bu gcig gis ji ltar 'dod pa'i sar //
translated: Just as a single sighted person,

original: long ba'i tshogs rnams thams cad bde bar khrid par 'gyur //
analyzed: long ba'i tshogs rnams thams cad bde bar khrid par 'gyur //
translated: leads a whole group of blind people to their desired destination.

original: de bzhin du ni de la dmigs bu med pa rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni de la dmigs bu med pa rnams //
translated: In the same way, those who are without a guide,

original: blo yis bzung nas yon tan rgyal ba nyid du 'gro //
analyzed: blo yis bzung nas yon tan rgyal ba nyid du 'gro //
translated: are led by the mind to the qualities of the Victor.

original: zhes so // de lta bur gyur ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // de lta bur gyur ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa ste /
translated: Thus, he has attained the ten perfections.

original: de ltar rtogs par gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das de la 'di skad ces bshad do //
translated: To that Bhagavat who has become such, this is explained:

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas //
translated: He abides in the ten perfections.

original: zhes pa / de la gnas ni rten yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa / de la gnas ni rten yin te /
translated: Here, “abides” is the support,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po de dag nyid rten gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po de dag nyid rten gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because those very ten perfections are the nature of the support.

original: de dag brten pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag brten pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are supported by that,

original: des ni 'di skad gsungs bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad gsungs bar 'gyur te /
translated: and thus it is said:

original: rten dang brten pa phan tshun 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa phan tshun 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the support and the supported are mutually related, they are taught as the meaning of dependent origination.

original: pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //🔽zhes pa ni 'khor gsum @51a * //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste // zhes pa ni 'khor gsum @51a * //
translated: The ten perfections are purified.

original: yongs su dag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the three spheres are completely pure.

original: sbyin pa'i rdzas dang / sbyin pa'i bdag po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pas pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rdzas dang / sbyin pa'i bdag po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pas pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ten perfections are called purified because the object of giving, the giver, and the recipient are not perceived.

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
translated: The way of the ten perfections

original: zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu kho na'i tshul dang / lam dang thabs gang gi yin pa de la de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu kho na'i tshul dang / lam dang thabs gang gi yin pa de la de skad gsungs so //
translated: is the way, path, and method of the ten perfections themselves.

original: de rnams kyang sa la sbyor ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang sa la sbyor ba 'di lta ste /
translated: Those are applied to the levels as follows.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ba dang / dri ma med pa la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'od byed pa la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'od 'phro ba can la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ba dang / dri ma med pa la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'od byed pa la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'od 'phro ba can la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: On the Joyful level, the perfection of generosity becomes predominant, on the Stainless level, the perfection of moral discipline, on the Luminous, the perfection of patience, on the Radiant, the perfection of diligence,

original: sbyang dka' ba la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon du gyur pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ring du song ba la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mi g-yo ba la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyang dka' ba la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon du gyur pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ring du song ba la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mi g-yo ba la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: On the Difficult to Overcome, the perfection of meditative stabilization; on the Manifested, the perfection of wisdom; on the Gone Afar, the perfection of method; on the Immovable, the perfection of aspiration;

original: legs pa'i blo gros la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos kyi sprin la ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros la stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / chos kyi sprin la ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes so //
translated: on the Excellent Intelligence, the perfection of strength; and on the Cloud of Dharma, the perfection of exalted wisdom.

original: de ltar sa 'di rnams la chos la bdag med pa dang / byams pa'i rtogs pa khyad par can med kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas lhag par byin gyis brlabs pas khyad par so sor thob bo //
analyzed: de ltar sa 'di rnams la chos la bdag med pa dang / byams pa'i rtogs pa khyad par can med kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas lhag par byin gyis brlabs pas khyad par so sor thob bo //
translated: Thus, although on these stages there is no special realization of the selflessness of phenomena or of love, they are individually attained through the special blessings of the purity of the perfections such as generosity.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad che ba ni smon lam gyi stobs kyis de rnams las mtha' yas pa thun mong ma yin par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad che ba ni smon lam gyi stobs kyis de rnams las mtha' yas pa thun mong ma yin par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The greatness of all the sravakas and so on is that through the power of their aspirations they become unshared with them.

original: de las zhes pa ni ye shes kyi gnas skabs te spyod yul zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de las zhes pa ni ye shes kyi gnas skabs te spyod yul zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: “From that” refers to the state of gnosis, up to “the domain.”

original: de la rtogs shing khong du chud pa'i khyad par las gong ma gong ma'i ye shes la rab tu gnas pa'i sbyong bas ye shes de dang yon tan gyi rten gyi sbyor bas kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la rtogs shing khong du chud pa'i khyad par las gong ma gong ma'i ye shes la rab tu gnas pa'i sbyong bas ye shes de dang yon tan gyi rten gyi sbyor bas kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: There, the difference in realization and comprehension is due to the purification of the higher and higher gnosis, and also due to the application of the support of that gnosis and its qualities.

original: thams cad du sems can gyi khams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad du sems can gyi khams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: It is due to the general characteristics of the realm of sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir /🔽chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa //
translated: Because:🔽Apart from the dharmadhātu,

original: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
translated: there is no such thing as a phenomenon.

original: zhes so // de bas bdag nyid dang mnyam pa nyid du 'thob ste /
analyzed: zhes so // de bas bdag nyid dang mnyam pa nyid du 'thob ste /
translated: Therefore, one attains equality with oneself,

original: bdag med pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in selflessness.

original: 'di'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis ye shes gcig la'ang bcu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis ye shes gcig la'ang bcu zhes gsungs so //
translated: Due to the difference in its state, even a single gnosis is said to be tenfold.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /🔽mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa / mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
translated: That is stated:🔽The Lord is the master of the ten grounds,

original: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
analyzed: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
translated: the one who abides on the ten grounds.

original: zhes pa ni rab tu @51b dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste /🔽bdag po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rab tu @51b dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste / bdag po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: He is the lord of the ten stages, such as the Joyous.

original: de nyid sa gang dang gang du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dbang thob pa'i phyir na mgon po zhes gsungs so //🔽sa bcu de dag nyid la so sor gnas pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid sa gang dang gang du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dbang thob pa'i phyir na mgon po zhes gsungs so // sa bcu de dag nyid la so sor gnas pa'i phyir na /
translated: He is the protector because he has attained mastery in the perfections, such as generosity, on whatever stage.

original: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //🔽zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po // zhes gsungs so ;
translated: He is the one who abides on the ten stages, because he is situated on each of the ten stages.🔽He is the one who has the ten knowledges, because he has the ten knowledges.

original: / shes bcu rnam dag ces pa ni shes pa bcu'i rnam grangs ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: / shes bcu rnam dag ces pa ni shes pa bcu'i rnam grangs ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang /
translated: The ten knowledges are the categories of the ten knowledges: knowledge of dharmas, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of others' minds, conventional knowledge, knowledge of suffering, knowledge of origin,

original: 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of cessation, knowledge of the path, knowledge of elimination, and knowledge of nonproduction.

original: de la chos shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of dharmas?

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyu la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'gog pa la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyu la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'gog pa la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: It is the absence of attachment in regard to the formations associated with the realm of desire, the absence of attachment in regard to the cause of the formations associated with the realm of desire, the absence of attachment in regard to the cessation of the formations associated with the realm of desire,

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams 'joms pa'i don du lam la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams 'joms pa'i don du lam la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa rnams so //
translated: and the absence of attachment in regard to the path which leads to the destruction of the formations associated with the realm of desire.

original: yang chos kyi shes pa dang / chos kyi shes pa'i sa la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa de nyid chos shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang chos kyi shes pa dang / chos kyi shes pa'i sa la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa de nyid chos shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Moreover, the absence of attachment in regard to the cognition of the teaching and the absence of attachment in regard to the stage of the cognition of the teaching are called the cognition of the teaching.

original: rjes su shes pa'i rtogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i rtogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cognition of the subsequent?

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang /🔽gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'gog pa la zag pa med pa'i shes pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams 'joms pa'i don du lam la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi 'gog pa la zag pa med pa'i shes pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams 'joms pa'i don du lam la gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa rnams dang /
translated: It is the uncontaminated knowledge of the aggregates conjoined with the form and formless realms, the uncontaminated knowledge of the cause of the aggregates conjoined with the form and formless realms,🔽the uncontaminated knowledge of the cessation of the aggregates conjoined with the form and formless realms, the uncontaminated knowledge of the path that is the means to abandon the aggregates conjoined with the form and formless realms,

original: yang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i la zag pa med pa'i shes pa zhes gsungs pa de nyid rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i la zag pa med pa'i shes pa zhes gsungs pa de nyid rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'o //
translated: and the uncontaminated knowledge of the knowledge that realizes the aggregates conjoined with the form and formless realms.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of others' minds?

original: sgom pa'i rang @52a * //
analyzed: sgom pa'i rang @52a * //
translated: The nature of meditation.🔽🔽

original: bzhin gyi shes pa gang yin pa'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bsgom pas bgrod par bya ba so sor thob cing bral ba'i shes pa gang gis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi mnyam par gzhag pa mngon du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bzhin gyi shes pa gang yin pa'i bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bsgom pas bgrod par bya ba so sor thob cing bral ba'i shes pa gang gis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi mnyam par gzhag pa mngon du gyur pa ste /
translated: The result of cultivation is the knowledge of the attainment and separation of the object to be traversed by cultivation, which is the knowledge of the nature of meditation.

original: pha rol rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams shes pa sde tshan gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: pha rol rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams shes pa sde tshan gcig tu byas te /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another is the knowledge of the minds and mental factors of others, which is made into one class.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos 'di ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos 'di ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa'o //
translated: This uncontaminated knowledge is the knowledge of the mind of another.

original: kun rdzob shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conventional knowledge?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is contaminated knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of suffering?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid yid la byed pa'i gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa 'di ni sdug bsngal shes pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid yid la byed pa'i gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa 'di ni sdug bsngal shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the five appropriated aggregates as impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial, which is uncontaminated knowledge. This is the knowledge of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of the origin?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen rnams su yid la byed pas gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung shes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen rnams su yid la byed pas gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the cause of the impure as cause, origin, generation, and condition.

original: 'gog pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of cessation?

original: 'gog pa la 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba rnams yid la byed pa gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa zhes gsungs pa de ni 'gog pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba rnams yid la byed pa gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa zhes gsungs pa de ni 'gog pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the cessation of the impure as cessation, calm, excellent, and escape.

original: lam shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of the path?

original: lam la lam dang / rig pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa rnams su yid la byed pas gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa zhes gang gsungs pa de ni lam shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam la lam dang / rig pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa rnams su yid la byed pas gang zag pa med pa'i shes pa zhes gang gsungs pa de ni lam shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the path of the impure as path, truth, acquisition, and definitive release.

original: zang pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zang pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of the destruction?

original: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes pa dang / bdag gis kun 'byung spangs so //
analyzed: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes pa dang / bdag gis kun 'byung spangs so //
translated: I have completely understood suffering.

original: bdag gis 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: bdag gis 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: I have abandoned the origin.🔽I have realized cessation.🔽 I have cultivated the path.

original: bdag gis lam bsgoms zin pas slar bsgom du med do zhes shes pa de nyid nye bar gzung ba'i shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / rig pa dang / rtogs pa dang / shes rab kyi snang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa de gsungs pa ni zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis lam bsgoms zin pas slar bsgom du med do zhes shes pa de nyid nye bar gzung ba'i shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / rig pa dang / rtogs pa dang / shes rab kyi snang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa de gsungs pa ni zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that there is no more to cultivate is the knowledge of exhaustion.

original: mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of non-arising?

original: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
analyzed: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
translated: I have completely understood suffering.🔽 I have nothing more to understand.

original: yang yongs su shes par byar med do zhes pa dang / kun 'byung rab tu spangs so //🔽yang spang du med pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: yang yongs su shes par byar med do zhes pa dang / kun 'byung rab tu spangs so // yang spang du med pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: I have abandoned the origin.🔽 I have nothing more to abandon.🔽I have realized cessation.🔽 I have nothing more to realize.

original: yang mngon du byar med pa dang / lam bsgoms so //
analyzed: yang mngon du byar med pa dang / lam bsgoms so //
translated: I have cultivated the path.

original: yang bsgom par byar med do //
analyzed: yang bsgom par byar med do //
translated: I have nothing more to cultivate.

original: @52b zhes shes pa de nye bar gzung ste /
analyzed: @52b zhes shes pa de nye bar gzung ste /
translated: The knowledge that there is nothing more to do is the knowledge of non-arising.

original: shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / rig pa dang / rtogs pa dang / shes rab kyi snang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni mi skye ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / rig pa dang / rtogs pa dang / shes rab kyi snang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni mi skye ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: This knowledge, seeing, awareness, realization, illumination of wisdom, and realization is the knowledge of non-arising.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /🔽shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa / shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can //
translated: That is stated:🔽The one with the nature of the ten pure knowledges,

original: shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba po //🔽zhes so ; / de bas na shes pa bcu po de dag gis rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dang gang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de ni /🔽shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can //
analyzed: shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba po // zhes so ; / de bas na shes pa bcu po de dag gis rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dang gang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de ni / shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can //
translated: The one who holds the ten pure knowledges.🔽Therefore, the Bhagavān, who possesses the nature of the pure ten knowledges,🔽The one with the nature of the ten pure knowledges,

original: zhes so // shes pa bcu po de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes 'dzin pas na /
analyzed: zhes so // shes pa bcu po de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes 'dzin pas na /
translated: Since he holds the pure ten knowledges, the naturally luminous wisdom,

original: shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba po //
analyzed: shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba po //
translated: The one who holds the ten pure knowledges.

original: zhes pa ste mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ste mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is free from all signs.

original: rnam pa bcu zhes pa ni 'di ltar dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu zhes pa ni 'di ltar dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa /
translated: The ten aspects are as stated in Distinguishing the Middle from the Extremes:

original: gcig dang rgyu dang za ba dang // byed pa dang ni dbang bsgyur dang // bdag po don dang rtag pa dang // nyon mongs pa dang dag pa'i gnas //
analyzed: gcig dang rgyu dang za ba dang // byed pa dang ni dbang bsgyur dang // bdag po don dang rtag pa dang // nyon mongs pa dang dag pa'i gnas //
translated: afflicted and pure states.

original: rnal 'byor can dang ma grol grol //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can dang ma grol grol //
translated: The yogi and the liberated and unliberated.

original: 'di dag la ni bdag tu lta //
analyzed: 'di dag la ni bdag tu lta //
translated: These are the views of self.

original: zhes so // rnam pa bcu po ni 'di rnams bdag tu 'dzin pas phung po la sogs pa la rab tu 'jug pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhes so // rnam pa bcu po ni 'di rnams bdag tu 'dzin pas phung po la sogs pa la rab tu 'jug pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten aspects are the engagement of the views of self in the aggregates and so on. They are as follows:

original: gcig pur 'dzin pa dang / rgyur 'dzin pa dang / za bar 'dzin pa dang / byed par 'dzin pa dang / rang dbang du 'dzin pa dang / bdag por 'dzin pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: gcig pur 'dzin pa dang / rgyur 'dzin pa dang / za bar 'dzin pa dang / byed par 'dzin pa dang / rang dbang du 'dzin pa dang / bdag por 'dzin pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: Grasping at one, grasping at cause, grasping at experiencer, grasping at doer, grasping at independent nature, grasping at master, grasping at permanence, grasping at afflicted and

original: rnam par byang bar 'dzin pa dang / rnal 'byor can du 'dzin pa dang / ma grol ba grol bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'dzin pa dang / rnal 'byor can du 'dzin pa dang / ma grol ba grol bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: purified states, grasping at the yogi, and grasping at the liberated and unliberated.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rnam pa bcu po zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The ten aspects.

original: / de rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi sems phung po la sogs pa la kun du rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i rnam pa bdag tu 'dzin pa bcu'o //
analyzed: / de rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi sems phung po la sogs pa la kun du rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i rnam pa bdag tu 'dzin pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten aspects of self-habits that distract the mind from the aggregates, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na don bsdus pa las phyogs kyi glang po'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /🔽rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems bcu yis //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na don bsdus pa las phyogs kyi glang po'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa / rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems bcu yis //
translated: Thus, in the Compendium of the Universal Vehicle, Vasubandhu says:🔽The ten distracted minds

original: sems g-yeng rnams kyis gzhan yin na //🔽gnyis med ye shes bsgrub pa la //
analyzed: sems g-yeng rnams kyis gzhan yin na // gnyis med ye shes bsgrub pa la //
translated: are different from the distracted minds.🔽The childish are not fit

original: byis pa rnams ni skal mi ldan //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni skal mi ldan //
translated: for the realization of nondual intuition.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa bcu po de gang gi yin pa'i bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa bcu po de gang gi yin pa'i bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Thus, the ten aspects of self-habits are the ones of the Lord.

original: de ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa thams cad kyis so sor @53a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa thams cad kyis so sor @53a * //
translated: Why?

original: snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽don bcu zhes pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba'i phyir ro // don bcu zhes pa ni /
translated: Because they are the individual appearances of all the aspects of the counteragent.

original: de'i gnyen po'i don bcu yang de nyid la brjod de /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i don bcu yang de nyid la brjod de /
translated: The ten meanings are also the ten meanings of the counteragent to those,

original: rtsa ba'i mtshan nyid de kho na //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i mtshan nyid de kho na //
translated: the reality of the root.

original: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid dang // 'bras bu rgyu yi de kho na //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid dang // 'bras bu rgyu yi de kho na //
translated: the reality of the result and cause,🔽the reality of the subtle and coarse,🔽the reality of the object of renown and purity,🔽the reality of the characteristics of inclusion and division,🔽and the reality of the expert.

original: phra ba dang ni rags pa dang // grags dang rnam par dag yul dang // bsdu dang dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang // mkhas de kho na rnam bcu ste //
analyzed: phra ba dang ni rags pa dang // grags dang rnam par dag yul dang // bsdu dang dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang // mkhas de kho na rnam bcu ste //
translated: The reality of the unmistaken characteristics is the antidote to the view of the transitory collection.🔽The reality of the result and cause is the antidote to the view of annihilation and permanence.🔽The reality of the subtle and coarse is the antidote to the view of the extremes.🔽The reality of the object of renown and purity is the antidote to the view of the one who acts and the experiencer.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'o //🔽zhes bya ba 'di dag go //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'o // zhes bya ba 'di dag go //
translated: The reality of the characteristics of inclusion and division is the antidote to the view of the self.🔽The reality of the expert is the antidote to the view of the transitory collection.🔽The ten types of reality are

original: de kho na rnam pa bcu ste //
analyzed: de kho na rnam pa bcu ste //
translated: the reality of the root,🔽the reality of the characteristics,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: the reality of the unmistaken,🔽the reality of the result and cause,🔽the reality of the subtle and coarse,🔽the reality of the object of renown and purity,🔽the reality of the characteristics of inclusion and division,

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na nyid dang / rags pa dang phra ba'i de kho na nyid dang /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na nyid dang / rags pa dang phra ba'i de kho na nyid dang /
translated: and the reality of the expert.

original: grags pa'i de kho na dang / rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na dang / bsdu ba'i de kho na dang / dbye ba'i de kho na dang / mkhas pa'i de kho na dang / rnam pa bcu po de dag bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa bcu'i gnyen por rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: grags pa'i de kho na dang / rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na dang / bsdu ba'i de kho na dang / dbye ba'i de kho na dang / mkhas pa'i de kho na dang / rnam pa bcu po de dag bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa bcu'i gnyen por rig par bya'o ;
translated: These ten should be known as the antidotes to the ten kinds of self-habits.

original: / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: don bcu'i don zhes so //
analyzed: don bcu'i don zhes so //
translated: The meaning of the ten meanings.

original: de la mkhas pa'i don bcu po 'di rnams de'i gnyen po'i phyogs 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don gyi de kho na ste /
analyzed: de la mkhas pa'i don bcu po 'di rnams de'i gnyen po'i phyogs 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don gyi de kho na ste /
translated: Among them, these ten kinds of expertise are the reality of the meaning that is their antidote.🔽They are the meaning of the meaning of the ten meanings because they are the meaning of the meaning of the ten meanings.

original: don du gnyer bar bya bas don te /🔽dam pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir bcu po de dag gi don bcu po ni mkhas pa'i de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: don du gnyer bar bya bas don te / dam pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro // de'i phyir bcu po de dag gi don bcu po ni mkhas pa'i de kho na nyid de /
translated: They are the meaning of the meaning of the ten meanings because they are the meaning of the meaning of the ten meanings.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the ten meanings of those ten are the reality of expertise, which should be known as the antidote to the view of self.

original: rgyas par de nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyas par de nyid du gsungs so //
translated: They are explained in detail in that text.

original: 'dir gzhung mangs su dogs nas ma bris so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung mangs su dogs nas ma bris so //
translated: Fearing excessive length, I will not write more here.

original: rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i don //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po don bcu'i don //
translated: The ten kinds of expertise are the meaning of the ten meanings.

original: zhes pa des ji skad gsungs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa des ji skad gsungs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What does this mean?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs thams cad kyi rang bzhin du bcom ldan 'das de nyid rig par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs thams cad kyi rang bzhin du bcom ldan 'das de nyid rig par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The Bhagavat is to be known as the nature of all the counteragents and the antidotes.

original: thub dbang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thub dbang zhes pa ni /
translated: The Lord of Sages

original: de la phyin ci ma log par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don nye bar ston cing /
analyzed: de la phyin ci ma log par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don nye bar ston cing /
translated: He teaches the meaning of dependent origination without error.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus par bsags pa'i dbang phyug yang dag par 'phen pa bla na med pa'i ston pa ;
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus par bsags pa'i dbang phyug yang dag par 'phen pa bla na med pa'i ston pa ;
translated: He is the Lord who has accumulated the stores of merit and wisdom without exception, the unsurpassed teacher who is the true projector,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi thub pa rnams kyi bdag po ni thub pa'i dbang po de nyid de /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi thub pa rnams kyi bdag po ni thub pa'i dbang po de nyid de /
translated: and he is the Lord of the sages, the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro /
translated: He is the Lord of Sages because he is difficult to find.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: thub dbang zhes so //
analyzed: thub dbang zhes so //
translated: The Lord of Sages

original: de nyid kyi phyir na 'phags pa klu sgrub snying po'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na 'phags pa klu sgrub snying po'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa /
translated: For this very reason, the noble Nagarjunagarbha says:

original: gang gis skye dang 'jig pa dag /'di yi @53b tshul gyis rab spangs pa //
analyzed: gang gis skye dang 'jig pa dag /'di yi @53b tshul gyis rab spangs pa //
translated: Whoever, by this method, has completely abandoned🔽arising and cessation,

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung gsungs pa yi //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung gsungs pa yi //
translated: the one who has taught dependent origination,

original: thub dbang de la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: thub dbang de la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage to that Lord of Sages.

original: zhes so // stobs bcu zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes so // stobs bcu zhes pa ni /
translated: The ten powers are as follows.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas are as follows:

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa sna chogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa sna chogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing what is correct and what is incorrect; the power of knowing the ripening of karma; the power of knowing the various dhātus; the power of knowing the various inclinations; the power of knowing the various faculties; the power of knowing the path that leads everywhere; the power of knowing the meditative absorptions, liberations, and so on; the power of knowing one’s own and others’ past lives; the power of knowing death, transference, and rebirth; and the power of knowing the cessation of contaminants.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ; thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ; thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te /
translated: The power of knowledge of the maturation of actions, the power of knowledge of all the paths and their respective destinations, the power of knowledge of recollection of past lives, the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, and the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants.

original: de ni ye shes kyi stobs rnam pa bcu po 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mthu stobs kyi khyad par rab tu bsgoms pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa med pa mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas la sogs pa'i spros pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ye shes kyi stobs rnam pa bcu po 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mthu stobs kyi khyad par rab tu bsgoms pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa med pa mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas la sogs pa'i spros pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are the ten powers of knowledge. The Bhagavān has fully cultivated the distinctive strength of these powers and has realized the nonconceptual sameness of the bases and so on.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: stobs bcu zhes pa ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu zhes pa ste /
translated: The ten powers.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po de dag thams cad dang gang ldan pa de ni de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po de dag thams cad dang gang ldan pa de ni de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: One who possesses all of these ten powers of the Tathāgata is said to be so.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na khyab bdag ni bdag nyid chen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na khyab bdag ni bdag nyid chen po ste /
translated: Therefore the all-pervading lord is the great self.

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba thams cad kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //🔽ces pa ni ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i 'gro ba'i don byed pa ni /
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba thams cad kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro // kun gyi don ni ma lus byed // ces pa ni ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i 'gro ba'i don byed pa ni /
translated: Because of the nature of all things, moving and unmoving.🔽He performs the benefit of all without exception.

original: kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
analyzed: kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
translated: He performs the benefit of all without exception.

original: ces so // de byed pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni /🔽kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
analyzed: ces so // de byed pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni / kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
translated: He who has the method of performing that is

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: He performs the benefit of all without exception.

original: bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Bhagavat.

original: rnam bcu dbang ldan che ba po //🔽zhes pa ni //
analyzed: rnam bcu dbang ldan che ba po // zhes pa ni //
translated: The great one who has the ten masteries.

original: de la rnam bcu ni dbang bcu'o //
analyzed: de la rnam bcu ni dbang bcu'o //
translated: Therein, the ten are the ten masteries.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: tshol dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: tshol dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba dang /
translated: The mastery of seeking, the mastery of karma, the mastery of requisites, the mastery of aspiration, the mastery of vows, the mastery of miracles, the mastery of birth, the mastery of Dharma,

original: sems la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba zhes so //
analyzed: sems la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba zhes so //
translated: the mastery of mind, and the mastery of gnosis.

original: dbang ba rnam pa bcu po de dag gi mtshan nyid chos rnams la dbang du gyur pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni rnam bcu dbang @54a * //
analyzed: dbang ba rnam pa bcu po de dag gi mtshan nyid chos rnams la dbang du gyur pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni rnam bcu dbang @54a * //
translated: He who possesses the ten kinds of mastery is the one who has the ten kinds of mastery.

original: ldan te / de'i phyir yang thams cad la dbang ba'i chos brnyes pa'i phyir che ba po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ldan te / de'i phyir yang thams cad la dbang ba'i chos brnyes pa'i phyir che ba po zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he is called the Great One because he has attained the Dharma of mastery over all things.

original: thog ma med pa zhes pa ni thog ma ste skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa zhes pa ni thog ma ste skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni thog ma med pa'o //
translated: The phrase “without beginning” means that he is without beginning, that is, without birth.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir na 'jig pa'ang med par don gyi shugs las shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir na 'jig pa'ang med par don gyi shugs las shes par bya'o ;
translated: Since there is no birth, there is also no cessation, as is understood by implication.

original: / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma bcom pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma bcom pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase “he has destroyed beginning and end” means that he has attained the gnosis of nonabiding nirvana.

original: spros med bdag ces pa ni spros pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / gzung 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos de rnams kyi bdag nyid de rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: spros med bdag ces pa ni spros pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / gzung 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos de rnams kyi bdag nyid de rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba ni /
translated: The phrase “he is the self without conceptual elaboration” means that he is free from the conceptual elaboration of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, and from the phenomena characterized by subject and object.

original: gang gi phyir 'di spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because it is the nature of non-elaboration,

original: de bzhin nyid bdag ces pa ni de la de bzhin nyid ni gzhan du mi 'gyur bas na de bzhin nyid kyi don to //🔽rtag pa dang de bzhin nyid ces bya bar byas pas na de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid de rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid bdag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid bdag ces pa ni de la de bzhin nyid ni gzhan du mi 'gyur bas na de bzhin nyid kyi don to // rtag pa dang de bzhin nyid ces bya bar byas pas na de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid de rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid bdag ste /
translated: thusness is the self. Thusness is the meaning of thusness because it does not change into something else.🔽It is the nature of thusness because it is made to be permanent and thusness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “the nature of emptiness” is the meaning of “the nature of thusness is the self.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir na dag pa'i bdag ces pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na dag pa'i bdag ces pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is the pure self.

original: glo bur gyi dri ma med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is free from adventitious stains,

original: de'i rang bzhin ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: its nature does not change into something else.

original: bden par smra zhing zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bden par smra zhing zhes pa ni /
translated: It is the truth-speaker.

original: de la bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four noble truths are the truths.

original: de rnams smra bar byed pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams smra bar byed pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who has the method of speaking about them is called that.

original: yang na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo'i don ni bden pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo'i don ni bden pa'i don to //
translated: Or else, the meaning of the truth is the meaning of profound dependent origination.

original: de smra bar byed pa ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de smra bar byed pa ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: To expound that is as above.

original: de nyid 'phags pa klu sgrub snying po'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /🔽'di la bsal ba ci yang med //
analyzed: de nyid 'phags pa klu sgrub snying po'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa / 'di la bsal ba ci yang med //
translated: That very thing is stated by the noble-minded one, the venerable Nagarjuna:🔽Here there is nothing to be removed

original: gzhag par bya ba ci yang med //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba ci yang med //
translated: and not the slightest to be added.

original: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: The real is to be seen as real

original: yang dag mthong na rnam par gro //
analyzed: yang dag mthong na rnam par gro //
translated: and when it is seen, one is set free.

original: zhes so // tshig mi 'gyur zhes pa ni sems can thams cad la rigs ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir ro //🔽ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed //
analyzed: zhes so // tshig mi 'gyur zhes pa ni sems can thams cad la rigs ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir ro // ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed //
translated: The phrase “the word is not changed” is because the wheel of the Dharma is turned without error in accordance with the lineage of all sentient beings.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: “He does what he says” is

original: ji ltar chos thams cad stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / chu zla lta bu zhes ston cing de bzhin du yid la'ang byed pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cad stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / chu zla lta bu zhes ston cing de bzhin du yid la'ang byed pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because he teaches that all phenomena are empty, selfless, like illusions, dreams, mirages, cities of gandharvas, and the moon in water, and because he thinks of them in that way.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed //
translated: He does what he says.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshig mi 'gyur zhes te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshig mi 'gyur zhes te /
translated: Therefore, his words are unchanging,

original: bden pa'i tshig gis sems can thams cad @54b la rigs ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig gis sems can thams cad @54b la rigs ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because with words of truth he turns the wheel of the true Dharma for all sentient beings, in accordance with their lineages.

original: gnyis med ces pa ni gzung 'dzin gnyis med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis med ces pa ni gzung 'dzin gnyis med pa ste /
translated: Nondual means without the duality of subject and object.

original: de'i med pa'i dngos po ni gnyis med ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i med pa'i dngos po ni gnyis med ces gsungs te /
translated: The thing that is the absence of that is called nondual.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //
translated: That is the Bhagavat himself.

original: don dam par gnyis med na yang kun rdzob tu gnyis su ston pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: don dam par gnyis med na yang kun rdzob tu gnyis su ston pa'o zhes so //
translated: Although ultimately nondual, he teaches dualistically in the conventional sense.

original: yang dag mtha' la rnam par gnas //
analyzed: yang dag mtha' la rnam par gnas //
translated: He abides in the limit of reality.

original: zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis yang dag mtha' ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis yang dag mtha' ste /
translated: This is the perfect limit in the sense of non-error.

original: phyin ci log gi gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no basis for error.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' de la rnam par gnas pa de ni de'i rang bzhin dang dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' de la rnam par gnas pa de ni de'i rang bzhin dang dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And he abides in that perfect limit, because it is his nature and inseparable from him.

original: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan // zhes pa ni /
translated: He has the lion’s roar of selflessness.

original: de la bdag med pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la bdag med pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, selflessness is threefold:

original: mtshan nyid med pas bdag med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pas bdag med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa'o //
translated: selflessness by the absence of defining characteristics, selflessness by the discordant defining characteristics, and selflessness by its own defining characteristics.

original: bdag med pa gsum po de nyid seng ge bas na /
analyzed: bdag med pa gsum po de nyid seng ge bas na /
translated: And just that threefold selflessness is his lion,

original: bdag med seng ge ste /
analyzed: bdag med seng ge ste /
translated: so he is the lion of selflessness.🔽He is like a lion because he is fearless toward all,

original: kun la nyam ming ba nyid kyi phyir seng ge dang 'dra bas seng ge ste /
analyzed: kun la nyam ming ba nyid kyi phyir seng ge dang 'dra bas seng ge ste /
translated: so he is the lion of selflessness.

original: bdag med pa'i seng ge'i sgra ni bdag med seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i seng ge'i sgra ni bdag med seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: He has the lion’s roar of selflessness, so he is the lion of selflessness.

original: de dang gang ldan pa de bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dang gang ldan pa de bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan zhes gsungs so //
translated: He who has that is said to have the lion’s roar of selflessness.

original: mu stegs ri dags ngan 'jigs byed //
analyzed: mu stegs ri dags ngan 'jigs byed //
translated: The bad fords of the tirthikas are frightened away.

original: ces pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgya mtshor 'jug pa'i don gyis lam ni mu dang stegs te /
analyzed: ces pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgya mtshor 'jug pa'i don gyis lam ni mu dang stegs te /
translated: The path is a ford because it is the means of entering the ocean of nirvana.

original: des na mu yang yin la mu stegs kyang yin pas mu stegs ngan pa'o //
analyzed: des na mu yang yin la mu stegs kyang yin pas mu stegs ngan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a ford and also a bad ford, so it is a bad ford.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na ri dags te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na ri dags te /
translated: For that very reason, it is a deer,

original: bdag med pa'i seng ge'i sgras 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i seng ge'i sgras 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is frightened by the lion's roar of selflessness.

original: 'jigs par byed pa'i tshul gang yin pa de ni 'jigs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs par byed pa'i tshul gang yin pa de ni 'jigs par byed pa ste /
translated: The way in which it frightens is that it frightens.

original: mu stegs ri dags ngan pa rnams 'jigs par byed pa ni mu stegs te ri drags ngan pa 'jigs byed do //
analyzed: mu stegs ri dags ngan pa rnams 'jigs par byed pa ni mu stegs te ri drags ngan pa 'jigs byed do //
translated: The bad fords of the tirthikas are frightened away.

original: de ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: stong ba nyid kyi yi ge sgras //
analyzed: stong ba nyid kyi yi ge sgras //
translated: By the sound of the syllable of emptiness,

original: rgol ba thams cad skrag par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgol ba thams cad skrag par 'gyur //
translated: all opponents are frightened.

original: gang dang gang la 'jug na yang //
analyzed: gang dang gang la 'jug na yang //
translated: Wherever one enters,

original: de dang de la stong pa nyid //
analyzed: de dang de la stong pa nyid //
translated: there emptiness is.

original: ces so // kun du 'gro ba zhes pa ni byin rlabs las byung ba'i shes pa bzhin du kun du 'gro bas na sprul pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: ces so // kun du 'gro ba zhes pa ni byin rlabs las byung ba'i shes pa bzhin du kun du 'gro bas na sprul pa'i sku ste /
translated: The term “omnipresent” means that the nirmāṇakāya is omnipresent, like the consciousness that arises from the transformation of the ālaya.

original: de ltar bdag brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is the self-appearance of the nirmāṇakāya.

original: yang na kun du 'gro ba ni lnga kun 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: yang na kun du 'gro ba ni lnga kun 'gro ba ste /
translated: Again, “omnipresent” means the five omnipresent mental factors.

original: de la 'di rnams ni sa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di rnams ni sa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called “great.”

original: sa chen po'i ris thams cad kyi sems las byung bar gyur pa ste /🔽de la yang re zhig reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / tshor @55a * //
analyzed: sa chen po'i ris thams cad kyi sems las byung bar gyur pa ste / de la yang re zhig reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / tshor @55a * //
translated: They are mental factors of all the great realms.🔽They are the phenomena of the nature of contact, attention, sensation,

original: ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos rnams so //
translated: perception, and intention.

original: de rnams dang gang ldan pa de ni kun du 'gro ba zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams dang gang ldan pa de ni kun du 'gro ba zhes so //
translated: They are called “omnipresent” because they are present in all of those.

original: don yod stabs zhes pa ni don yod ni bcings pa med pa'o //
analyzed: don yod stabs zhes pa ni don yod ni bcings pa med pa'o //
translated: The term “Amogha-hasta” means that Amogha is unbound.

original: stabs ni 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: stabs ni 'gro ba ste /
translated: Hasta means “going.”

original: de dang gang ldan pa de ni don yod stabs so //
analyzed: de dang gang ldan pa de ni don yod stabs so //
translated: One who possesses that is Amogha-hasta.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yid ltar mgyogs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yid ltar mgyogs //
translated: The Tathāgata is swift like the mind.

original: zhes pa ni skad cig ma gcig kho nas gzhal du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni skad cig ma gcig kho nas gzhal du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it goes everywhere in the immeasurable world-realms in a single moment.

original: rgyal ba zhes pa ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams las 'dis rgyal ba'i phyir na rgyal ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyal ba zhes pa ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams las 'dis rgyal ba'i phyir na rgyal ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Victorious One is so called because he has conquered the unwholesome factors.

original: rnam rgyal zhes pa ni rnam par rgyal ba dang ldan pa yin pas na rnam rgyal lo //
analyzed: rnam rgyal zhes pa ni rnam par rgyal ba dang ldan pa yin pas na rnam rgyal lo //
translated: The Victorious is so called because he is endowed with victory.

original: dgra las rgyal zhes pa ni dgra ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dgra las rgyal zhes pa ni dgra ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The Conqueror is so called because he has conquered the enemies. The enemies are the afflictions.

original: 'dis de las rgyal ba'i phyir na dgra las rgyal lo //
analyzed: 'dis de las rgyal ba'i phyir na dgra las rgyal lo //
translated: He is the Conqueror because he has conquered them.🔽The Wheel-turning King is so called because he is a wheel-turning king.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba zhes pa ni chos mngon pa las 'khor los sgyur ba bzhi zhes brjod do //🔽de rnams kyi yang 'byung ba'i dus ni gang 'khor lo ni ji lta bu dang ldan /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba zhes pa ni chos mngon pa las 'khor los sgyur ba bzhi zhes brjod do // de rnams kyi yang 'byung ba'i dus ni gang 'khor lo ni ji lta bu dang ldan /
translated: In the Abhidharma, four kinds of wheel-turning kings are mentioned.🔽When do they appear? What kind of wheel do they possess?

original: cig car 'byung ngam ji lta bu'i 'gro ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: cig car 'byung ngam ji lta bu'i 'gro ba yin zhe na /
translated: Do they appear simultaneously? What kind of world do they inhabit?

original: de'i phyir dbyig gnyen zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyig gnyen zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, Vasubandhu says:

original: 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba ni //
translated: The appearance of the wheel-turning kings

original: stong phrag brgyad cu las mi 'phyi //
analyzed: stong phrag brgyad cu las mi 'phyi //
translated: The others are no later than eighty thousand.

original: gsir dngul zangs lcags 'khor lo can //
analyzed: gsir dngul zangs lcags 'khor lo can //
translated: The wheels are made of iron, copper, silver, and gold.

original: de dag gling gcig gling gnyis dang ; / gsum dang bzhi lam rim pa bzhin //
analyzed: de dag gling gcig gling gnyis dang ; / gsum dang bzhi lam rim pa bzhin //
translated: They rule over one, two, three, and four continents, respectively.

original: phas bsu rang 'gro g-yul bshams dang // mtshon brtsams pas rgyal gnod pa med //
analyzed: phas bsu rang 'gro g-yul bshams dang // mtshon brtsams pas rgyal gnod pa med //
translated: The first is met by the king, the second goes by himself, the third engages in battle, and the fourth conquers by brandishing a weapon.

original: lhan cig gnyis min sangs rgyas bzhin //
analyzed: lhan cig gnyis min sangs rgyas bzhin //
translated: There are never two at the same time, like two Buddhas.

original: zhes so // de'i tshul gyis so sor snang ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i tshul gyis so sor snang ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: This is the way the individual appearances of the universal monarchs are.

original: yang na dpal bde mchog gi rgyud las gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang na dpal bde mchog gi rgyud las gsungs pa /
translated: Or, as it is said in the glorious tantra of Cakrasaṃvara:

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir na 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir na 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: Because he has the form of a universal monarch, he is a universal monarch.

original: de nyid kyi phyir stobs po che zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir stobs po che zhes pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is called Mahābala.

original: chen po yang de yin la stobs kyang de yin pas stobs chen ni dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la stobs kyang de yin pas stobs chen ni dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi'o //
translated: He is great and he is powerful, so Mahābala is the four-branched army.

original: de dang gang ldan pa de stobs po che zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dang gang ldan pa de stobs po che zhes gsungs so //
translated: He who possesses that is called Mahābala.

original: tshogs kyi slob dpon chogs kyi mchog / tshogs rje tshogs bdag dbang dang ldan //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: tshogs kyi slob dpon chogs kyi mchog / tshogs rje tshogs bdag dbang dang ldan // zhes pa ni /
translated: lord of the assembly, master of the assembly, powerful.

original: de la tshogs ni nyan thos kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de la tshogs ni nyan thos kyi tshogs so //
translated: Here, the assembly is the assembly of disciples.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ni tshogs kyi mchog ste gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ni tshogs kyi mchog ste gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The chief of the assembly is the chief of the assembly, meaning the principal one.

original: tshogs kyi slob dpon ni tshogs ni rang rgyal gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: tshogs kyi slob dpon ni tshogs ni rang rgyal gyi tshogs so //
translated: The master of the assembly is the assembly of the self-conquerors.

original: de rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i man ngag ston @55b pa'i phyir na slob dpon te 'jam dpal nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i man ngag ston @55b pa'i phyir na slob dpon te 'jam dpal nyid do //
translated: Because he teaches the unmistaken instructions to them, he is the master, which is Mañjuśrī himself.

original: tshogs rje zhes pa la tshogs ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: tshogs rje zhes pa la tshogs ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs te /
translated: As for lord of the assembly, the assembly is the assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyi rje bo ni tshogs rje'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rje bo ni tshogs rje'o //
translated: The lord of them is the lord of the assembly.

original: tshogs bdag ces pa ni /
analyzed: tshogs bdag ces pa ni /
translated: As for master of the assembly,

original: tshogs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: tshogs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs so //
translated: the assembly is the assembly of tathāgatas.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po ni rje bo ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po ni rje bo ste /
translated: The master of them is the lord.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the very nature of the mind of enlightenment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na dbang ldan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na dbang ldan te /
translated: For that very reason, he is powerful.

original: de dang de'i rang bzhin yang dag par bstan pa nyid kyis thams cad kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang de'i rang bzhin yang dag par bstan pa nyid kyis thams cad kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of all is taught by the teaching of the nature of each.

original: mthu chen gces pa 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: mthu chen gces pa 'dzin pa ste //
translated: He is the great power, the holder of the dear essence,

original: tshul chen gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog / ces pa ni /🔽de la mthu chen zhes pa ni //
analyzed: tshul chen gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog / ces pa ni / de la mthu chen zhes pa ni //
translated: the great method, not dependent on another.

original: che ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Here, the great power is the great self.

original: che ba yang de yin la mthu yang de nyid yin pas mthu chen no //
analyzed: che ba yang de yin la mthu yang de nyid yin pas mthu chen no //
translated: He is great and he is powerful, thus he is the great power.

original: gces pa 'dzin zhes pa ni gces pa ni legs pa'i chos 'dzin pa'o //🔽tshul chen ni chen po yang de yin la tshul yang de nyid yin pas tshul chen te /
analyzed: gces pa 'dzin zhes pa ni gces pa ni legs pa'i chos 'dzin pa'o // tshul chen ni chen po yang de yin la tshul yang de nyid yin pas tshul chen te /
translated: The holder of the dear essence is the holder of the dear Dharma.

original: thabs chen zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thabs chen zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The great method is the great method, the great means.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ni gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ni gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ste /
translated: Not dependent on another is not dependent on another,

original: chos zab mo la mos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos zab mo la mos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the very devotion to the profound Dharma.

original: de ltar yang mos pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgol ba gzhan rnams kyis dbrog par mi nus pas de ni gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang mos pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgol ba gzhan rnams kyis dbrog par mi nus pas de ni gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'o //
translated: Thus, because faith is primary, he is not led by others, for others cannot take away his faith.

original: tshig rje tshig bdag smra mkhas pa //
analyzed: tshig rje tshig bdag smra mkhas pa //
translated: He is the lord of speech, the master of speech,

original: tshig la dbang ba tshig mtha' yas //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: tshig la dbang ba tshig mtha' yas // zhes pa ni /
translated: the eloquent one, the one who has power over speech, the one with infinite speech.🔽He is the lord of speech, the master of speech, the eloquent one, the one who has power over speech, the one with infinite speech.

original: de la tshig rje ni tshig rnams kyi rje bo ni tshig rje ste /
analyzed: de la tshig rje ni tshig rnams kyi rje bo ni tshig rje ste /
translated: Here, the lord of speech is the master of speech.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has attained the analytical knowledge of the meaning of the teachings.

original: tshig bdag ni tshig kun gyi gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshig bdag ni tshig kun gyi gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The master of speech is the chief of all speech.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽smra mkhas pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro // smra mkhas pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has attained the analytical knowledge of the etymological explanations of the teachings.🔽The eloquent one is the one who has attained the analytical knowledge of the teachings.

original: tshig la dbang ba ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig la dbang ba ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who has power over speech is the one who has attained the analytical knowledge of ready speech.

original: sa legs pa'i blo gros la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas na chos brjod par mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sa legs pa'i blo gros la so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas na chos brjod par mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The one with good intellect, because he has attained the four correct knowledges, is called “skilled in expressing the Dharma.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshig mtha' yas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshig mtha' yas zhes gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, he is said to have “infinite speech.”

original: mtha' yas pa'i tshig gi dag dang ldan pa de ni tshig mtha' yas te /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i tshig gi dag dang ldan pa de ni tshig mtha' yas te /
translated: He who has infinite speech is one with infinite speech.

original: skad thams cad kyis sems can thams cad la ji ltar skal pa dang ldan pa nyid du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skad thams cad kyis sems can thams cad la ji ltar skal pa dang ldan pa nyid du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he turns the wheel of Dharma for all sentient beings in all languages, in accordance with their fortune.

original: tshig bden bden par smra ba ste //
analyzed: tshig bden bden par smra ba ste //
translated: He is the one with true speech, the one who speaks the truth,

original: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po // zhes pa ni /
translated: the one who teaches the four truths.

original: de la tshig bden pa ni bden pa gnyis te /🔽'di ltar kun rdzob kyis @56a * //
analyzed: de la tshig bden pa ni bden pa gnyis te / 'di ltar kun rdzob kyis @56a * //
translated: Here, true speech is the two truths:🔽the conventional truth

original: bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: and the ultimate truth.

original: de la kun rdzob la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the conventional is threefold:

original: brtags pa'i kun rdzob dang / shes pa'i kun rdzob dang / brjod pa'i kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: brtags pa'i kun rdzob dang / shes pa'i kun rdzob dang / brjod pa'i kun rdzob ste /
translated: the imagined conventional, the conventional of cognition, and the conventional of expression.

original: de rnams kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bden pa'o //
translated: They are the truths of those.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gcig pu yongs su grub pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gcig pu yongs su grub pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The ultimate truth should be understood as the one, the absolutely accomplished.

original: de yang don dam pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang don dam pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, the ultimate is threefold:

original: don dam pa dang / thob pa don dam pa dang / sgrub pa don dam pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa dang / thob pa don dam pa dang / sgrub pa don dam pa'o //
translated: the ultimate as object, the ultimate as attainment, and the ultimate as practice.

original: de la don don dam pa ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de la don don dam pa ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The ultimate as object is thusness,

original: dam pa'i ye shes kyi don zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: dam pa'i ye shes kyi don zhes bya bas so //
translated: because it is the object of the ultimate intuition.

original: thob pa don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: thob pa don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The ultimate as attainment is nirvana,

original: dam pa'i don zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: dam pa'i don zhes bya bas so //
translated: because it is the ultimate object.

original: sgrub pa don dam pa ni lam ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa don dam pa ni lam ste /
translated: The ultimate as practice is the path,

original: 'di don dam pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'di don dam pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: because it is the practice of the ultimate.

original: bden pa de gnyis la brten nas 'jug pa'i tshig de ni bden pa'i tshig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: bden pa de gnyis la brten nas 'jug pa'i tshig de ni bden pa'i tshig ces gsungs so //
translated: The words of one who engages in those two truths are called the words of truth.

original: de ltar yang dbu ma'i rtsa ba las 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang dbu ma'i rtsa ba las 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the noble Nagarjuna has said in the Mulamadhyamakakarika:🔽The teaching of the Dharma

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
translated: by all the Buddhas

original: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
translated: is based upon the two truths:

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The conventional truth of the world, and the truth of ultimate truth.🔽Those who do not know the distinction

original: gang dag bden pa de gnyis kyi //
analyzed: gang dag bden pa de gnyis kyi //
translated: between these two truths,

original: rnam dbye rnam par mi shes pa //
analyzed: rnam dbye rnam par mi shes pa //
translated: they do not know the profound reality

original: de yis sangs rgyas bstan pa yi //🔽zab mo'i de nyid rnam mi shes //
analyzed: de yis sangs rgyas bstan pa yi // zab mo'i de nyid rnam mi shes //
translated: taught by the Buddha.

original: zhes so // de yang bden par smra ba ste zhes pa ni bden pa ni yang dag pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes so // de yang bden par smra ba ste zhes pa ni bden pa ni yang dag pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, “speaking the truth” means that truth is the nature of authentic emptiness.

original: de ltar smra ba'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni bden par smra pa ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar smra ba'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni bden par smra pa ste zhes pa'o //
translated: Those who speak in this way are said to “speak the truth.”

original: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po //
translated: The teacher of the four truths

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: means

original: de la bden pa ni shes bya kun mdor bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid rnams te bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa ni shes bya kun mdor bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid rnams te bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: that the four truths are the characteristics that summarize all objects of knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni phung po la sogs pa la phyin ci log pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni phung po la sogs pa la phyin ci log pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The truth of suffering has the characteristic of error regarding the aggregates and so forth,

original: 'phags pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contrary to the noble ones.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni mdor bsdu na ji skad gsungs pa'i sdug bsngal nyid ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen nyid kyis bden pa ste /
