analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni mdor bsdu na ji skad gsungs pa'i sdug bsngal nyid ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen nyid kyis bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of origination is, in brief, the origination of the suffering just described, which is the truth of the conditions of ignorance, volition, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is a truth because it is the cause of suffering.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni ji lta ji ltar brtags pa'i chos thams cad ji ltar skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni ji lta ji ltar brtags pa'i chos thams cad ji ltar skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The truth of cessation is the Blessed One, because all phenomena, as they are and as they appear, are characterized by non-arising.

original: gti mug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen por gyur pa de rtogs pa yang lam gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen por gyur pa de rtogs pa yang lam gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of the path is the realization of that which is the antidote to the side of delusion.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su rdzogs par byed pa byams pa'i mthus gtong ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su rdzogs par byed pa byams pa'i mthus gtong ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is the perfection of complete enlightenment, which is generosity, etc., by the power of love.

original: @56b de rnams ston pa ni bden pa bzhi ston pa po'o //
analyzed: @56b de rnams ston pa ni bden pa bzhi ston pa po'o //
translated: The one who teaches those is the one who teaches the four noble truths.

original: phyir mi ldog pa phyir mi 'ong //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa phyir mi 'ong //
translated: The non-returner is the irreversible.

original: 'dren pa rang rgyal bse ru'i tshul //
analyzed: 'dren pa rang rgyal bse ru'i tshul //
translated: The leader is the rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddha.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning of the words.

original: de la phyir mi ldog pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la phyir mi ldog pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: One who is irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is called irreversible.🔽 Just as one who is irreversible from the śrāvaka stage is called irreversible, so too one who is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha is called irreversible.

original: ji ltar nyan thos kyi rigs ltar phyir mi ldog cing de la gsal bar byed pas na phyir mi ldog pa ste /🔽sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba la lung bstan pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos kyi rigs ltar phyir mi ldog cing de la gsal bar byed pas na phyir mi ldog pa ste / sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba la lung bstan pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha is called irreversible because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, and because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, one is called irreversible.🔽 One who is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha is called irreversible because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, and because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, one is called irreversible.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa de las gang zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu byang ba de ni phyir mi 'ong ba zhes gsungs so ;🔽/ de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni dad pa dang mthong bas thob pa de las gang zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu byang ba de ni phyir mi 'ong ba zhes gsungs so ; / de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: One who is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha is called irreversible because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, and because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, one is called irreversible.

original: 'dod pa'i rnam pa brgyad dang ni //🔽dgu pa yang ni zad pa yis //🔽lan cig phyir ni 'ong ba dang // gang zag phyir mi 'ong ba skye //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam pa brgyad dang ni // dgu pa yang ni zad pa yis // lan cig phyir ni 'ong ba dang // gang zag phyir mi 'ong ba skye //
translated: One who is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha is called irreversible because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, and because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, one is called irreversible.

original: zhes so // rang sangs rgyas ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes so // rang sangs rgyas ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: One who is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha is called irreversible because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, and because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, one is called irreversible.🔽 One who is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha is called irreversible because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, and because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, one is called irreversible.🔽 One who is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha is called irreversible because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, and because one is irreversible from the stage of a pratyekabuddha, one is called irreversible.

original: bse ru lta bur spyod pa dang / tshogs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bse ru lta bur spyod pa dang / tshogs na spyod pa'o //
translated: The rhinoceros-like and the congregating.

original: de la bse ru lta bu'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la bse ru lta bu'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: With regard to that, the rhinoceros-like is stated from the perspective of the rhinoceros-like.

original: bse ru zhes pa ni bse ru dang 'dra bas bse ru ste /🔽bse zhes pa ni sems can bse nyid de /
analyzed: bse ru zhes pa ni bse ru dang 'dra bas bse ru ste / bse zhes pa ni sems can bse nyid de /
translated: The rhinoceros-like is so called because it is like a rhinoceros.

original: de ni mgo la rva gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni mgo la rva gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: The rhinoceros is an animal that has only one horn on its head.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i phyir na sangs rgyas gcig pur ston pas bse ru'i tshul zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i phyir na sangs rgyas gcig pur ston pas bse ru'i tshul zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is like that, the Buddha taught the rhinoceros mode.

original: 'dren pa rang rgyal ni tshogs na spyod pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dren pa rang rgyal ni tshogs na spyod pa'o ;
translated: The leader, the solitary realizer, is the congregating.

original: / so so re rer gtso bo yin pas 'dren pa ste /
analyzed: / so so re rer gtso bo yin pas 'dren pa ste /
translated: The leader is so called because it is the principal of each one.

original: tshogs na spyod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs na spyod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the congregating because it is the congregating.

original: nges 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba //
analyzed: nges 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba //
translated: Arisen from various certain emergences,

original: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig po //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig po //
translated: the single cause of the great elements.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is stated.

original: de la / nges 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba //
analyzed: de la / nges 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba //
translated: With regard to that, arisen from various certain emergences.

original: zhes pa la nges 'byung sna tshogs ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes pa la nges 'byung sna tshogs ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o ;
translated: Various certain emergences are the nirvāṇa of śrāvakas and so on.

original: / de rnams kyis nges par 'byung bas na nges 'byung ste /🔽gang zhig gdul bya'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud la de'i gzugs su 'byung ba so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig po //
analyzed: / de rnams kyis nges par 'byung bas na nges 'byung ste / gang zhig gdul bya'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud la de'i gzugs su 'byung ba so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro // 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig po //
translated: They are called “elements” because they are the causes of the world.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: They are called “great” because they are the causes of the world.

original: de la 'byung ba ni sa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba ni sa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The elements are the four: earth, water, fire, and air.🔽Space is also an element, so there are five elements.

original: nam mkha' yang 'byung ba chen po nyid kyi phyir na 'byung ba chen po lnga yin pa las bzhi zhes gsungs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang 'byung ba chen po nyid kyi phyir na 'byung ba chen po lnga yin pa las bzhi zhes gsungs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are only four mentioned?

original: de rnams ni chen po yang yin la 'byung ba yang yin pas 'byung ba chen po ste /🔽nam mkha'i yul dang phyogs la rgyas par mnan nas gnas pa'i phyir na sa'i khams la sogs pa chen po nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams ni chen po yang yin la 'byung ba yang yin pas 'byung ba chen po ste / nam mkha'i yul dang phyogs la rgyas par mnan nas gnas pa'i phyir na sa'i khams la sogs pa chen po nyid do //
translated: They are called “great” because they are elements and great.🔽The earth element and the others are great because they are extended in the sense of pervading the regions of space.

original: yang sa'i khams @57a * //
analyzed: yang sa'i khams @57a * //
translated: The earth element is the cause of the world in the sense that it is the support of the world.🔽The water element is the cause of the world in the sense that it is the support of the world.🔽The fire element is the cause of the world in the sense that it ripens the world.🔽The air element is the cause of the world in the sense that it moves the world.🔽Space is the cause of the world in the sense that it does not obstruct the world.

original: la sogs pa bzhi po de rnams ni thun mong ma yin pa'i las kyi khyad par las 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir na 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: la sogs pa bzhi po de rnams ni thun mong ma yin pa'i las kyi khyad par las 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir na 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: The four elements and so on are called “great” because they are the special causes of the uncommon actions of the body, speech, and mind.

original: de bas nam mkha' ni chen po nyid du yod de /
analyzed: de bas nam mkha' ni chen po nyid du yod de /
translated: Therefore, space exists as a great element,

original: gzugs thams cad skye ba'i go 'byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad skye ba'i go 'byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the arising of all forms.

original: 'byung ba nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not an element,

original: 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gang gi phyir 'byung ba'i don ni dngos po'i don yin pas na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gang gi phyir 'byung ba'i don ni dngos po'i don yin pas na /
translated: because it is unconditioned, and because the meaning of “element” is the meaning of “thing.”

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, space is not a great element.

original: de'i phyir na 'byung ba chen po ni bzhi kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'byung ba chen po ni bzhi kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, there are only four great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag ni rgyu ste byed rgyu gcig bu gnyis su med pa gang yin pa de ni de la de ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po de dag ni rgyu ste byed rgyu gcig bu gnyis su med pa gang yin pa de ni de la de ltar gsungs so //
translated: The four great elements are the cause, the single cause, the non-dual cause, and that is said to be so.

original: dge slong dgra bcom zad pa zad /
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom zad pa zad /
translated: “Bhikṣus, the arhat is exhausted, exhausted,

original: 'dod chags bral bas dbang po thul //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral bas dbang po thul //
translated: free from desire, with faculties subdued.”

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is said.

original: de la dge slong ni chos mngon pa las dge slong bzhi brjod de /
analyzed: de la dge slong ni chos mngon pa las dge slong bzhi brjod de /
translated: There are four kinds of monks:

original: 'di lta ste ming gi dge slong dang / slong ba'i dge slong dang / bcas pa'i dge slong dang // don dam pa'i dge slong ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste ming gi dge slong dang / slong ba'i dge slong dang / bcas pa'i dge slong dang // don dam pa'i dge slong ngo //
translated: the nominal monk, the monk in asking, the monk in the precepts, and the ultimate monk.

original: bzhi po de rnams las 'di ni don dam pa'i dge slong ste /
analyzed: bzhi po de rnams las 'di ni don dam pa'i dge slong ste /
translated: From among these four, he is the ultimate monk,

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / bdud thams cad kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / bdud thams cad kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is free from the afflictions and because he is not divided by any demon.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes pa ni dgra ni nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes pa ni dgra ni nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: An arhat is one who has destroyed the enemies, where the enemies are the afflictions.

original: de rnams bcom pa dang ldan pas na dgra bcom pa'o //🔽'khor bar slar nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: de rnams bcom pa dang ldan pas na dgra bcom pa'o // 'khor bar slar nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid kyis sam /
translated: He is called an arhat because he possesses the destruction of those.🔽He is called a worthy one because he is worthy to enjoy the necessities of life that others have offered, due to his nature of not falling back into cyclic existence,

original: don ma lus par yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gzhan rnams la rjes su ston par byed pa 'os par nus pa zhes pas sam /
analyzed: don ma lus par yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gzhan rnams la rjes su ston par byed pa 'os par nus pa zhes pas sam /
translated: or because he is worthy to teach others, due to his ability to perfect his own aims,

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog tu 'os pa zhes pas sam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dkon mchog tu 'os pa zhes pas sam /
translated: or because he is worthy of worship as the jewel of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: khams gsum gyi gtso bo rnams kyis rnam pa du mas mchod par bya bar 'os pa zhes pas sam /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi gtso bo rnams kyis rnam pa du mas mchod par bya bar 'os pa zhes pas sam /
translated: They are worthy of the many kinds of offerings made to them by the chief beings of the three worlds.

original: bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la sgrub pa'i mchod par 'os pa'i phyir na dgra bcom pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la sgrub pa'i mchod par 'os pa'i phyir na dgra bcom pa zhes bshad de /
translated: Or else, they are called arhats because they are worthy of the offering of practice to the unsurpassed tathagatas.

original: bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: They are bhagavans.

original: zag pa zad pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa zhes pa ni /
translated: They have exhausted defilement.

original: de la mi dge ba'i chos kyi rtsa ba bzhi ni zag cing skye bar byed pa'i phyir ram //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i chos kyi rtsa ba bzhi ni zag cing skye bar byed pa'i phyir ram //
translated: The four roots of nonvirtue are defilements and give rise to birth.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnag zag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnag zag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, they are called the defilements of the pus of affliction.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo nas bzung nas ji tsam mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas sems can rnams nyon mongs par byed /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo nas bzung nas ji tsam mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas sems can rnams nyon mongs par byed /
translated: From the peak of existence down to the lowest hell, they afflict sentient beings through the wounds of the six sense bases.

original: gnod par byed pas nyon mongs pa'i zag pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnod par byed pas nyon mongs pa'i zag pa rnams so //
translated: They harm them, so they are the defilements of affliction.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga dang / ma rig pa dang lhan cig skyes @57b pa dang kun du brtags pa las byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su brtags pa nyid dang / lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis rnams ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga dang / ma rig pa dang lhan cig skyes @57b pa dang kun du brtags pa las byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su brtags pa nyid dang / lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis rnams ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The five objects such as form, the nature of the imagination that arises from the innate and the imagined ignorance, and the sixty-two views are called ignorance.

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: The impurities of desire, the impurities of existence, the impurities of ignorance, and the impurities of views are taught.

original: mi slob pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung pos ni 'dod pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung pos ni 'dod pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: The aggregate of morality and the aggregate of concentration of the nonlearner eliminate the impurity of desire.

original: mi slob pa'i shes rab kyi phung pos ni lta ba'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i shes rab kyi phung pos ni lta ba'i zag pa zad do //
translated: The aggregate of wisdom of the nonlearner eliminates the impurity of views.

original: mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i phung pos ni srid pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i phung pos ni srid pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: The aggregate of liberation of the nonlearner eliminates the impurity of existence.

original: mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi phung pos ni ma rig pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi phung pos ni ma rig pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: The aggregate of the wisdom of liberation of the nonlearner eliminates the impurity of ignorance.

original: tshul khrims yongs su rdzogs ba'i sa la 'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su rdzogs ba'i sa la 'am /
translated: The stage of the perfection of morality

original: mthong ba'i sa la yang dag par lta bas ni lta ba'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa la yang dag par lta bas ni lta ba'i zag pa zad do //
translated: On the path of seeing, the defilement of views is destroyed by right view.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i sa la'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i sa la'am /
translated: On the stage of perfection of concentration,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i lam la yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'dod pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i lam la yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'dod pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: or on the path of non-returning, the defilement of desire is destroyed by right concentration.

original: shes rab yongs su rdzogs pa'i sa la'am /
analyzed: shes rab yongs su rdzogs pa'i sa la'am /
translated: On the stage of perfection of wisdom,

original: dgra bcom pa'i lam la yang dag pa'i rnam par grol bas ni ma rig pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i lam la yang dag pa'i rnam par grol bas ni ma rig pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: or on the path of the perfected being, the defilement of ignorance is destroyed by right liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i sa la'am /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i sa la'am /
translated: On the stage of perfection of liberation,

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes gnyis kyis srid pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes gnyis kyis srid pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: or on the path of the perfected being, the defilement of existence is destroyed by the two knowledges of exhaustion and of non-arising.

original: dgra bcom pa'i lam la 'am //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i lam la 'am //
translated: On the path of the perfected being,

original: 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir na 'dod pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir na 'dod pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: the defilement of desire is destroyed by the complete knowledge of the defilements of desire.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po yongs su shes pa'i phyir na ma rig pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po yongs su shes pa'i phyir na ma rig pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: The defilement of ignorance is destroyed by the complete knowledge of the aggregate of formations.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because formations are conditioned by ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phung po yongs su shes pa'i phyir na lta ba'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phung po yongs su shes pa'i phyir na lta ba'i zag pa zad do //
translated: Because the mass of afflictions is fully understood, the defilement of views is exhausted.

original: phung po'i rdzas yongs su shes pa'i phyir na srid pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: phung po'i rdzas yongs su shes pa'i phyir na srid pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: Because the substance of the aggregates is fully understood, the defilement of existence is exhausted.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir na lta ba'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir na lta ba'i zag pa zad do //
translated: Because the truth of suffering is fully understood, the defilement of views is exhausted.

original: lta ba thams cad nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: All views focus on the five aggregates that are appropriated.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir na 'dod pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir na 'dod pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: Because the truth of suffering and the truth of origination are all abandoned, the defilement of desire is exhausted.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du byas pa'i phyir na srid pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du byas pa'i phyir na srid pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: Because the truth of cessation is actualized, the defilement of existence is exhausted.

original: lam gyi bden pa bsgoms pa nyid kyis ma rig pa'i zag pa zad do //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa bsgoms pa nyid kyis ma rig pa'i zag pa zad do //
translated: By cultivating the truth of the path itself, the defilement of ignorance is exhausted.

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa spangs pa'i phyir na lha'i bu'i bdud bcom par gyur to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa spangs pa'i phyir na lha'i bu'i bdud bcom par gyur to //
translated: Because the defilement of desire is abandoned, the māra of the sons of the gods is conquered.

original: srid pa'i zag pa zad pa'i phyir na 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom @58a * //🔽par gyur to //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa zad pa'i phyir na 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom @58a * //🔽par gyur to //
translated: Because the defilement of existence is exhausted, the māra of the lord of death is conquered.

original: ma rig pa spangs pa'i phyir na nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom par gyur to //
analyzed: ma rig pa spangs pa'i phyir na nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom par gyur to //
translated: Because he has abandoned ignorance, he has conquered the demon of the afflictions.

original: lta ba'i zag pa zad pa'i phyir na phung po'i bdud bcom par gyur to //
analyzed: lta ba'i zag pa zad pa'i phyir na phung po'i bdud bcom par gyur to //
translated: Because he has exhausted the outflows of views, he has conquered the demon of the aggregates.

original: bdud bzhi las mchog tu rgyal bas bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ni zag pa zad do zhes so //
analyzed: bdud bzhi las mchog tu rgyal bas bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ni zag pa zad do zhes so //
translated: Since he has triumphed over the four demons, the Blessed One Mañjuśrī has exhausted the outflows.

original: de'i phyir zag pa 'di dag zad pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa 'di dag zad pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is what is meant by the exhaustion of these outflows.

original: 'dod chags bral ba zhes pa 'dis ni khams gsum na kun du gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu drug gi dbye bas nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis spangs pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba zhes pa 'dis ni khams gsum na kun du gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu drug gi dbye bas nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis spangs pa'i phyir
translated: Here, “free from desire” means that he is free from the afflictions that abide in the three realms, because he has abandoned the ninety-eight afflictions through the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, which are divided into sixteen aspects of the four noble truths.

original: / 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he is said to be “free from desire.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir na dbang po thul zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na dbang po thul zhes pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is said to be “one who has subdued the senses,”

original: spyod yul thams cad kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod yul thams cad kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is not overwhelmed by any object.

original: bde ba rnyed pas 'jigs med thob //
analyzed: bde ba rnyed pas 'jigs med thob //
translated: He has attained bliss, and so is fearless.

original: bsil bar gyur pas rnyog pa med //🔽ces pa ni /
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pas rnyog pa med // ces pa ni /
translated: He has attained coolness, and so is free of turbidity.

original: de la bde ba rnyed pa ni bde ba ni lus kyi las te /
analyzed: de la bde ba rnyed pa ni bde ba ni lus kyi las te /
translated: Here, “bliss” is physical action.

original: de rnyed pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnyed pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba rnyed pa'o //
translated: “Attaining” it is attaining bliss.

original: 'jigs pa ni skrag pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni skrag pa ste /
translated: “Fear” is terror.

original: gang la de med pa ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la de med pa ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: He who is without it is fearless.

original: 'jigs pa med pa ngag gi las te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa ngag gi las te /
translated: Fearlessness is verbal action.

original: ngag gi las kyi tshig thams cad skyon med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag gi las kyi tshig thams cad skyon med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all verbal actions are faultless.

original: ngag gi las thob pa ni 'jigs med thob pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi las thob pa ni 'jigs med thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of verbal action is the attainment of fearlessness.

original: bsil bar gyur pa ni 'dis bsil ba ste /
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pa ni 'dis bsil ba ste /
translated: “Coolness” is coolness through this.

original: zhi ba nyid kyis bdag nyid sems g-yo ba las thams cad med par gzigs te /
analyzed: zhi ba nyid kyis bdag nyid sems g-yo ba las thams cad med par gzigs te /
translated: Through peace, he sees the absence of all movement of the mind.

original: dang po 'dod chags la sogs pas zil gyis gnon par gyur la phyis de spangs pa'i phyir na bsil bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dang po 'dod chags la sogs pas zil gyis gnon par gyur la phyis de spangs pa'i phyir na bsil bar gyur pa'o //
translated: At first, he was overcome by desire and so forth, but later, because he abandoned them, he became cool.

original: de nyid kyis lus ngag yid skyo ba med pa'i phyir na rnyog pa med ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis lus ngag yid skyo ba med pa'i phyir na rnyog pa med ces gsungs so //
translated: Because of that, he is free of the turbidity of body, speech, and mind.

original: rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan //
analyzed: rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan //
translated: He is endowed with knowledge and feet.

original: bde gshegs 'jig rten rig pa'i mchog / ces pa la /
analyzed: bde gshegs 'jig rten rig pa'i mchog / ces pa la /
translated: The Well-Gone is the supreme knower of the world.

original: de la rig pa dang rkang par ldan ni /
analyzed: de la rig pa dang rkang par ldan ni /
translated: He is endowed with knowledge and feet.

original: des ni ye shes sems dpa' de ston pa phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i rgyu ston par byed de /🔽rig pa dang rkang pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad las yang dag pa'i lta ba ni rig pa ste /
analyzed: des ni ye shes sems dpa' de ston pa phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i rgyu ston par byed de / rig pa dang rkang pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad las yang dag pa'i lta ba ni rig pa ste /
translated: This shows that the wisdom being has attained the cause of the perfect teacher.🔽Knowledge and feet are the eightfold noble path.

original: yan lag gzhan ni rkang pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag gzhan ni rkang pa'o //
translated: Right view is knowledge, and the other limbs are feet.

original: ma mthong zhing rkang pa med na 'gro bar mi nus zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: ma mthong zhing rkang pa med na 'gro bar mi nus zhes bya bas so //
translated: Without seeing and without feet, one cannot go.

original: bslab pa gsum ni rig pa dang / rkang pa ste /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum ni rig pa dang / rkang pa ste /
translated: The three trainings are knowledge and feet.

original: lhag pa shes rab kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa @58b sems kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa shes rab kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa @58b sems kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: The training in higher wisdom, the training in higher morality, and the training in higher mind.

original: de la shes rab ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab ni rig pa'o //
translated: Among those, wisdom is knowledge.

original: gnyis ni rkang pa'o //🔽shes rab kyis sngon du byas nas bskyod pa ni rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni rkang pa'o // shes rab kyis sngon du byas nas bskyod pa ni rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The other two are feet.🔽Having been preceded by wisdom, movement is called feet.

original: rig pa sngon du gzung ngo //
analyzed: rig pa sngon du gzung ngo //
translated: Knowledge is taken as foremost.

original: de yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: and the purity of his morality and concentration.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi spyan nyid kyis bltas nas tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin rkang pa dang 'dra bas 'di dag gis 'gro zhing bgrod par bya bas mthun par bslabs pas na rig pa dang / rkang pa'i sgras bslab pa gsum nges par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi spyan nyid kyis bltas nas tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin rkang pa dang 'dra bas 'di dag gis 'gro zhing bgrod par bya bas mthun par bslabs pas na rig pa dang / rkang pa'i sgras bslab pa gsum nges par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having seen with the eye of wisdom, he trains in the three trainings, which are like feet, since one goes and proceeds by means of them.

original: de'i phyir rig pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas /🔽rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan //
analyzed: de'i phyir rig pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas / rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan //
translated: Therefore, he is endowed with the three knowledges and so forth.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is endowed with knowledge and feet.

original: bde gshegs zhes bya ba des kyang ji ltar bgrod par bya ba dang / 'gro ba la ston te /
analyzed: bde gshegs zhes bya ba des kyang ji ltar bgrod par bya ba dang / 'gro ba la ston te /
translated: The word “sugata” also shows how one goes and where one goes.

original: shin tu legs par 'gro bas bder gshegs te /
analyzed: shin tu legs par 'gro bas bder gshegs te /
translated: He is a sugata because he goes well.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i don gyis na ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i don gyis na ste /
translated: He is a sugata because he goes irreversibly.

original: dper na tsha ba'i nad shin tu byang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tsha ba'i nad shin tu byang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, he is like a person who has completely recovered from a fever.

original: yang na lus pa med par gshegs pas na bder gshegs te /
analyzed: yang na lus pa med par gshegs pas na bder gshegs te /
translated: Or, he is a sugata because he goes without remainder.

original: shes bya ma lus par shes pa'i don gyis na ste /
analyzed: shes bya ma lus par shes pa'i don gyis na ste /
translated: Because of the meaning of knowing all objects of knowledge without exception,

original: dper na bum pa legs par gang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa legs par gang ba bzhin no //
translated: like a pot that is completely full.

original: don de gnyis ni phyi rol pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du gyur pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: don de gnyis ni phyi rol pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du gyur pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: These two meanings are superior to non-Buddhists and śrāvakas, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyi rol pa ni mthar thug par gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa ni mthar thug par gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: Non-Buddhists do not go to the ultimate,

original: phyir ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they turn back.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i skal pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir mthar thug par song ba yin kyang ma lus par song ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i skal pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir mthar thug par song ba yin kyang ma lus par song ba ma yin te /
translated: Śrāvakas, etc., though they go to the ultimate because they are endowed with the fortune of ordinary beings, they do not go without exception,

original: shes bya thams cad la ye shes thogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la ye shes thogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their wisdom is obstructed with regard to all objects of knowledge.

original: de ltar rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa dang / legs par dang / ma lus par gshegs pa ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa' yin zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa dang / legs par dang / ma lus par gshegs pa ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa' yin zhes ston pa'o //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, the wisdom being, is the perfect teacher, who is endowed with knowledge and feet, who goes well and without exception.

original: ston pa de'i phrin las ni /
analyzed: ston pa de'i phrin las ni /
translated: The activity of that teacher is as follows:

original: 'jig rten rig pa'i mchog ces pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa'i mchog ces pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: The two phrases “supreme knowledge of the world” and “realizer of the world” indicate this.

original: de yang ston pa'i las rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang ston pa'i las rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Teacher’s activity is twofold:

original: skal pa dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i 'jig rten la gzigs pa dang / skal ba dang ldan pa 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: skal pa dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i 'jig rten la gzigs pa dang / skal ba dang ldan pa 'dul ba'o //
translated: he sees the world, which is fortunate and unfortunate, and he guides the fortunate.

original: de la 'jig rten rig pa zhes pa des ni skal ba dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i 'jig rten la gzigs pa ston to //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten rig pa zhes pa des ni skal ba dang ldan pa dang / skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i 'jig rten la gzigs pa ston to //
translated: The phrase “supreme knowledge of the world” indicates that he sees the world, which is fortunate and unfortunate.

original: 'jig rten rtogs pa ni 'jig rten rig pas te /🔽skal ba dang ldan pa dang skal pa dang mi ldan pa'i @59a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtogs pa ni 'jig rten rig pas te / skal ba dang ldan pa dang skal pa dang mi ldan pa'i @59a * //
translated: “Realizer of the world” means that he has supreme knowledge of the world.

original: 'jig rten yongs su shes pa'i phyir na de ni 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten yongs su shes pa'i phyir na de ni 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he knows the world, which is fortunate and unfortunate, he is called “supreme knowledge of the world.”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du shes rab kyi spyan gyis gzigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du shes rab kyi spyan gyis gzigs te /
translated: the Bhagavat Mañjuśrī sees with the eye of wisdom three times in the day and three times at night.

original: su ni rgud /
analyzed: su ni rgud /
translated: He sees who is declining,

original: su ni 'byor /
analyzed: su ni 'byor /
translated: who is prospering,

original: su ni ngan song la gzhol /
analyzed: su ni ngan song la gzhol /
translated: who is heading for the lower realms,🔽and who is heading for the higher realms.

original: gang zhig ngan song las bton te mtho ris dang thar pa 'di la gzhag / gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskrun pa de bskrun par bya ba dang / gang dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / gang yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ngan song las bton te mtho ris dang thar pa 'di la gzhag / gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskrun pa de bskrun par bya ba dang / gang dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / gang yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: who has not matured, those are to be brought to maturity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na mchog ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na mchog ste /
translated: Therefore, it is supreme.

original: dam pa ni bcom ldan 'di'o //
analyzed: dam pa ni bcom ldan 'di'o //
translated: The highest is this Blessed One.

original: bdag gir mi 'dzin ngar mi 'dzin //🔽bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
analyzed: bdag gir mi 'dzin ngar mi 'dzin // bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
translated: He does not grasp as mine, does not grasp as I.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: He abides in the mode of the two truths.

original: de la bdag gir mi 'dzin pa zhes pa'i tshig des ni gzung ba'i phyogs bkag pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gir mi 'dzin pa zhes pa'i tshig des ni gzung ba'i phyogs bkag pa'o //
translated: Here, the words does not grasp as mine negate the position of the object.

original: ngar mi 'dzin zhes bya ba des kyang 'dzin pa'i phyogs bkag pa ste /
analyzed: ngar mi 'dzin zhes bya ba des kyang 'dzin pa'i phyogs bkag pa ste /
translated: Does not grasp as I also negates the position of the subject.

original: de gnyis kyang log par so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang log par so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those two are also individually perceived as false.

original: de ltar 'phags pa klu sgrub snying po'i zhabs kyis rin po che'i phreng ba las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa klu sgrub snying po'i zhabs kyis rin po che'i phreng ba las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the noble Nāgārjuna’s Precious Garland says:

original: bdag dang bdag gi gnyis ka yang //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi gnyis ka yang //
translated: Both the self and “mine”🔽are ultimately unreal.

original: don dam par ni 'di dag log / yang dag ji bzhin yongs shes pas //
analyzed: don dam par ni 'di dag log / yang dag ji bzhin yongs shes pas //
translated: Because of the complete understanding of reality,

original: gang phyir gnyi ga med pas so //🔽zhes so // bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
analyzed: gang phyir gnyi ga med pas so // zhes so // bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
translated: both are nonexistent.

original: zhes pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “abiding in the mode of the two truths” has been explained.

original: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
translated: Having gone to the end of the far shore of saṃsāra,

original: bya ba byas pa skam sar gnas //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa skam sar gnas //
translated: the one who has done what had to be done remains on dry land.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de la / 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
analyzed: de la / 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
translated: “Having gone to the end of the far shore of saṃsāra”

original: zhes des 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: zhes des 'di ltar ston te /
translated: teaches this.

original: 'khor ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Saṃsāra is the nature of things,

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyis 'brel zhing 'gro ba dag tu 'gro zhing song la /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyis 'brel zhing 'gro ba dag tu 'gro zhing song la /
translated: because it is the five appropriated aggregates. Since the five appropriated aggregates are related to afflictions and karma, they go to the realms, have gone, and will go.

original: 'gro bar byed pas na 'khor ba pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pas na 'khor ba pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, they are called “those in saṃsāra.”

original: 'khor ba ni tshu rol /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni tshu rol /
translated: Samsara is this shore.

original: de'i pha rol ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de'i pha rol ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Nirvana is the other shore.

original: de'ang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo'o //🔽'khor ba dang pha rol ni 'khor ba dang pha rol gnyis te /
analyzed: de'ang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo'o // 'khor ba dang pha rol ni 'khor ba dang pha rol gnyis te /
translated: And that is the nature of non-entity.🔽Samsara and the other shore are samsara and nirvana.

original: de gnyis kyi mtha' ni 'khor ba dang pha rol gyi mtha'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi mtha' ni 'khor ba dang pha rol gyi mtha'o //
translated: The limit of those two is the limit of samsara and nirvana.

original: de la gnas pas na 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pas na 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa'o //
translated: One who abides in that has gone to the other shore of samsara.

original: des 'di gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des 'di gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what he says:

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gnyis la bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal de ni kun rdzob tu @59b gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gnyis la bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal de ni kun rdzob tu @59b gnas pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One, Manjusri, abides in the nature of entity and non-entity conventionally,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de gnyis kyi chos phra ba nyid kyang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi chos phra ba nyid kyang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even the subtle attributes of those two are not perceived.

original: de ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: mya ngan las 'das mtha' ma gang /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das mtha' ma gang /
translated: The limit of nirvana is not one thing,

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' ma de nyid de //🔽de gnyis bye brag 'ga' zhig kyang //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' ma de nyid de // de gnyis bye brag 'ga' zhig kyang //
translated: and the limit of samsara is not another.🔽There is not even the slightest

original: shin tu phra ba yang med do //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba yang med do //
translated: distinction between those two.

original: zhes so // bya ba byas zhes pa ni gdon mi za bar bya ba ni bya ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes so // bya ba byas zhes pa ni gdon mi za bar bya ba ni bya ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: The phrase “having done what had to be done” means that what had to be done without fail has been done.

original: de la tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yongs su bsags pas sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par grol ba ni las kyi gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yongs su bsags pas sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par grol ba ni las kyi gtso bo ste /
translated: Therein, the principal action is the complete liberation from all suffering through the accumulation of morality, meditative concentration, and wisdom.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pas na bya ba byas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pas na bya ba byas zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since that is completed, it is said that “what had to be done has been done.”

original: 'dod pa chung bas 'jug pa dang / yan lag bsdams pas 'jug pa dang / yang dag par chags par bya ba bsdams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdams pa'i khyad par rnams rdzogs par bya ba ni byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung bas 'jug pa dang / yan lag bsdams pas 'jug pa dang / yang dag par chags par bya ba bsdams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdams pa'i khyad par rnams rdzogs par bya ba ni byas pa ste /
translated: The completion of the restraint that is described as “the restraint of few desires,” “the restraint of being content with what one has,” “the restraint of being guarded in one’s limbs,” and “the restraint of being guarded in one’s faculties” is the action that has been done.
